analyzed: gang dag gi pho mtshan chad pa de dag ni pho mtshan chad pa dag yin te /

analyzed: ngal ba ni chad pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir las chung zad kyang mi bzod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Tire” is a synonym for “wear out.” Therefore, “cannot endure even a little work” means “cannot do even a little work.”

original: sha mdog kha dog rnam bzhi dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sha mdog kha dog rnam bzhi dang // zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: sha mdog sngo ches pa dang / sha mdog ser ches pa dang / sha mdog dkar ches pa dang dmar ba dag ste /

original: smad par bya ba'i sha mdog de dag dgag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: smad par bya ba'i sha mdog de dag dgag pa yin gyi /
translated: These are the complexions that are despised.

analyzed: lha rnams kyi gzugs mdzes pa lta bu dag ni ma gtogs so //
translated: But the beautiful complexions of the gods are not included.

original: gyol po zhes bya ba ni rkang yon dag go //
analyzed: gyol po zhes bya ba ni rkang yon dag go //
translated: “Cripple” means lame.

original: yang na rkang pa sa la 'chal zhing 'gro ba dag go //
analyzed: yang na rkang pa sa la 'chal zhing 'gro ba dag go //
translated: Or else, they walk with their feet dragging on the ground.

analyzed: gang dag gi rkang pa gnyis ha cang gdangs te 'gro ba de dag ni lus nyams pa dag yin no //

analyzed: yang na gang gi rkang pa gnyis gcig gi steng du gcig 'dor zhing 'gro ba de dag ni lus nyams pa dag yin no //
translated: Or else, those whose two feet are placed one on top of the other as they walk are physically impaired.

original: rnam pa de lta bu dag gi dgag pa de yang rab tu gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu dag gi dgag pa de yang rab tu gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: lag rdum la sogs pa'i dgag pa 'ba' zhig rab tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lag rdum la sogs pa'i dgag pa 'ba' zhig rab tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin gyi /

analyzed: 'di ltar skra ser ba la sogs pa rnam pa de lta bu dag gi dgag pa de yang rab tu bsgrims te gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the prohibition of those who are of such a type, such as those with yellow hair, etc. should also be strictly observed.

analyzed: de ltar re zhig rnam pa de lta bu dag rab tu dbyung bar mi bya rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya'o zhes bstan nas /

original: da ni rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen na yang bsdu bar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen na yang bsdu bar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that even if they are fully ordained, they should not be admitted,

original: rigs dang lus la skyon chags pa rab tu dbyung ba ni nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rigs dang lus la skyon chags pa rab tu dbyung ba ni nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said: “One with a physical or family flaw should not be admitted.”

original: rigs la skyon chags pa ni lham mkhan la sogs pa zan bza' bar mi bya ba dag go //
analyzed: rigs la skyon chags pa ni lham mkhan la sogs pa zan bza' bar mi bya ba dag go //
translated: One with a family flaw is one whose family is not fit to eat food, such as a cobbler.

original: lus la skyon chags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: lus la skyon chags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: One with a physical flaw is of two types:

original: dbyibs las dang / kha dog las so //
analyzed: dbyibs las dang / kha dog las so //
translated: flawed in shape and flawed in color.

original: de la dbyibs las skyon chags pa ni lag rdum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbyibs las skyon chags pa ni lag rdum la sogs pa'o //
translated: One flawed in shape is one with a crippled arm and so on.

original: kha dog las skyon chags pa ni lus rma mtshan can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog las skyon chags pa ni lus rma mtshan can la sogs pa'o //
translated: One flawed in color is one with a body marked by sores and so on.

original: de dag ni 'dir gnas sbyin pa 'ba' zhig bkag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dir gnas sbyin pa 'ba' zhig bkag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, not only is the giving of a residence prohibited,🔽but also

original: 'di ltar gnas khang la sogs pa dag tu skabs dbye ba dang rjes su 'brang ba'i 'khor nyid dang phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong du bsgrubs pa la sogs pa yang bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas khang la sogs pa dag tu skabs dbye ba dang rjes su 'brang ba'i 'khor nyid dang phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong du bsgrubs pa la sogs pa yang bkag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Buddha prohibited monks from keeping a retinue of followers, from keeping a following of śramaṇas, and so on.

original: de ltar na gzhung las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhung las kyang gsungs te /
translated: The scriptures also state:

original: dge slong gis sun 'byin pa'i 'khor nye bar gzhag par mi bya ste /🔽nye bar 'jog par gyur na 'gal @39a * //
analyzed: dge slong gis sun 'byin pa'i 'khor nye bar gzhag par mi bya ste / nye bar 'jog par gyur na 'gal @39a * //
translated: A bhikṣu should not keep a retinue that is a cause of corruption.

original: tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs nas /
translated: If he does so, he will be in violation.

original: ji tsam gyis na 'khor sun 'byin pa'i 'khor yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na 'khor sun 'byin pa'i 'khor yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one describe a retinue that is a cause of corruption?

original: rigs las dang kha dog dang dbyibs las te /
analyzed: rigs las dang kha dog dang dbyibs las te /
translated: From the point of view of caste, occupation, complexion, and shape.

original: ji ltar rigs las she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs las she na /
translated: How from the point of view of caste?

original: lham mkhan dang gdol ba dang g-yung po'i rigs las so ;
analyzed: lham mkhan dang gdol ba dang g-yung po'i rigs las so ;
translated: From the point of view of the castes of cobbler, caṇḍāla, and púkayas.

original: / ji ltar kha dog dang dbyibs las she na /
analyzed: / ji ltar kha dog dang dbyibs las she na /
translated: How from the point of view of complexion and shape?

original: skra ser la sogs pa zhes 'dir smras pa dag las so //
analyzed: skra ser la sogs pa zhes 'dir smras pa dag las so //
translated: From the point of view of those who have yellow hair and so on.

original: ji mang po dag tshig gcig gis cig car rdzogs par bsnyen par byar rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ji mang po dag tshig gcig gis cig car rdzogs par bsnyen par byar rung ngam zhe na /
translated: Is it proper to approach many with a single statement?

original: de'i phyir du ma mkhan po gcig la gsum man chad tshig gcig gis rdzogs par bsnyen par byar rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ma mkhan po gcig la gsum man chad tshig gcig gis rdzogs par bsnyen par byar rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For that purpose, it is proper to approach three or more with a single statement to a single preceptor.

original: du ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Many means

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'o //
translated: those to be approached.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhi che na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhi che na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: mkhan po gcig pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mkhan po gcig pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: A single preceptor.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba du ma mkhan po gcig pa ni du ma mkhan po gcig pa ste de'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba du ma mkhan po gcig pa ni du ma mkhan po gcig pa ste de'o //
translated: Many to be approached with a single preceptor is many with a single preceptor.

original: du ma zhes bya ba de la ji tsam gyis du mar brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: du ma zhes bya ba de la ji tsam gyis du mar brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: How many are called many?

original: gsum man chad ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gsum man chad ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Three or more.

original: gsum man chad cig car rdzogs par bsnyen par byar rung gi de las lhag pa ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsum man chad cig car rdzogs par bsnyen par byar rung gi de las lhag pa ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is proper to approach three or more simultaneously. It is improper to approach more than that.

original: lung las kyang /
analyzed: lung las kyang /
translated: Also, a scripture says,

original: tshogs kyis tshogs kyi las dag mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyis tshogs kyi las dag mi bya'o //
translated: A group should not perform the actions of a group.

original: zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs la /
translated: And:

original: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang /
translated: The Upalipariprﬁccha-sūtra says,

original: btsun pa dus gcig skad cig gcig la las byed pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig gi las gnyis bgyi ba dang bgyis par brjod pa dang / dge 'dun yang des 'gal tshabs can du mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dus gcig skad cig gcig la las byed pa gcig gis gsol ba gcig gi las gnyis bgyi ba dang bgyis par brjod pa dang / dge 'dun yang des 'gal tshabs can du mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: “Reverend, is it possible for a single monk to perform a single action in a single instant that is both a karmic action and a karmic action that has been done, and for the Saṅgha not to be split?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de gal te las byed pa'i dge slong gis mkhan bo rnams dang rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa rnams kyi ming yongs su brjod nus shing gsol ba nyams bar mi 'gyur la las kyang byed na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de gal te las byed pa'i dge slong gis mkhan bo rnams dang rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa rnams kyi ming yongs su brjod nus shing gsol ba nyams bar mi 'gyur la las kyang byed na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Upāli, it is possible. If the monk who is the agent is able to recite the names of the preceptors and those who wish to be fully ordained, and if the recitation is not defective, and if the action is performed.”

original: mkhan po gcig pa nyid ni gleng gzhi las ston te /
analyzed: mkhan po gcig pa nyid ni gleng gzhi las ston te /
translated: The fact that they have the same preceptor is taught in the nidana.

original: dge tshul sbyin byed dang skyong ba de gnyis phan tshun sems rjes su srung bas so sor rdzogs par ma bsnyen par skad cig gcig kho na la mkhan po gcig gis cig car rdzogs par bsnyen par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul sbyin byed dang skyong ba de gnyis phan tshun sems rjes su srung bas so sor rdzogs par ma bsnyen par skad cig gcig kho na la mkhan po gcig gis cig car rdzogs par bsnyen par gyur pa'o //
translated: The novice monks Dīrghanakha and Kālika were each other’s supporters, and they were fully ordained by the same preceptor at the same time, in a single , not separate, ceremony.

original: tshig gcig gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig gcig gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By a single statement means

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las gcig gis so //
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las gcig gis so //
translated: by a single four-part formal procedure.

original: dus mnyam pa rnams ni gcig la gcig phyag mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa rnams ni gcig la gcig phyag mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are equal in status do not bow down to each other.

original: gang dag @39b dus mnyam pa de dag ni dus mnyam pa rnams te /
analyzed: gang dag @39b dus mnyam pa de dag ni dus mnyam pa rnams te /
translated: Those who are equal in status are those who are equal in status.

original: de dag ni gcig la gcig btud de phyag bya ba mi dgos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gcig la gcig btud de phyag bya ba mi dgos par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they do not bow down to each other.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: dus gcig tu rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i dge slong rnams kyis gcig la gcig btud de phyag mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gcig tu rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i dge slong rnams kyis gcig la gcig btud de phyag mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The fully ordained monks who are fully ordained at the same time do not bow down to each other.

original: dus mnyam pa rnams kyi rnyed pa dang / las su bsko ba dag la gang dang po yin zhe na /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa rnams kyi rnyed pa dang / las su bsko ba dag la gang dang po yin zhe na /
translated: Who is senior among those who are equal in status with regard to the acquisition of property and the assignment of duties?

original: de'i phyir sngar 'ongs pa dang po yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar 'ongs pa dang po yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the first to arrive is the first to receive.

original: rab tu byung ba dus mnyam pa rnams kyi rnyed pa dang las sbyin par bsko ba'i gnas su sngar 'ongs pa zhes bya ba thog mar phyin pa'i gang zag dang po thu bo nyid du 'gyur te ;
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dus mnyam pa rnams kyi rnyed pa dang las sbyin par bsko ba'i gnas su sngar 'ongs pa zhes bya ba thog mar phyin pa'i gang zag dang po thu bo nyid du 'gyur te ;
translated: Among those who have taken ordination at the same time, the first to arrive is the first to receive offerings and work assignments.

original: / de lta bas na gang rnyed pa'i gnas su dang por 'ongs pa des ni /
analyzed: / de lta bas na gang rnyed pa'i gnas su dang por 'ongs pa des ni /
translated: Therefore, the first to arrive is the first to receive.

original: rnyed pa dang por blang bar bya ba la las su bsko ba ni phyis bya ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang por blang bar bya ba la las su bsko ba ni phyis bya ste /
translated: The first to arrive is the first to receive, and work assignments are given later.

original: de ni dang por 'ongs pa'i phyir thu bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni dang por 'ongs pa'i phyir thu bo nyid yin no //
translated: He is the first to arrive and is the first to receive.

original: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ji ltar 'ongs pas rnyed pa blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /🔽gang dang gang 'ongs pa ni ji ltar 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ji ltar 'ongs pas rnyed pa blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs te / gang dang gang 'ongs pa ni ji ltar 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān also said, “Whatever arrives first should receive offerings.”🔽Whatever arrives is whatever arrives.

original: ji ltar 'ongs par gyur pa der 'ongs pa ni ji ltar 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ongs par gyur pa der 'ongs pa ni ji ltar 'ongs pa ste /
translated: Whatever arrives first is whatever arrives first.

original: ji lta 'ongs pa des rnyed pa blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta 'ongs pa des rnyed pa blang bar bya'o //
translated: Whatever arrives first should receive offerings.

original: des phyis las su bsko ba bya ba de yang shugs kyis 'thob pa yin te /
analyzed: des phyis las su bsko ba bya ba de yang shugs kyis 'thob pa yin te /
translated: Also, the one who is the first to arrive at the site of the ceremony obtains the status of elder by implication.

original: de'i tshe thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the eldest at that time.

original: phyis 'ongs pas ni las su bsko ba dang por bya ste de'i tshe gsar pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis 'ongs pas ni las su bsko ba dang por bya ste de'i tshe gsar pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who arrives later should be made an elder first, because he is the newest at that time.

original: de la phyis 'ongs pas las su bsko ba sngar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽dgon pa bas skra sor gnyis las lhag par mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la phyis 'ongs pas las su bsko ba sngar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // dgon pa bas skra sor gnyis las lhag par mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it says, “The one who arrives later should be made an elder first.”🔽“The one from the wilderness should not let his hair grow longer than two fingerbreadths.”

original: dge slong dgon pa bas skra sor gnyis kyi tshad las lhag par mi gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa bas skra sor gnyis kyi tshad las lhag par mi gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the one from the wilderness” means a bhikṣu who lives in the wilderness.

original: skra smos pas kha spu yang smos par gyur pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma brjod do //
analyzed: skra smos pas kha spu yang smos par gyur pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma brjod do //
translated: The word “hair” also includes the beard, so it is not mentioned separately.

original: grong mtha' bas ni de'i 'og ma nyid las mi gzhag go zhes bya ba la 'og ma'i dngos po ni 'og ma nyid de sor gnyis de'i 'og ma nyid de /
analyzed: grong mtha' bas ni de'i 'og ma nyid las mi gzhag go zhes bya ba la 'og ma'i dngos po ni 'og ma nyid de sor gnyis de'i 'og ma nyid de /
translated: “The one from the outskirts of the village should not let his hair grow longer than the lowest amount.” The lowest amount is two fingerbreadths.

original: sor phyed dang gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: sor phyed dang gnyis nyid do //
translated: The lowest amount is one and a half fingerbreadths.

original: de lta bas na sor phyed dang gnyis kyi tshad las lhag par ji tsam du sor gnyis kyi tshad du gyur pa de tsam du mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta bas na sor phyed dang gnyis kyi tshad las lhag par ji tsam du sor gnyis kyi tshad du gyur pa de tsam du mi gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it should not be more than one and a half fingers in length, nor should it be two fingers in length.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: dge slong grong mtha' pas skra ji tsam du sor gnyis kyi tshad du ma phyin pa de tsam kho nar breg par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong grong mtha' pas skra ji tsam du sor gnyis kyi tshad du ma phyin pa de tsam kho nar breg par bya'o //
translated: A monk who lives in a village should shave his hair to the extent that it does not reach two fingers in length.

original: 'dir de ltar ni gzhung las kyang dge slong dgon pa bas skra sor gnyis su gzhag @40a * //🔽par bya la /
analyzed: 'dir de ltar ni gzhung las kyang dge slong dgon pa bas skra sor gnyis su gzhag @40a * // par bya la /
translated: Here, it is also stated in the scriptures that a monk who lives in the forest should keep his hair to a length of two fingers,

original: grong mtha' bas ni de'i 'og ma'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: grong mtha' bas ni de'i 'og ma'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: while a monk who lives in a village should keep it shorter than that.

original: rab tu 'byung ba'i dus na skra breg pa smras pa de'i sgo nas 'dir skra breg pa'i cho ga thams cad bstan te /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i dus na skra breg pa smras pa de'i sgo nas 'dir skra breg pa'i cho ga thams cad bstan te /
translated: When the time comes to go forth, the hair is shaved. Through this, all the procedures for shaving the hair are taught here.

original: skra ba lang gi spu 'dra bar mi breg go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skra ba lang gi spu 'dra bar mi breg go zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not shave the hair so that it resembles the hair of an ox.

original: ba lang gi spu zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi spu dag go //
analyzed: ba lang gi spu zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi spu dag go //
translated: Here, the hair of an ox refers to the hair of an ox.

original: ba lang gi spu dag dang 'dra ba ni ba lang gi spu 'dra bar de de ltar ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi spu dag dang 'dra ba ni ba lang gi spu 'dra bar de de ltar ro //
translated: That which resembles the hair of an ox is like the hair of an ox.

original: ji ltar chan pas skra ba lang gi spu dag dang 'dra bar 'dreg pa de ltar breg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chan pas skra ba lang gi spu dag dang 'dra bar 'dreg pa de ltar breg par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not shave the head like a millet plant, or like a cow’s foot.

original: de ni thams cad du yang bkag pa yin na de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni thams cad du yang bkag pa yin na de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is prohibited in all cases, but in order to teach an exception to that,

original: rma'i than kor ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rma'i than kor ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it says, “except for the area around the wound.”

original: rma'i than kor ni chan pas breg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rma'i than kor ni chan pas breg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The area around the wound should be shaved.

original: skra 'jog pa las gtsug pud 'jog pa ni phyogs gcig tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir de 'jog pa la nyes pa med do snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: skra 'jog pa las gtsug pud 'jog pa ni phyogs gcig tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir de 'jog pa la nyes pa med do snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: Since the topknot is a part of the hair, there is no fault in keeping it, thinking that it is not prohibited.

original: gtsug pud byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtsug pud byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, it says, “One should not have a topknot.”

original: gtsug pud mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: gtsug pud mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: The meaning is that one should not have a topknot.

original: skra breg pa las na spu breg pa yang nyes pa med do snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra breg pa las na spu breg pa yang nyes pa med do snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since shaving the head is prohibited, there is no fault in shaving the body hair.

original: mdoms kyi spu 'dreg tu mi gzhug go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mdoms kyi spu 'dreg tu mi gzhug go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, it says, “One should not shave the pubic hair.”

original: mdo snga ma las byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdo snga ma las byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: The first sūtra should be applied to the second.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words here is as follows.

original: mdoms gsang ba'i gnas te spu 'dreg tu mi gzhug go //
analyzed: mdoms gsang ba'i gnas te spu 'dreg tu mi gzhug go //
translated: The private parts should not be shaved.

original: re zhig mdoms kyi spu breg pa spyir bkag nas /
analyzed: re zhig mdoms kyi spu breg pa spyir bkag nas /
translated: Having generally prohibited shaving the private parts,

original: da ni dmigs kyis bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dmigs kyis bsal bar bya ste /
translated: now an exception is made.

original: rma'i ched du gzhan gyis mi 'tsho na mkhas pa gnas brtan gnas brtan dag la dri ste 'dreg tu gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rma'i ched du gzhan gyis mi 'tsho na mkhas pa gnas brtan gnas brtan dag la dri ste 'dreg tu gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the wound is not healed by others, it should be shaved by the wise, after consulting the elders.

original: rma'i phyir ni spu 'dreg tu gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: rma'i phyir ni spu 'dreg tu gzhug pa'o //
translated: Shaving for the sake of a wound means shaving for the sake of a wound.

original: gzhan gyis mi 'tsho na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi 'tsho na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the wound is not healed by others means

original: gal te bska ba la sogs pa'i thabs gzhan gyis rma mi 'tsho na'o //
analyzed: gal te bska ba la sogs pa'i thabs gzhan gyis rma mi 'tsho na'o //
translated: if the wound is not healed by other methods such as astringents.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bska ba ldas bkru bar bya zhing phyis gal te ma sos na mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa dag la dris te /
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bska ba ldas bkru bar bya zhing phyis gal te ma sos na mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa dag la dris te /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One also said, “Wash with astringents and so on. If it does not heal, ask those who uphold the sūtras, vinaya and mātṛkā.

original: mdoms kyi spu 'dreg tu gzhug go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdoms kyi spu 'dreg tu gzhug go zhes gsungs te /
translated: The hair of the private parts should not be shaved.

original: de ni 'dir gzhung yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir gzhung yin no //
translated: This is the rule here.

original: de'i phyir mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa ni tshig gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽byin pa'i spu breg pa yang de'i phyir ma yin par byed du mi gzhug go //🔽zhes @40b bya ba yang 'dreg tu mi gzhug go zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa ni tshig gzhan bstan pa'i phyir ro // byin pa'i spu breg pa yang de'i phyir ma yin par byed du mi gzhug go // zhes @40b bya ba yang 'dreg tu mi gzhug go zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar te /
translated: The word “expert” is mentioned in order to teach another rule.🔽One should not cause the hair of the private parts to be shaved, but one should not cause the hair of the pubic region to be shaved.🔽The word “but” is to be supplied.

original: byin pa'i spu breg pa yang 'dreg tu ma gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byin pa'i spu breg pa yang 'dreg tu ma gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: one should not cause the hair of the pubic region to be shaved.

original: ji rnam pa thams cad du 'dreg tu mi gzhug gam zhe na /
analyzed: ji rnam pa thams cad du 'dreg tu mi gzhug gam zhe na /
translated: Is it absolutely forbidden to shave?

original: de'i phyir ma yin par zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma yin par zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “not for that reason.”

original: rma'i phyir ma yin par 'dren tu mi gzhug gi rma'i phyir ni 'dreg tu gzhug pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rma'i phyir ma yin par 'dren tu mi gzhug gi rma'i phyir ni 'dreg tu gzhug pa kho na yin no //
translated: One should not cause the hair to be shaved for that reason, but one should cause the hair to be shaved for the sake of a wound.🔽Since the shaving of the hair of the private parts is prohibited, one might think that it is permissible to shave the hair of the rest of the body.

original: byin pa'i spu breg pa bkag pas lus gzhan gyi spu ni breg tu rung ngo snyam du dogs pa la lus gzhan du yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byin pa'i spu breg pa bkag pas lus gzhan gyi spu ni breg tu rung ngo snyam du dogs pa la lus gzhan du yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To forestall this, he says, “One should not cause the body to be shaved elsewhere.”

original: mdoms dang byin pa gnyis las gzhan pa'i lus ni mgrin pa man chad kyi lus 'og ma la bya ste /
analyzed: mdoms dang byin pa gnyis las gzhan pa'i lus ni mgrin pa man chad kyi lus 'og ma la bya ste /
translated: The body other than the genitals and the anus is the lower body below the neck.

original: de la yang rma'i phyir ma yin par spu breg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang rma'i phyir ma yin par spu breg par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not shave the hair of the body except for the hair of the private parts.

original: 'dir ma mo'i gzhung las skra dang kha spu ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i yan lag dang nying lag dag gi spu breg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ma mo'i gzhung las skra dang kha spu ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i yan lag dang nying lag dag gi spu breg par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya says: “Except for the hair of the head and face, one should not shave the hair of the body or the minor body parts.”

original: gang 'dreg na nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'dreg na nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one shaves it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sna'i spu breg pa la ni rnam grangs kyi tshig yod de /
analyzed: sna'i spu breg pa la ni rnam grangs kyi tshig yod de /
translated: There are terms that refer to shaving the hair of the nose.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis dge slong dag gi sna'i spu phyed btogs pa dag la rgan rims kyis smang tsher blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis dge slong dag gi sna'i spu phyed btogs pa dag la rgan rims kyis smang tsher blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Thus the Bhagavān said: “A bhikṣu should not receive alms in the order of seniority from bhikṣus who have half their nose hair shaved.

original: dge slong gis dge slong dag gi sna'i spu phyed btogs pa dag la rgan rims kyis smang tsher len par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong dag gi sna'i spu phyed btogs pa dag la rgan rims kyis smang tsher len par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so ;
translated: If a bhikṣu receives alms in the order of seniority from bhikṣus who have half their nose hair shaved, he becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: / gal te sna'i spu dag rnam pa thams cad du btogs par mi bya ba yin na /
analyzed: / gal te sna'i spu dag rnam pa thams cad du btogs par mi bya ba yin na /
translated: If the hair on the body is not to be removed in any way,

original: ci'i phyir phyed btogs pa'i smad tsher len pa nyes byas su bstan te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyed btogs pa'i smad tsher len pa nyes byas su bstan te /
translated: why is it a minor infraction to remove the hair between the eyebrows?

original: rigs pa 'dis ni sngon gzhung dngos su yang yod par gyur pa las de nub par gyur par shes so //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis ni sngon gzhung dngos su yang yod par gyur pa las de nub par gyur par shes so //
translated: By this reasoning, it is known that the original text existed, but it has disappeared.

original: da ni sen mo breg pa'i cho ga bstan te /🔽sen mo spu gri'i so lta bu'am /
analyzed: da ni sen mo breg pa'i cho ga bstan te / sen mo spu gri'i so lta bu'am /
translated: Now the procedure for cutting the nails is taught.🔽The nails should be cut like the surface of a razor,

original: ste'u'i kha lta bur breg par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽ser mo spu gri'i so lta bur mtha' dma' zhing dbus mtho bar breg par bya ba'am /
analyzed: ste'u'i kha lta bur breg par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / ser mo spu gri'i so lta bur mtha' dma' zhing dbus mtho bar breg par bya ba'am /
translated: or like the mouth of a plow.🔽The nails should be cut so that the edges are low and the middle is high, like the surface of a razor.

original: ste'u'i kha 'dra bar dbus dang mtha' mnyam par breg par bya'o //
analyzed: ste'u'i kha 'dra bar dbus dang mtha' mnyam par breg par bya'o //
translated: Or they should be cut so that the middle and edges are even, like the mouth of a plow.

original: de dag sbyil bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag sbyil bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should not be filed.

original: sen mo de dag rgyags pa bskyed pa'i sbyil bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sen mo de dag rgyags pa bskyed pa'i sbyil bar mi bya'o //
translated: Those nails should not be filed to produce a smooth surface.

original: sen mo sbyang ba yang rnam pa thams cad du bkag par gyur to snyam pa la /
analyzed: sen mo sbyang ba yang rnam pa thams cad du bkag par gyur to snyam pa la /
translated: It seems that the cutting of the nails has been completely prohibited.

original: dri ma bsal ba'i phyir brud par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dri ma bsal ba'i phyir brud par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to remove the stains, he should shave.

original: dri ma bsal bar bya ba'i phyir brud cing bzhar bar bya ste /
analyzed: dri ma bsal bar bya ba'i phyir brud cing bzhar bar bya ste /
translated: In order to remove the stains, he should shave and cut his hair and beard.

original: brud pa ji tsam gyis dri ma sle bar gyur pa de tsam bya'o //🔽chos gos gyon bzhin du skra dang kha spu breg @41a * //
analyzed: brud pa ji tsam gyis dri ma sle bar gyur pa de tsam bya'o // chos gos gyon bzhin du skra dang kha spu breg @41a * //
translated: He should shave as much as is necessary to remove the stains.

original: par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: He should not shave his head while wearing his robes.

original: 'dir gos thams cad chos gos kyi sgrar brjod pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir gos thams cad chos gos kyi sgrar brjod pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Here, all garments are called robes.

original: 'dir bla gos gzung bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir bla gos gzung bar bya'i /
translated: But here the upper robe is meant,

original: mthang gos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthang gos ni ma yin no //
translated: not the lower robe.

original: gal te mthang gos kyang bkag na ni /
analyzed: gal te mthang gos kyang bkag na ni /
translated: If the lower robe were also prohibited,

original: gcer bu kho nal breg par 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di ni bla gos thams cad bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gcer bu kho nal breg par 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di ni bla gos thams cad bkag pa yin no //
translated: he would be forced to shave his head naked. Therefore, this refers to the prohibition of all upper robes.

original: skra breg pa gang gis bya zhe na /🔽skra bzed bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skra breg pa gang gis bya zhe na / skra bzed bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: With what should he shave his head?🔽He should carry a razor case.

original: skra bzed pa'i gos bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: skra bzed pa'i gos bcang bar bya ste /
translated: He should carry a cloth for shaving his head.

original: des skra dag bzed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des skra dag bzed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of shaving his head with that.

original: de yang bgo ba'i don yin gyi gding ba'i don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bgo ba'i don yin gyi gding ba'i don ni ma yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of “to spread,” not the meaning of “to sit upon.”

original: med na rdul gzan gyis so zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //🔽med na rdul gzan gyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med na rdul gzan gyis so zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro // med na rdul gzan gyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not have a sitting mat, one should shave one’s head with a dust cover.🔽If one does not have a sitting mat, one should shave one’s head with a dust cover.

original: skra bzed kyi gos med na rdul gzan gyon pas skra dang kha spu breg par bya'o //
analyzed: skra bzed kyi gos med na rdul gzan gyon pas skra dang kha spu breg par bya'o //
translated: If one does not have a cloth for shaving the head, one should shave one’s head and beard with a dust cover.

original: bting bar yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bting bar yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not spread it out.

original: skra dang kha spu breg par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: skra dang kha spu breg par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not shave one’s head and beard.🔽Here, the scriptures state:

original: 'dir gzhung ni gleng gzhi dag las dge slong gis bting bar 'dug nas skra breg par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gleng gzhi dag las dge slong gis bting bar 'dug nas skra breg par mi bya ste /
translated: “A monk should not shave his head while sitting on a spread.🔽If he has his head shaved in a dwelling, a courtyard, or a gateway, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gnas khang dang khyams dang sgo khang du skra 'dreg tu 'jug na yang nyes byas de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gnas khang dang khyams dang sgo khang du skra 'dreg tu 'jug na yang nyes byas de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gang du dge 'dun phyag dar phyags pa der skra 'dreg tu gzhug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang du dge 'dun phyag dar phyags pa der skra 'dreg tu gzhug par mi bya ste /
translated: “One should not have one’s head shaved where the Saṅgha sweeps.

original: 'dreg tu gzhug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong gang dag rgas 'khogs nyam chung ba dag dang nad pa sbyor mi bzod pa de dag gis ni khyams sam gzhan du skra 'dreg tu gzhug par bya zhing /🔽bde bar gnas pa dag gis kyang nyi ma tsha ba'am /
analyzed: 'dreg tu gzhug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong gang dag rgas 'khogs nyam chung ba dag dang nad pa sbyor mi bzod pa de dag gis ni khyams sam gzhan du skra 'dreg tu gzhug par bya zhing / bde bar gnas pa dag gis kyang nyi ma tsha ba'am /
translated: And likewise, “Monks who are old, weak, and sick, and those who are unable to work, should have their heads shaved in a courtyard or elsewhere.

original: char 'bab pa gang du phyi rol du 'gror med na khyams sam gzhan der skra breg par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽gang du dge 'dun phyag dar phyags par yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽phyogs gang du dge 'dun phyag dar phyags pa'i phyogs der skra 'dreg tu gzhug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: char 'bab pa gang du phyi rol du 'gror med na khyams sam gzhan der skra breg par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // gang du dge 'dun phyag dar phyags par yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni / phyogs gang du dge 'dun phyag dar phyags pa'i phyogs der skra 'dreg tu gzhug par mi bya ste /
translated: Those who are healthy should shave their heads in a courtyard or elsewhere, not outside, if the sun is hot or it is raining.🔽”🔽“You should not sweep the place where the Saṅgha is sweeping,”🔽means that you should not have your head shaved in the place where the Saṅgha is sweeping.

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gang du dge 'dun phyag dar nyal nyil la sogs pa phyags pa der zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gang du dge 'dun phyag dar nyal nyil la sogs pa phyags pa der zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that you should not have your head shaved in the place where the Saṅgha is sweeping up rubbish and so on in the monastery.

original: rgan po dang nad pa dang rlung dang nyi ma dang char pa dag la khyams la sogs par 'dreg tu gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgan po dang nad pa dang rlung dang nyi ma dang char pa dag la khyams la sogs par 'dreg tu gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The elder, the sick, and those affected by wind, sun, and rain should have their hair cut in a courtyard, etc.

original: khyams la sogs par zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni gnas khang dang sgo khang la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: khyams la sogs par zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni gnas khang dang sgo khang la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “in a courtyard, etc.” includes a house, a door-way, etc.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: rgan po @41b sbyor mi bzod pa dang / nad pa mi nus pas ni khyams la sogs par skra 'dreg tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan po @41b sbyor mi bzod pa dang / nad pa mi nus pas ni khyams la sogs par skra 'dreg tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The elder, who is unable to endure the work, and the sick, who are unable, should have their hair cut in a courtyard, etc.

original: rlung dang nyi ma dang char ba dag la ni thams cad kyis so //🔽phyogs de byi dor bya'o zhes bya ba ni skra bregs pa'i phyogs der byi dor bya ba ste /
analyzed: rlung dang nyi ma dang char ba dag la ni thams cad kyis so // phyogs de byi dor bya'o zhes bya ba ni skra bregs pa'i phyogs der byi dor bya ba ste /
translated: Those affected by wind, sun, and rain should have their hair cut by all.🔽The place where the hair is cut should be cleaned.

original: sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the place where the hair is cut should be cleaned.

original: sbyang ba zhes bya ba ni skra med pa nyid dang chus btab pa las byung ba'i sa 'bus pa la sogs pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyang ba zhes bya ba ni skra med pa nyid dang chus btab pa las byung ba'i sa 'bus pa la sogs pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: “Cleaning” means removing the hair, and removing the dirt that arises from sprinkling with water.

original: skra bregs pa rnams gang du dor bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: skra bregs pa rnams gang du dor bar bya zhe na /
translated: Where should the hair that is cut be thrown?

original: de'i phyir skra ni phyag dar khrod du dor ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skra ni phyag dar khrod du dor ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The hair is thrown in the dust heap.”

original: skra dag ni phyag dar gyis gang ba'i phyogs su dor ro //
analyzed: skra dag ni phyag dar gyis gang ba'i phyogs su dor ro //
translated: The hair is thrown in the direction of the dust heap.

original: sen mo gcad pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sen mo gcad pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nails are also cut in the same way.

original: skra breg pa'i cho ga bstan pa gang yin pa'i cho ga de nyid kyis sen mo bcad par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skra breg pa'i cho ga bstan pa gang yin pa'i cho ga de nyid kyis sen mo bcad par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The procedure for cutting the nails should be understood in the same way as the procedure for shaving the hair.

original: de 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na dge slong mas zhal ta ma byas par skyes pas skra mi breg go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na dge slong mas zhal ta ma byas par skyes pas skra mi breg go zhes bya ba la /
translated: If he is not free from desire, the hair should not be cut by a man without the supervision of a nun.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'o //
translated: “He” refers to the monk.

original: dge slong mas zhal ta ma byas par zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma gzhan gyis ma bsrungs par skyes pas skra mi breg go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge slong mas zhal ta ma byas par zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma gzhan gyis ma bsrungs par skyes pas skra mi breg go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Without the supervision of a nun” means that the hair should not be cut by a man without the protection of another nun.

original: ci thams cad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad dam zhe na /
translated: Is it all?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: No, because it is said, “If he is not free from attachment.”

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni breg ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni breg ste /
translated: One who is free from attachment is pure.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here says, “If he is free from attachment, there is no offense.”

original: kun du chags par gyur na zhal ta byed pa mos rjes su bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun du chags par gyur na zhal ta byed pa mos rjes su bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he is attached, the nun who is the instructor should instruct her.

original: gal te skyes pa'i yul de'i 'dod chags skye na dge slong ma kun du chags par gyur pa de la dge slong ma zhal ta byed pa mos rjes su bstan par bya ste yang dag par rjes su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te skyes pa'i yul de'i 'dod chags skye na dge slong ma kun du chags par gyur pa de la dge slong ma zhal ta byed pa mos rjes su bstan par bya ste yang dag par rjes su bstan par bya'o //
translated: If the attachment of the nun who is the student arises toward the man, the nun who is the instructor should instruct her, should properly instruct her.

original: ji ltar zhe na dran pa nye bar zhog cig / ji rnag gi lus 'di la snying po yod dam zhes so zhes bya bas ni /🔽dran pa nye bar zhog cig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na dran pa nye bar zhog cig / ji rnag gi lus 'di la snying po yod dam zhes so zhes bya bas ni / dran pa nye bar zhog cig ces bya ba ni /
translated: How? “Place mindfulness right here. Is there any essence in this putrid body?”🔽“Place mindfulness right here” means

original: dran pa mngon du gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa mngon du gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: “Make mindfulness manifest right here.”

original: ji rnag gi lus 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji rnag gi lus 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This body of pus and blood means🔽.

original: 'jig ba'i bdag nyid kyi lus la'o //
analyzed: 'jig ba'i bdag nyid kyi lus la'o //
translated: In this body which is a mass of corruption means in a body which is subject to destruction.

original: snying po yod dam zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dod chags pa'i dngos po yod dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snying po yod dam zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dod chags pa'i dngos po yod dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Is there any essence? means Is there any object of attachment?

original: 'dreg mkhan la ni ma dang sring mo dang bu mo'i 'du shes nye bar zhog cig ces so zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dreg mkhan dge slong ma'i yul la 'dod chags skye bar gyur na de'i tshe 'dreg mkhan kun du chags par gyur pa de la ni🔽zhal ta byed pa @42a * //
analyzed: 'dreg mkhan la ni ma dang sring mo dang bu mo'i 'du shes nye bar zhog cig ces so zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dreg mkhan dge slong ma'i yul la 'dod chags skye bar gyur na de'i tshe 'dreg mkhan kun du chags par gyur pa de la ni zhal ta byed pa @42a * //
translated: You should think of the barber as your mother, sister, or daughter. If attachment to the object of a nun arises in the barber, then the barber, who has become attached,

original: mos rjes su bstan par bya ste /🔽ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: mos rjes su bstan par bya ste / ji ltar zhe na /
translated: should be instructed by the nun.

original: ma la sogs ba'i 'du shes nye bar zhog shig ces bya bas so //
analyzed: ma la sogs ba'i 'du shes nye bar zhog shig ces bya bas so //
translated: She should instruct him thus: You should think of me as your mother, sister, or daughter.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis skra breg pa'i bye brag smras na /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis skra breg pa'i bye brag smras na /
translated: If the nun speaks of the particulars of shaving her head,

original: da ni spyi'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir de byas nas khrus bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni spyi'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir de byas nas khrus bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, in order to teach the general procedure, he says, Having done that, she should bathe.

original: de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That means that she should think of the barber as her mother, sister, or daughter.

original: skra dang kha spu bregs pa'o //
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs pa'o //
translated: He shaves his hair and beard.

original: byas nas zhes bya ba ni zin nas te /
analyzed: byas nas zhes bya ba ni zin nas te /
translated: Having done so means having completed the act.

original: khrus bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: khrus bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: He should bathe means he should apply himself to bathing.

analyzed: yang na yan lag lnga'i khrus kyang bya'o zhes bya ba yang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: kha ma bkab par zhes bya ba ni ma g-yogs par ro //

analyzed: sgren mor khrus mi bya'o zhes bya bas 'dir sgren mo'i khrus bkag pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la khrus nyi rim la sogs pas khrus mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;

original: gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /

analyzed: khrus ras med na mdun dang rgyab nas lo ma dag gis glan la khrus bya'o //

analyzed: srog chags chags na bshal bas med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: stor khung gdod par bya'o //

analyzed: ljan ljin yod nas /

analyzed: bcer bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it should be made smooth.

original: de'i ched du lcags kyi thal phyags bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i ched du lcags kyi thal phyags bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For that purpose, an iron shovel should be kept” means

original: mes sba ba de'i ched du lcags kyi thal phyags bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mes sba ba de'i ched du lcags kyi thal phyags bcang bar bya'o //
translated: for the purpose of covering the fire with ashes, an iron shovel should be kept.

original: lcags las byas ba ni lcags kyi ste /
analyzed: lcags las byas ba ni lcags kyi ste /
translated: “Made of iron” means made of iron.

original: lcags kyi nal ze bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lcags kyi nal ze bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that an iron shovel should be kept.

original: me 'bar ba na mi rmya bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: me 'bar ba na mi rmya bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should enter the hot sauna and stay there in order to avoid becoming exhausted when the fire is burning.

original: bsro gang gi khang par me sbar te 'bar na mi rmya bar bya ba mi 'khrugs par bya ba'i phyir nang du 'jug pa re zhig bsdad par bya'o ;
analyzed: bsro gang gi khang par me sbar te 'bar na mi rmya bar bya ba mi 'khrugs par bya ba'i phyir nang du 'jug pa re zhig bsdad par bya'o ;
translated: When the fire is burning in the hot sauna, one should enter and stay there for a while in order to avoid becoming exhausted and in order to avoid becoming agitated.

original: / bog pa mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / bog pa mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to avoid fainting,

original: phye dang yungs mar du bsres pa dag mer blugs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phye dang yungs mar du bsres pa dag mer blugs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: one should pour flour and mustard seed mixed with oil into the fire.

original: bog pa zhes bya ba ni mes brgyal ba ste /
analyzed: bog pa zhes bya ba ni mes brgyal ba ste /
translated: Fainting is a swoon caused by fire.

original: de mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir phye dang yungs mar yungs kar gyi mar du bsres pa sbyar ba dag mer blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir phye dang yungs mar yungs kar gyi mar du bsres pa sbyar ba dag mer blugs par bya'o //
translated: In order to avoid that, one should pour into the fire a mixture of flour and mustard seed mixed with oil.

original: dri mi zhim pa nyid bsal ba'i @45b phyir bdug spos blugs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa nyid bsal ba'i @45b phyir bdug spos blugs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to remove bad smells, one should pour incense into the fire.

original: dri mi zhim pa'i dngos po ni dri mi zhim pa nyid de /
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa'i dngos po ni dri mi zhim pa nyid de /
translated: Bad smells are bad odors.

original: phye dang yungs mar bsres pa dag blugs pa las gyur pa'i dri mi zhim pa nyid de /
analyzed: phye dang yungs mar bsres pa dag blugs pa las gyur pa'i dri mi zhim pa nyid de /
translated: The bad smell that arises from pouring flour and mustard seed mixed with oil into the fire is removed by pouring incense into the fire.

original: bsal ba zhes bya ba de dang dbral ba'i phyir bdug spos blugs par bya'o //🔽mchi ma 'dzag nas kyi bag zan gyis gcod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsal ba zhes bya ba de dang dbral ba'i phyir bdug spos blugs par bya'o // mchi ma 'dzag nas kyi bag zan gyis gcod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word remove means that in order to remove that, one should insert incense.🔽If tears flow, one should stop them with barley flour, it is said.

original: mchi ma 'dzag na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchi ma 'dzag na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If tears flow means

original: mig chu 'dzag na'o //🔽nas kyi bag phye zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig chu 'dzag na'o // nas kyi bag phye zhes bya ba ni /
translated: if eye-water flows.🔽Barley flour means

original: nas btags pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: nas btags pa'i ming ngo //
translated: the name of barley flour.

original: de'i zan gyis mig chu gcad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i zan gyis mig chu gcad par bya ste /
translated: With that flour, one should stop the eye-water.

original: mi 'dzag par bya ba'i thabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'dzag par bya ba'i thabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should do the method of not letting it flow.

original: skyu ru ra'i phye ma spus pa'i chad bus kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyu ru ra'i phye ma spus pa'i chad bus kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should also stop it with a ball of jujube powder, it is said.

original: kyang ngo zhes bya bas ni de bcad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽der rtsva bam gyi stan gding ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya bas ni de bcad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro // der rtsva bam gyi stan gding ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word also is connected to one should stop it.🔽One should spread a mat of grass bundles there, it is said.

original: bsro gang der rtsa bam rtsva chun gshibs pa'i stan gding bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsro gang der rtsa bam rtsva chun gshibs pa'i stan gding bar bya ste /
translated: One should spread a mat of grass bundles in that hot bath,

original: sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is soft.

original: sa gzhir skye ba nyid kyis sam spangs bas gsher ba'i rtsva gsher ba dag dgram mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa gzhir skye ba nyid kyis sam spangs bas gsher ba'i rtsva gsher ba dag dgram mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ground is moistened either by nature or by sprinkling, and then the grass is spread out.

original: bsro gang gi khang pa'i sa gzhi gang yin par rtsva dag dgram par bya ste /
analyzed: bsro gang gi khang pa'i sa gzhi gang yin par rtsva dag dgram par bya ste /
translated: The ground of the sauna is where the grass is spread out.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What is the special quality of the grass?

original: gsher ba dag go //
analyzed: gsher ba dag go //
translated: It is moist.

original: de dag cis gsher zhe na /
analyzed: de dag cis gsher zhe na /
translated: How is it moist?

original: skye ba nyid kyis sam zhes bya ba skye bas grub pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba nyid kyis sam zhes bya ba skye bas grub pa ni /
translated: Either by nature means it is moist by nature.

original: skye bas gsher ba ste des so //
analyzed: skye bas gsher ba ste des so //
translated: It is moist by nature, and that is how it is.

original: spangs pas zhes bya ba ni chus btab pas gsher ba ste /
analyzed: spangs pas zhes bya ba ni chus btab pas gsher ba ste /
translated: By sprinkling means it is moist by sprinkling with water.

original: de yang rung ngo //🔽g-yan pa phrug pa'i ched du lcags kyi phrug spyad bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang rung ngo // g-yan pa phrug pa'i ched du lcags kyi phrug spyad bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is also acceptable.🔽For the purpose of scratching the itch, an iron scratcher is used.

original: g-yan pa phrug pa'i rgyur lcags las byas pa'i gzar chung bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yan pa phrug pa'i rgyur lcags las byas pa'i gzar chung bya ba'o //
translated: It is a small iron instrument for the purpose of scratching the itch.

original: rdzas kyi blas lung mig nas tha gus btags te dben par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzas kyi blas lung mig nas tha gus btags te dben par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The patient is tied with a rope from the eyes to the feet and placed in a secluded place.

original: rdzas kyi blas phrus spyad de'i lung mig gi nang nas tha gus btags pa'i rgyus phyogs dben par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rdzas kyi blas phrus spyad de'i lung mig gi nang nas tha gus btags pa'i rgyus phyogs dben par gzhag ste /
translated: The razor should be placed in a secluded place.

original: spyang du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spyang du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it should be kept in a safe place.

original: de la dri ma med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir mes rung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir mes rung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to make it stainless, it should be heated with fire.

original: g-yan pa phrug pa'i ched du sbyar ba'i phrug spyad de la dri ma med pa nyid du bsgrub pa dag par bya ba'i phyir mes rung bar bya ba mes brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yan pa phrug pa'i ched du sbyar ba'i phrug spyad de la dri ma med pa nyid du bsgrub pa dag par bya ba'i phyir mes rung bar bya ba mes brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that in order to make the razor used for shaving stainless, it should be heated with fire in order to purify it.

original: der khrus mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der khrus mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not wash it there.

original: bsro gang der dge slong dag gis khrus mi bya ba'o //🔽de'i ched du khrus khang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsro gang der dge slong dag gis khrus mi bya ba'o // de'i ched du khrus khang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that the monks should not wash themselves in that hot water bath.🔽A bathhouse should be made for that purpose.

original: khrus bya ba de'i ched du khrus khang bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khrus bya ba de'i ched du khrus khang bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that a bathhouse should be made for the purpose of washing.

original: khrus chu ldugs pa'i chos gos dag mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir so phag gis bsgron pa'i khrus dong bya'o @46a * //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khrus chu ldugs pa'i chos gos dag mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir so phag gis bsgron pa'i khrus dong bya'o @46a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: A bathing pool should be made with bricks in order to prevent the bathing robes from being damaged by the water.

original: khrus kyi chu ldugs par byed pa'i gos dag ni khrus chu ldugs pa'i chos gos dag go //
analyzed: khrus kyi chu ldugs par byed pa'i gos dag ni khrus chu ldugs pa'i chos gos dag go //
translated: Bathing robes are robes for pouring bathing water.

original: de dag mi nyams mi gsher bar bya ba'i phyir so phag gis bsgron pa'i khrus dong bya'o //
analyzed: de dag mi nyams mi gsher bar bya ba'i phyir so phag gis bsgron pa'i khrus dong bya'o //
translated: A bathing pool should be made with bricks in order to prevent them from being damaged or wet.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: dge slong khrus dong du zhugs pas ni khrus bya la /
analyzed: dge slong khrus dong du zhugs pas ni khrus bya la /
translated: A monk who has entered the bathing pool should bathe.

original: dge slong kha na sdod pas ni chu blugs par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong kha na sdod pas ni chu blugs par bya ste /
translated: A monk who remains outside should pour the water.

original: de ltar na chos gos dag nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na chos gos dag nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the robes will not be damaged.

original: de la stor khung gdod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la stor khung gdod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: A drain should be made there.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni khrus dong la ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni khrus dong la ste /
translated: There means in the bathing pool.

original: khrus dong de la stor khung gdod par bya'o //
analyzed: khrus dong de la stor khung gdod par bya'o //
translated: A drain should be made in that bathing pool.🔽The water should be announced to those who are not yet finished.

original: chu ha cang tshan phyi ma rnams la sbran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khrus chu ha cang tsha ste /
analyzed: chu ha cang tshan phyi ma rnams la sbran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khrus chu ha cang tsha ste /
translated: The bathing water is too hot.

original: brnags mi bzod na rab tu byung ba phyi ma rnams la spran par bya ba ste /
analyzed: brnags mi bzod na rab tu byung ba phyi ma rnams la spran par bya ba ste /
translated: If it is unbearable, it should be reported to the monks who come later.

original: gal te chu ha cang tsha ches te khrus byar mi bzod na /
analyzed: gal te chu ha cang tsha ches te khrus byar mi bzod na /
translated: If the water is too hot and one cannot bear to bathe,

original: dge slong phyi ma rnams la chu te por tsha'o zhes sbran par bya ba'o //🔽der grang mos bsre'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong phyi ma rnams la chu te por tsha'o zhes sbran par bya ba'o // der grang mos bsre'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it should be reported to the monks who come later, saying “The water is hot.”🔽“There, it should be cooled with cold water.”

original: chu tsha ba der chu grang mos bsre ba 'dres par bya ba ste /
analyzed: chu tsha ba der chu grang mos bsre ba 'dres par bya ba ste /
translated: In that hot water, cold water should be mixed,

original: chu tsha ba'i nang du chu grang mos bslad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chu tsha ba'i nang du chu grang mos bslad par bya ba'o //
translated: that is, cold water should be added to the hot water.

original: chag chag gi chu la sogs par yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chag chag gi chu la sogs par yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Also in the water for sprinkling, etc.”

original: chag chag gi chu gang la bkru bshal dang / zhal zhal la sogs pa'i sogs pa yod pa de ni chag chag gi chu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chag chag gi chu gang la bkru bshal dang / zhal zhal la sogs pa'i sogs pa yod pa de ni chag chag gi chu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The water for sprinkling, etc., is that in which washing, rinsing, and so on are done.

original: chag chag gi chu la sogs pa der zhes bya ba chag chag gi chu la sogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chag chag gi chu la sogs pa der zhes bya ba chag chag gi chu la sogs pa'i phyir /
translated: “In that water for sprinkling, etc.” means for the sake of the water for sprinkling, etc.

original: yang chu tsha ba der chu grang mos bsre bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang chu tsha ba der chu grang mos bsre bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Again, cold water should be mixed with the hot water. This is the meaning.

original: khrus gang der yang thal ba dang ba lang gi lci ba dang so shing gis bkang ba'i gyo mo dag gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khrus gang der yang thal ba dang ba lang gi lci ba dang so shing gis bkang ba'i gyo mo dag gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that bathing place, one should also place a pot filled with ashes, cow dung, and tooth cleaners.

original: thal ba dang ba lang gi lci ba dang so shing ni thal ba dang ba lang gi lci ba dang so shing dag go //
analyzed: thal ba dang ba lang gi lci ba dang so shing ni thal ba dang ba lang gi lci ba dang so shing dag go //
translated: Ashes, cow dung, and tooth cleaners are the ashes, cow dung, and tooth cleaners.

original: de dag gis so sor bkang ba'i gyo mo dag gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gis so sor bkang ba'i gyo mo dag gzhag par bya ste /
translated: One should place pots filled with each of those.

original: khrus khang der thal ba la sogs pas bkang ba'i gyo mo dag gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khrus khang der thal ba la sogs pas bkang ba'i gyo mo dag gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that in that bathing place, one should place pots filled with ashes and so on.

original: gal te nyams dmas par gyur na khe'u sus bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te nyams dmas par gyur na khe'u sus bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one becomes weak, one should eat gruel.

original: gal te bsro gang du zhugs pas lus kyi nyams dmas pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe khe'u sus bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bsro gang du zhugs pas lus kyi nyams dmas pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe khe'u sus bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If one enters the sauna and one's body becomes weak, then at that time one should eat gruel.

original: bsro gang du 'jug pa'i dus na dge slong rnams cha lugs dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsro gang du 'jug pa'i dus na dge slong rnams cha lugs dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: When entering the sauna, because the monks are separated from their robes,

original: kun du rgyu la sogs pa gzhan dag shan bsre bas bsro gang du 'jug pa'i skabs srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun du rgyu la sogs pa gzhan dag shan bsre bas bsro gang du 'jug pa'i skabs srid pa'i phyir /
translated: It is possible that a non-Buddhist ascetic might enter the sauna, because the sauna is open to all.

original: der ngo mi shes pa zhig shan bsre bas nye bar gnas par gyur na /🔽der gtogs pas nges @46b par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: der ngo mi shes pa zhig shan bsre bas nye bar gnas par gyur na / der gtogs pas nges @46b par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If a non-Buddhist ascetic were to enter the sauna,🔽the monks in the sauna would ask him,

original: dri bar bya zhing de'i ched du mi 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dri bar bya zhing de'i ched du mi 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “Who are you?” in order to ascertain who he is and to prevent him from staying there.

original: dge slong sgo ba bsko'i zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge slong sgo ba bsko'i zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The monks at the door of the sauna would say, “Who are you?”

original: der zhes bya ba ni bsro khang du'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni bsro khang du'o //
translated: “There” means in the sauna.

original: ngo mi shes pa zhig ces bya ba ni ma nges pa zhig go / shan bsre bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo mi shes pa zhig ces bya ba ni ma nges pa zhig go / shan bsre bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A non-Buddhist ascetic” means someone who is not a monk.

original: kho bo khyed cag las gang yang rung ba zhig yin no zhes gseb tu 'jug pas so //🔽nye bar gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kho bo khyed cag las gang yang rung ba zhig yin no zhes gseb tu 'jug pas so // nye bar gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Entering the sauna” means entering the sauna, saying, “I am one of you.”

original: kun du rgyu la sogs pa sta gon du gnas par gyur na'o //🔽der gtogs pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun du rgyu la sogs pa sta gon du gnas par gyur na'o // der gtogs pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If he were to enter” means if a non-Buddhist ascetic were to enter the sauna.

original: bsro gang na rnam par gnas pa'i dge slong gis te /
analyzed: bsro gang na rnam par gnas pa'i dge slong gis te /
translated: “The monks in the sauna” means the monks who are in the sauna.🔽“The monks at the door of the sauna” means the monks who are at the door of the sauna.

original: des dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: des dri bar bya'o //
translated: He should ask.

original: ci zhig gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gi phyir zhe na /
translated: For what reason?

original: ji 'di chos 'di'i ba'i dge slong zhig gam ;
analyzed: ji 'di chos 'di'i ba'i dge slong zhig gam ;
translated: Is this a monk of this Dharma,

original: 'on te kun du rgyu la sogs pa zhig yin zhes de ltar shes par bya ba nges par bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te kun du rgyu la sogs pa zhig yin zhes de ltar shes par bya ba nges par bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya'o //
translated: or is he a wandering mendicant, etc.? In order to know and ascertain that, he should ask.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te bsro gang du mu stegs can 'ga' zhig kho bo khyed cag las gang yang rung ba zhig yin no zhes shan bsre zhing 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te bsro gang du mu stegs can 'ga' zhig kho bo khyed cag las gang yang rung ba zhig yin no zhes shan bsre zhing 'jug na /
translated: If in the sauna, some non-Buddhist were to mix in, saying, I am one of you,

original: de'i tshe dge slong bsro gang du zhugs pas khyod su zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas nges par bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong bsro gang du zhugs pas khyod su zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas nges par bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya'o //
translated: then at that time, the monk who has entered the sauna should ask in order to ascertain who he is, saying, Who are you? and so on.

original: zhugs pa'i thabs kyi cho ga bstan nas /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i thabs kyi cho ga bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the method of procedure for entering,

original: ma zhugs pa'i thabs kyi cho ga brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma zhugs pa'i thabs kyi cho ga brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to state the method of procedure for not entering,

original: de'i ched du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i ched du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he said for that purpose, and so on.

original: sgo ba bsko'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgo ba bsko'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The doorkeeper should be appointed is to be supplied.

original: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For that purpose means:

original: ngo mi shes pa shan bsre bas nye bar gnas par gyur pa de nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya ba dang / mi 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo mi shes pa shan bsre bas nye bar gnas par gyur pa de nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya ba dang / mi 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to ascertain who he is, he should be asked, and in order to prevent him from entering.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: bsro gang du sgo ba gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: bsro gang du sgo ba gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: The gatekeeper should be placed at the sauna.

original: gal te mu stegs can 'ga' zhig 'ong zhing 'jug par 'dod na de'i tshe sgo bas nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'di ni bdag cag las gang yang rung ba ma yin pas mi gzhug pa'i phyir de la khyod su zhig ces dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mu stegs can 'ga' zhig 'ong zhing 'jug par 'dod na de'i tshe sgo bas nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'di ni bdag cag las gang yang rung ba ma yin pas mi gzhug pa'i phyir de la khyod su zhig ces dri bar bya'o //
translated: If any non-Buddhist comes and wishes to enter, at that time the gatekeeper should ask him, “Who are you?” in order to ascertain who he is, and in order to prevent him from entering because he is not one of us.

original: sgo ba ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: sgo ba ji lta bu zhig ce na /
