translated: One should not honor the latter.

original: de ni thams cad du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the rule for all.

original: thams cad la bkag par thal ba la /
analyzed: thams cad la bkag par thal ba la /
translated: But if it is forbidden in all cases,

original: la la la bya ba brtsam pa'i phyir slob dpon dang mkhan po ni mchog tu tshul khrims 'chal pa la yang bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: la la la bya ba brtsam pa'i phyir slob dpon dang mkhan po ni mchog tu tshul khrims 'chal pa la yang bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then one should honor even the most immoral teacher and preceptor, because they are engaged in the work of the Buddha.

original: mchog tu tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchog tu tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The most immoral is

original: pham par gyur @48b pa thams cad kyi ltung ba byung ba'am /
analyzed: pham par gyur @48b pa thams cad kyi ltung ba byung ba'am /
translated: one who has committed all the downfalls that are declared to be grounds for defeat.

original: ltung ba sde lnga char gyi ltung ba byung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga char gyi ltung ba byung ba'o //
translated: One who has committed a downfall in any of the five classes of downfalls.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan po ni gal te mchog tu tshul khrims 'chal bar gyur kyang slob ma dang nye gnas tshul khrims dang ldan pas /
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan po ni gal te mchog tu tshul khrims 'chal bar gyur kyang slob ma dang nye gnas tshul khrims dang ldan pas /
translated: Even if a preceptor or instructor has the worst kind of immorality, a disciple or student should still serve and attend him,

original: bsnyen bkur bya ste /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ste /
translated: because he is a field of great merit.

original: g-yog bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yog bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he should be a servant.

original: de gnyis ni bstan pa la 'jug pa'i sgor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sdom pa skye ba dang / legs par bsrung ba dang / chos khong du chud pa'i rgyu yin pa'i yang phyir ro //🔽pha ma dang nad pa dag ni khyim pa yin na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis ni bstan pa la 'jug pa'i sgor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sdom pa skye ba dang / legs par bsrung ba dang / chos khong du chud pa'i rgyu yin pa'i yang phyir ro // pha ma dang nad pa dag ni khyim pa yin na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because these two are the door to entering the teaching, and because they are the cause for the arising of vows, for keeping them well, and for understanding the Dharma.🔽Even if one’s parents or a sick person are laypeople,

original: pha ma dang nad pa de dag ni khyim pa yin na yang bsnyen bkur bya ba ste /
analyzed: pha ma dang nad pa de dag ni khyim pa yin na yang bsnyen bkur bya ba ste /
translated: one should serve and attend them,🔽because they are a field of great merit.

original: g-yog bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: g-yog bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: This means that one should be their servant.

original: / yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra las ni rab tu byung ba yin na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra las ni rab tu byung ba yin na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, the word also indicates that it goes without saying that one should not kill those who are not ordained.

original: pha ma ni phan 'dogs pa'i zhing yin pa'i phyir dang / nad pa ni snying rje'i zhing yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pha ma ni phan 'dogs pa'i zhing yin pa'i phyir dang / nad pa ni snying rje'i zhing yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: One should not kill one's parents because they are fields of benefit, and one should not kill the sick because they are fields of compassion.

original: dkon mchog gsum pas kyang bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum pas kyang bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, One should honor even the three jewels.

original: khrus kyi zhar la legs par sbyar ba'i khrus kyis bkru'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /
analyzed: khrus kyi zhar la legs par sbyar ba'i khrus kyis bkru'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /
translated: One should bathe with a bath powder that is well prepared, it is said, in the course of a bath.

original: legs par sbyar ba'i khrus kyis ni nad dang nad pa ma yin pa yang bkru'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: legs par sbyar ba'i khrus kyis ni nad dang nad pa ma yin pa yang bkru'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: One should bathe with a bath powder that is well prepared, whether or not one is sick.

original: mdo 'di ni thams cad du gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni thams cad du gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This sūtra is included in all [the vinayas].

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir rlung 'dren pa'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu bskol bas khrus bya ba ni de'i ming yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir rlung 'dren pa'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu bskol bas khrus bya ba ni de'i ming yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to teach its essential nature, it is said, The name of that [bath powder] is the boiling of the roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits of the wind-drawing plant, and bathing with that.

original: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu rlung 'dren pa dag ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu rlung 'dren pa dag ste /
translated: The root, the trunk, the branches, the leaves, the flowers, and the fruits are the winds that are drawn in.

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa rlung 'dren pa de dag bskol ba des khrus bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa rlung 'dren pa de dag bskol ba des khrus bya ba ni /
translated: The bathing is done by the winds that draw in the root and so forth.

original: de'i ming yin te /
analyzed: de'i ming yin te /
translated: That is its name.

original: legs par sbyar ba'i khrus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: legs par sbyar ba'i khrus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “bathing of the well-prepared one.”

original: ci de 'ba' zhig kho nas bkru 'am zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci de 'ba' zhig kho nas bkru 'am zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Is it only that which cleanses?

original: bsku mnye byas te mi rtsub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsku mnye byas te mi rtsub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “after the massage, because of the smoothness.”

original: 'bru mar la sogs pas bsku mnye byas nas phyis bkru bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'bru mar la sogs pas bsku mnye byas nas phyis bkru bar bya ste /
translated: After the massage with oil and so forth, one should bathe afterwards.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi rtsub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the smoothness.

original: mi rtsub pa nyid dang ji ltar dbral dar bya zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtsub pa nyid dang ji ltar dbral dar bya zhe na /
translated: How is smoothness to be removed?

original: de'i phyir de dang dbral ba'i phyir khrus chal gyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang dbral ba'i phyir khrus chal gyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in order to remove that, with a cleansing bath.”

original: mi rtsub pa nyid kyi phyir bsku mnye byas pa de dang dbral ba'i phyir sran chung gi phye la sogs pa khrus chal gyis lus bskus te khrus bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa nyid kyi phyir bsku mnye byas pa de dang dbral ba'i phyir sran chung gi phye la sogs pa khrus chal gyis lus bskus te khrus bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since the body is not rough, it is rubbed with a paste of chickpea flour, etc. in order to remove the oiliness.

original: gal te khrus chal gyis lus bskus na'o na de nyid rtsub pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khrus chal gyis lus bskus na'o na de nyid rtsub pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If the body is rubbed with a paste, wouldn't that be rough?

original: de'i phyir @49a * //🔽snga ma'i ched du chu'i bum pa phyir mar snum thigs pa gnyis sam gsum blugs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir @49a * // snga ma'i ched du chu'i bum pa phyir mar snum thigs pa gnyis sam gsum blugs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore,🔽two or three drops of oil are poured into the second pitcher of water for the sake of the first.

original: snga ma mi rtsub pa nyid kyi phyir du phyis ldugs pa'i chu'i bum pa phyi mar snum thigs pa gnyis sam gsum dag blugs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma mi rtsub pa nyid kyi phyir du phyis ldugs pa'i chu'i bum pa phyi mar snum thigs pa gnyis sam gsum dag blugs so zhes bstan to //
translated: Two or three drops of oil are poured into the second pitcher of water for the sake of the first, which is not rough.

original: ma brtags pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽lcags kyi gzhong rings su khrus bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma brtags pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir / lcags kyi gzhong rings su khrus bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to show that this is not mere speculation,🔽it is said that the bath should be taken in an iron tub.

original: lcags kyi gzhong rings zhes bya ba ni gru chung du'i rnam pa 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: lcags kyi gzhong rings zhes bya ba ni gru chung du'i rnam pa 'dra ba yin te /
translated: An iron tub is shaped like a small boat.

original: der khrus bya'o //
analyzed: der khrus bya'o //
translated: One should bathe there.

original: khrus bzhin du thams cad kyis bcang bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khrus bzhin du thams cad kyis bcang bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to avoid the consequence that everyone should use it like a bath,

original: de ni nad pas bcang bar bya ba zhes bya ba 'di brjod de ;
analyzed: de ni nad pas bcang bar bya ba zhes bya ba 'di brjod de ;
translated: it is said, “It is to be used by the sick.”

original: lcags kyi gzhong rings de ni nad pa 'ba' zhig gis bcang bar bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lcags kyi gzhong rings de ni nad pa 'ba' zhig gis bcang bar bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: That iron basin is to be used only by the sick, not by others.

original: de'i steng du kha gab gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i steng du kha gab gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A lid should be placed over it.”

original: lcags kyi gzhong rings de'i steng du kha gab gzhug ste /
analyzed: lcags kyi gzhong rings de'i steng du kha gab gzhug ste /
translated: A lid should be placed over that iron basin.

original: chu dron mo yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽de gnya' bar sngas nang tshangs can gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu dron mo yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro // de gnya' bar sngas nang tshangs can gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order that the hot water will last a long time.🔽“A pillow filled with cotton should be placed under the chin.”

original: lcags kyi gzhong rings der gnya' ba'i phyogs su sngas nang tshangs can gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: lcags kyi gzhong rings der gnya' ba'i phyogs su sngas nang tshangs can gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: A pillow filled with cotton should be placed under the chin in that iron basin.

original: des yun ring du gnas pas gnya' ba na bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des yun ring du gnas pas gnya' ba na bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In order that the neck will not ache from remaining in that position for a long time.

original: khrus byas nas phyis rkang pa gnyis bkru bar bya ste /
analyzed: khrus byas nas phyis rkang pa gnyis bkru bar bya ste /
translated: After bathing, one should wash the feet afterwards.

original: de'i phyir gar bab bab tu rkang pa mi bkru'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gar bab bab tu rkang pa mi bkru'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, one should not wash one’s feet anywhere one likes.

original: khyams la sogs pa gar bab bab tu rkang pa gnyis mi bkru'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: khyams la sogs pa gar bab bab tu rkang pa gnyis mi bkru'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that one should not wash one’s feet anywhere one likes, such as in the courtyard.

original: de ni gtsug lag khang gi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gtsug lag khang gi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: This refers to the monastery.

original: 'o na gang du zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang du zhe na /
translated: But where, then?

original: de'i phyir de'i gnas ni wa khar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i gnas ni wa khar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “The place for that is the foot of the stairs.”

original: rkang pa bkru bde'i gnas ni wa kha yin par rig par bya'o //🔽'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rkang pa bkru bde'i gnas ni wa kha yin par rig par bya'o // 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The place for washing the feet is the foot of the stairs.

original: rkang pa wa khar bkru'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa wa khar bkru'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text states: “The Blessed One said, ‘Wash your feet at the foot of the stairs.’”

original: rkang khrus kyi gzhi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rkang khrus kyi gzhi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One should make a foot-washing place.”

original: bya'o zhes bya ba'i byed pa'i tshig dang por sbyar ba ni 'dod pas spyod pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽rkang khrus kyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba'i byed pa'i tshig dang por sbyar ba ni 'dod pas spyod pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro // rkang khrus kyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The optative ending is used in the first case to indicate that this is a matter of personal preference.🔽“Foot-washing place”

original: rkang pa bkru ba'i gnas zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: rkang pa bkru ba'i gnas zhes bya'o ;
translated: means a place for washing the feet.

original: / de ni thams cad kyi thun mong yin te /
analyzed: / de ni thams cad kyi thun mong yin te /
translated: It is common to all,

original: dge 'dun gyi phyogs su bya ba'i cho ga yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyogs su bya ba'i cho ga yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the rite to be performed in the direction of the Saṅgha.

original: phyogs gang du zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gang du zhe na /
translated: In which direction?

original: de'i phyir gtsug lag khang gi steng gi shar lho mtshams su'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsug lag khang gi steng gi shar lho mtshams su'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “in the southeast corner above the temple.”

original: gtsug lag khang gi steng zhes bya ba ni khang thog go //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi steng zhes bya ba ni khang thog go //
translated: “Above the temple” means on the roof.

original: gtsug lag khang gi sgo la @49b brten nas shar dang lho'i phyogs kyi bar grva'i mtshams su byed du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi sgo la @49b brten nas shar dang lho'i phyogs kyi bar grva'i mtshams su byed du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: It means that one should have it made in the corner between the east and south, in dependence on the door of the temple.

original: rnam pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of shape?

original: de'i phyir rus sbal gyi rnam pa 'dra ba rtsub par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rus sbal gyi rnam pa 'dra ba rtsub par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “in the shape of a tortoise, rough.”

original: gang gi rnam par ru sbal gyi rgyab 'dra ba de ni ru sbal gyi rnam pa 'dra ba ste de ltar ro //
analyzed: gang gi rnam par ru sbal gyi rgyab 'dra ba de ni ru sbal gyi rnam pa 'dra ba ste de ltar ro //
translated: That which has the shape of a tortoise’s back is in the shape of a tortoise.

original: rtsub par ro zhes bya ba ni rud rud por te /
analyzed: rtsub par ro zhes bya ba ni rud rud por te /
translated: “Rough” means uneven.

original: de ltar byed du gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar byed du gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It means that one should have it made in that way.

original: bde ba la reg par gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remain in contact with pleasure,

original: chol zangs sa las byas pa gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chol zangs sa las byas pa gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: a foot-washing basin should be placed.

original: chol zangs zhes bya ba ni rkang lag bkru ba'i snod do //
analyzed: chol zangs zhes bya ba ni rkang lag bkru ba'i snod do //
translated: A foot-washing basin is a vessel for washing the feet and hands.

original: ci las byas pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci las byas pa zhe na /
translated: What is it made of?

original: de'i phyir sa las byas pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa las byas pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be made of earth.

original: gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It should be placed, this is the meaning.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dang / shel las byas pa'i chol zangs dag bzhag par mi bya'i sa las byas pa gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽rgya cher 'grel pa byed pa la la 'di skad ces sa las byas pa zhes gnyis pa smos pa las na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dang / shel las byas pa'i chol zangs dag bzhag par mi bya'i sa las byas pa gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // rgya cher 'grel pa byed pa la la 'di skad ces sa las byas pa zhes gnyis pa smos pa las na /
translated: Here, the text says that a foot-washing basin made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, or crystal should not be placed, but one made of earth should be placed.

original: zangs las byas pa la sogs pa yang bkag par shes so zhes zer te /
analyzed: zangs las byas pa la sogs pa yang bkag par shes so zhes zer te /
translated: Some commentators on the Bodhisattvabhumi say that the second word, made of earth, indicates that a foot-washing basin made of copper, etc., is also prohibited.

original: de lta yin na shing la sogs pa yang bkag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na shing la sogs pa yang bkag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that were so, it would follow, absurdly, that one made of wood, etc., would also be prohibited.

original: sa las byas pa zhes gnyis pa smos pa las ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa las byas pa zhes gnyis pa smos pa las ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The second, “made of gold,” is an exception to the first.

original: sa las byas pa kho na'o zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas par byas pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: sa las byas pa kho na'o zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas par byas pa'i rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to assume that the exception is included in the first rule.

original: gser la sogs pa ni bkag par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa ni bkag par grub pa yin no //
translated: Gold, etc., are established as prohibited.

original: de lta bas na gtso bo gser la sogs pa bkag pa'i tshig gis ni zangs las byas pa la sogs pa ni bya bar shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtso bo gser la sogs pa bkag pa'i tshig gis ni zangs las byas pa la sogs pa ni bya bar shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement prohibiting gold, etc., is understood to prohibit the use of copper, etc.

original: dbyibs ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the shape?

original: de'i phyir / zhabs glang po che'i rmig mthil 'dra ba snying po can no zhes bya ba smras te /🔽chol zangs gang gi zhabs glang po che'i rmig mthil 'dra ba de ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir / zhabs glang po che'i rmig mthil 'dra ba snying po can no zhes bya ba smras te / chol zangs gang gi zhabs glang po che'i rmig mthil 'dra ba de ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The base is like the sole of an elephant’s foot and has a core.”🔽The base of a copper vessel is like the sole of an elephant’s foot.

original: zhabs glang po che'i rmig mthil 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: zhabs glang po che'i rmig mthil 'dra ba'o //
translated: That is the base like the sole of an elephant’s foot.

original: de ltar byed du gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar byed du gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The meaning is that one should cause it to be made in that way.

original: mi ldeg par gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽zhabs zhes bya ba ni 'og gi mthil lo //
analyzed: mi ldeg par gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro // zhabs zhes bya ba ni 'og gi mthil lo //
translated: In order to make it stable and not overturn.🔽“Base” means the lower surface.

original: snying po can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying po can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having a core” means

original: chol zangs gang la snying po yod pa de ni snying po can te /
analyzed: chol zangs gang la snying po yod pa de ni snying po can te /
translated: The essence of a vessel is that which is essential to it.

original: dbyibs de lta bu dang ldan pa de byed du gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbyibs de lta bu dang ldan pa de byed du gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should have it made with a shape like that.

original: snying po can zhes smras na /
analyzed: snying po can zhes smras na /
translated: If one says “with an essence,”

original: de phyogs gang na yod pa'i snying po dang ldan pa mi shes pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de phyogs gang na yod pa'i snying po dang ldan pa mi shes pas de'i phyir /
translated: one does not know which part has the essence, so it is said:

original: dbus na yod pa ka dam pa'i me tog 'dra la rtsub pa @50a * //
analyzed: dbus na yod pa ka dam pa'i me tog 'dra la rtsub pa @50a * //
translated: “In the middle, like a kadamba flower, rough and

original: dang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: with a handle.”

original: de dbus kyi phyogs na yod pa'i snying po dang ldan par byed du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dbus kyi phyogs na yod pa'i snying po dang ldan par byed du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one should have it made with an essence in the middle part.

original: rnam pa ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is its shape like?

original: de'i phyir / ka dam pa'i me tog 'dra la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ka dam pa'i me tog 'dra la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “like a kadamba flower,” and so on.

original: shing gdam pa'i me tog ltar dbyibs lcog lcog por 'dug la /
analyzed: shing gdam pa'i me tog ltar dbyibs lcog lcog por 'dug la /
translated: One should have a vessel made with a shape like a kadamba tree flower,

original: rtsub pa rud rud pa dang ldan pa'i chol zangs bcangs bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtsub pa rud rud pa dang ldan pa'i chol zangs bcangs bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: with a rough, uneven handle.

original: ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: How should it be held?

original: de'i phyir bkrus nas kha bub tu gzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bkrus nas kha bub tu gzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Having washed it, it should be placed upside down.”

original: chol zangs khas bub tu gzhag go //
analyzed: chol zangs khas bub tu gzhag go //
translated: The communal vessel should be placed upside down.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is that done?

original: bkrus nas te chu gzhan gyis bkru'i rkang pa bkrus pa'i chus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bkrus nas te chu gzhan gyis bkru'i rkang pa bkrus pa'i chus ni ma yin no //
translated: Having washed it, with another water, not with the water used to wash the feet.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas rkang pa bkrus pa'i chu gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol lam wa khar 'bor bcug ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas rkang pa bkrus pa'i chu gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol lam wa khar 'bor bcug ste /
translated: Here the text says, “Having washed both feet, the water used to wash the feet should be poured outside the monastery or into a gutter.

original: yang 'khrur bcug nas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang 'khrur bcug nas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Then, having washed it again, it should be placed upside down.”

original: gang du gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: Where should it be placed?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi ni khang thog du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi ni khang thog du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The communal vessel should be placed on the roof of the monastery.”

original: dge 'dun gyi chol zangs ni khang thog khang ba'i steng du gzhag go //🔽gang zag gi ni gnas khang du sgo glegs kyi phag tu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi chol zangs ni khang thog khang ba'i steng du gzhag go // gang zag gi ni gnas khang du sgo glegs kyi phag tu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The communal vessel should be placed on the roof of the monastery.🔽The individual vessel should be placed in the dwelling, behind the door bolt.

original: gnas khang der sgo glegs kyi phag tu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas khang der sgo glegs kyi phag tu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The text says, “In the dwelling, behind the door bolt.”

original: gang zag gi chol zangs ni sgo glegs dang rtsig pa'i bar der gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi chol zangs ni sgo glegs dang rtsig pa'i bar der gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The individual's copper vessel should be placed between the door and the wall.

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gang du lhung bzed kyi byi dor la sogs pa byas pa der chus byug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gang du lhung bzed kyi byi dor la sogs pa byas pa der chus byug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The place in the monastery where the monk performs the cleaning of the begging bowl, etc. should be sprinkled with water.

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gang du lhung bzad kyi byi dor la sogs pa byed pa'i phyogs de chus byug go //🔽sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyogs gang du lhung bzad kyi byi dor la sogs pa byed pa'i phyogs de chus byug go // sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The place in the monastery where the monk performs the cleaning of the begging bowl, etc. should be sprinkled with water.

original: tshon gyi las la sogs pa bsdus te ;
analyzed: tshon gyi las la sogs pa bsdus te ;
translated: The word etc. includes the work of dyeing, etc.

original: de'i phyogs chus byug go //
analyzed: de'i phyogs chus byug go //
translated: The place where that is done should be sprinkled with water.

original: yang na bsku'o zhes bya ba la bsku ba rnam pa ji lta bur bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang na bsku'o zhes bya ba la bsku ba rnam pa ji lta bur bya zhe na /
translated: Or, it should be smeared. What kind of smearing is done?

original: de'i phyir / mdud rtse'i rnam pa lta bu 'am rdza rnga'i rnam pa lta bur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mdud rtse'i rnam pa lta bu 'am rdza rnga'i rnam pa lta bur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be like the shape of a bird's beak or like the shape of a clay drum.

original: dbyibs de 'dra bar bsku ba'o //
analyzed: dbyibs de 'dra bar bsku ba'o //
translated: Smearing is done in that kind of shape.

original: bsku ba bstan na ji zhig gis bsku zhe na /
analyzed: bsku ba bstan na ji zhig gis bsku zhe na /
translated: If smearing is taught, what is it smeared with?

original: de'i phyir pa lang gi lci ba'am 'jim pas so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir pa lang gi lci ba'am 'jim pas so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be with cow dung or clay.

original: thams cad du yang rnam pa de ltar nges par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad du yang rnam pa de ltar nges par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Are the shapes of the precious substances always determined in this way?

original: de'i phyir dkon mchog gi don nyid du bsku ba la ni rnam pa nges pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dkon mchog gi don nyid du bsku ba la ni rnam pa nges pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says: There is no determination of shape in the case of consecration for the sake of the precious substances.

original: dkon mchog gi don nyid du bsku ba gang yin pa'i bsku ba de la ni dbyibs nges pa med do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gi don nyid du bsku ba gang yin pa'i bsku ba de la ni dbyibs nges pa med do //
translated: In the case of consecration for the sake of the precious substances, there is no determination of shape.

original: dkon mchog dag gi ched du bsku ba gang yin pa de ni dkon @50b mchog gi don to //
analyzed: dkon mchog dag gi ched du bsku ba gang yin pa de ni dkon @50b mchog gi don to //
translated: Consecration for the sake of the precious substances is consecration for the sake of the precious substances.

original: de'i dngos po ni dkon mchog gi don nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni dkon mchog gi don nyid de /
translated: The state of that is consecration for the sake of the precious substances.

original: dkon mchog gi don nyid du bsku ba de la ni dbyibs nges pa med do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gi don nyid du bsku ba de la ni dbyibs nges pa med do //
translated: There is no determination of shape in the case of consecration for the sake of the precious substances.

original: rab tu byung ba'i gzhi'i zhar la /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i gzhi'i zhar la /
translated: In the context of the basis of ordination,

original: lhung bzed med pa rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lhung bzed med pa rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says: One without a begging bowl should not be ordained or fully admitted.

original: lhung bzed med par dge tshul gyi mkhan po dang slob dpon dang ; zhu ba'i dge slong dag gis rab tu dbyung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed med par dge tshul gyi mkhan po dang slob dpon dang ; zhu ba'i dge slong dag gis rab tu dbyung bar mi bya ste /
translated: One without a begging bowl should not be ordained by the preceptor, the teacher, or the monk who asks, when he is a novice.

original: de lta bas na mkhan po la sogs pa de dag bsdu ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig tu bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mkhan po la sogs pa de dag bsdu ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig tu bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to include the preceptor and so on, the plural is used.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not give full ordination.

original: dge 'dun du 'gyur ba'i dge slong dag gis so //
analyzed: dge 'dun du 'gyur ba'i dge slong dag gis so //
translated: The monks who make up the saṃgha.

original: chung du dang chen po dang skyabs kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chung du dang chen po dang skyabs kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not give the lesser, greater, or refuge precepts.

original: lhung bzed chung du dang chen po dang skyabs rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed chung du dang chen po dang skyabs rab tu dbyung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not give the going forth and full ordination of the lesser, greater, or refuge precepts.

original: chung du dang chen pos mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pas /
analyzed: chung du dang chen pos mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pas /
translated: Because it was said, “One should not give the lesser or greater,” and so on,

original: de'i phyir lhung bzed byin gyis brlab tu rung ba gsum gyi tshad nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhung bzed byin gyis brlab tu rung ba gsum gyi tshad nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to know the definite measure of the three suitable for consecrating the alms bowl,

original: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang gis lhag bar 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa lhag pa nas do'i bar de shong ba de ni rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang gis lhag bar 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa lhag pa nas do'i bar de shong ba de ni rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba
translated: It is proper for the bowl to be filled to the brim with boiled rice, with a portion of lentil soup and vegetables, and to be able to hold one full hand span above the rim.

original: smras te / lhung bzed kyi smad kyi cha lhag mar 'bras thug po che bre'u chung gang btsos pa shong zhing chud pa'i lhung bzed gang yin pa de ni rigs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: smras te / lhung bzed kyi smad kyi cha lhag mar 'bras thug po che bre'u chung gang btsos pa shong zhing chud pa'i lhung bzed gang yin pa de ni rigs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The bowl is proper if it can hold boiled rice, with a portion of lentil soup and vegetables, and is filled to the brim so that one full hand span can be placed above the rim.

original: gang gi lhag mar zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi lhag mar zhe na /
translated: What is the brim?

original: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas zhes bya ba smras te /🔽de ni kha yang yin la /
analyzed: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas zhes bya ba smras te / de ni kha yang yin la /
translated: The brim is the very edge of the mouth.🔽The mouth is the brim,

original: cha yang yin pas kha'i cha'o //
analyzed: cha yang yin pas kha'i cha'o //
translated: thus it is the brim of the mouth.

original: kha'i cha'i mtha' ni mchu ste /🔽mu zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kha'i cha'i mtha' ni mchu ste / mu zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The brim of the mouth is the lips.🔽The edge is the end.

original: kha'i cha'i mtha' de kho na ni kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na'o //
analyzed: kha'i cha'i mtha' de kho na ni kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na'o //
translated: The very edge of the mouth is the very edge of the mouth.

original: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na de nas tshad ji tsam gyis zhe na ;
analyzed: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na de nas tshad ji tsam gyis zhe na ;
translated: How much is that?

original: de'i phyir mthe bo'i lto gang gi zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthe bo'i lto gang gi zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the size of a fist.”

original: mthe bo'i lto ni mthe bo'i lto ste /
analyzed: mthe bo'i lto ni mthe bo'i lto ste /
translated: The palm of the hand is called the “palm of the fist.”

original: mthe bo'i tshigs kyi phyogs gcig nas brtsams te /🔽tshigs kyi phyogs gcig gi bar ni mthe bo'i lto zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthe bo'i tshigs kyi phyogs gcig nas brtsams te / tshigs kyi phyogs gcig gi bar ni mthe bo'i lto zhes bya'o //
translated: Beginning from one side of the joint of the thumb🔽up to the other side of the joint, that is called the “palm of the fist.”

original: gang gi kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto'i tshad de nyid yod pa de ni mthe bo'i lto gang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto'i tshad de nyid yod pa de ni mthe bo'i lto gang ngo //
translated: The size of the palm of the fist is the measure of the mouth’s circumference.

original: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang bzhag pa de'i lhag ma smad kyi cha gang yin pa'i smad kyi lhag ma der shong ba'i lhung bzed gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang bzhag pa de'i lhag ma smad kyi cha gang yin pa'i smad kyi lhag ma der shong ba'i lhung bzed gang yin pa'o //
translated: The remaining lower part of the mouth’s circumference is the size of the bowl that fits into the remaining lower part.

original: ci zhig shong zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig shong zhe na /
translated: What does it hold?

original: de'i phyir 'bras thug po che ma gadh'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras thug po che ma gadh'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “a measure of cooked beans.”

original: 'bras thug po che ma gadhr'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa ni 'bras thug @51a * //🔽po che mag dh'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras thug po che ma gadhr'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa ni 'bras thug @51a * // po che mag dh'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa ste /
translated: A measure of rice is a small Magadha measure of rice.🔽A measure of soup is a small Magadha measure of soup.

original: de shong ba'o //
analyzed: de shong ba'o //
translated: That is the measure of the alms-bowl.

original: ci de 'ba' zhig gam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de 'ba' zhig gam zhe na /
translated: Is that all?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir / sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “together with a measure of soup and a measure of vegetables.”

original: 'di ltar tshod mdag mang ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshod mdag mang ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Although there is a great deal of vegetables,

original: 'on kyang tshod ma ji tsam gyis 'bras chan sbags nus pa de'i tshad kho na'i tshod ma 'dir gzung gi /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshod ma ji tsam gyis 'bras chan sbags nus pa de'i tshad kho na'i tshod ma 'dir gzung gi /
translated: only as much as can be mixed with the rice is to be accepted here.

original: lhag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The remainder is not.

original: de ni lhung bzed chung du'i tshad yin no //
analyzed: de ni lhung bzed chung du'i tshad yin no //
translated: That is the measure of the small alms-bowl.

original: 'brid dang chen po'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: 'brid dang chen po'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of the medium and large alms-bowls?

original: de'i phyir lhag pa nas do'i bar de shong zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhag pa nas do'i bar de shong zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “that which can contain more than that up to a doṇa.”

original: 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa las lhag pa nas bre'u chung dor ma chog pa'i bar sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa shong zhing de chud pa ni lhung bzed 'bring po'i tshad yin no //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang btsos pa las lhag pa nas bre'u chung dor ma chog pa'i bar sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa shong zhing de chud pa ni lhung bzed 'bring po'i tshad yin no //
translated: The measure of a medium alms bowl is the amount that can hold more than a cooked meal of one Magadha medium bushel of white rice, with soup and vegetables, up to a cooked meal of one and a half Magadha medium bushels of white rice, with soup and vegetables.

original: 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa bza' ba dang rjes su mthun pa de shong zhing chud pa'i lhung bzed gang yin pa de ni lhung bzed chen po'i tshad yin no //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa bza' ba dang rjes su mthun pa de shong zhing chud pa'i lhung bzed gang yin pa de ni lhung bzed chen po'i tshad yin no //
translated: The measure of a large alms bowl is the amount that can hold a cooked meal of one and a half Magadha medium bushels of white rice, with soup and vegetables, up to a cooked meal of two Magadha medium bushels of white rice, with soup and vegetables.

original: lhung bzed gsum po de ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: lhung bzed gsum po de ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: These three types of alms bowls are proper.

original: rigs pa las ma 'das pa ni rigs pa ste byin gyis brlab tu rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs pa las ma 'das pa ni rigs pa ste byin gyis brlab tu rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is not beyond what is proper is proper, which means it is suitable to be consecrated.

original: 'dir ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: 'dir ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: Here, the term “Magadha medium bushel”

original: 'bras thug po che skam po yul dbus kyi srang bcu drug brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che skam po yul dbus kyi srang bcu drug brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The measure of a dry prastha of rice in the Middle Country is to be understood as sixteen palas.

original: dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi tshad bstan nas dge slong ma rnams kyi brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi tshad bstan nas dge slong ma rnams kyi brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the measure of the monks’ alms-bowl, in order to teach the nuns’ measure,

original: dge slong mas dge slong gi chung du las lhag pa mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong gi chung du las lhag pa mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “A nun should not keep an alms-bowl larger than the smallest of the monks’ bowls.”

original: dge slong mas dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed chung du gang yin pa de las lhag pa'i lhung bzed mi bcang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed chung du gang yin pa de las lhag pa'i lhung bzed mi bcang ngo //
translated: A nun should not keep an alms-bowl larger than the smallest of the monks’ bowls.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed chung du gang yin pa de ni dge slong ma rnams kyi chen po yin te /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed chung du gang yin pa de ni dge slong ma rnams kyi chen po yin te /
translated: The smallest of the monks’ bowls is the largest of the nuns’ bowls.

original: de las lhag pa bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de las lhag pa bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not keep a bowl larger than that.

original: de dag gi lhung bzed chung du ni 'bras thug po che btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa 'grangs ba tsam shong ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi lhung bzed chung du ni 'bras thug po che btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa 'grangs ba tsam shong ba yin no //
translated: The smallest of their bowls is one that can hold a full measure of cooked rice with soup and vegetables.

original: 'bring ni de gnyis kyi bar gyi mtshams yin par don gyis khong du chud par bya'o /
analyzed: 'bring ni de gnyis kyi bar gyi mtshams yin par don gyis khong du chud par bya'o /
translated: The medium is to be understood by implication as being between those two.

original: // / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga pa /
translated: The basis of the bowl

original: lhung bzed kyi gzhi brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi gzhi brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to speak about the basis of the bowl,

original: des de'i gzhir zha nye'i dbyar 'dab gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des de'i gzhir zha nye'i dbyar 'dab gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he said, “She should place a piece of tin on it.”

original: des zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas so //
translated: “She” refers to the nun.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed kyi'o //
translated: “It” refers to the bowl.🔽“Basis” refers to the ground on which the bowl is placed.

original: gzhir zhes bya ba ni sa'i phyogs gang @51b du lhung bzed bzhag pa'i 'og gzhi gang yin pa de ni gzhi'o //🔽der zha nye'i dbyar 'dab gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhir zhes bya ba ni sa'i phyogs gang @51b du lhung bzed bzhag pa'i 'og gzhi gang yin pa de ni gzhi'o // der zha nye'i dbyar 'dab gzhag par bya ste /
translated: “On it” means on the basis.

original: der zha nye'i dbyar 'dab gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der zha nye'i dbyar 'dab gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “She should place a piece of tin on it” means she should place a piece of tin on it.

original: de'i rnam pa ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is its shape like?

original: de'i phyir / byang chub dang pa ta'i lo ma'am lag mthil gyi lta bur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / byang chub dang pa ta'i lo ma'am lag mthil gyi lta bur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it was said, “Like the leaf of a bodhi tree or the palm of the hand.”

original: byang chub kyi shing dang shing pa ta'i lo ma gang yin pa de'i dbyibs lta bur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing dang shing pa ta'i lo ma gang yin pa de'i dbyibs lta bur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the shape of the Bodhi tree and the leaves of the pāṭala tree.

original: yang na lag mthil gyi dbyibs ci 'dra ba de lta bu der gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽tshad shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na lag mthil gyi dbyibs ci 'dra ba de lta bu der gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro // tshad shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Or else, it is to be inserted in the shape of the palm of the hand.🔽In order to know the size, it is said:

original: tshad las kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshad las kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Also by the size.

original: kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also means

original: mdo snga ma drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdo snga ma drang ba'i don to //
translated: that the former sūtra is provisional.

original: de ltar na 'di tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, this is the meaning of the words:

original: byang chub kyi shing dang / shing pa ta'i lo ma tshad gang yin pa dang / lag mthil gyi tshad gang yin pa de'i tshad tsam du zha nye'i dbyar 'dab kyi tshad kyang rig par bya'o //🔽brnyan pos kyang de nyid dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing dang / shing pa ta'i lo ma tshad gang yin pa dang / lag mthil gyi tshad gang yin pa de'i tshad tsam du zha nye'i dbyar 'dab kyi tshad kyang rig par bya'o // brnyan pos kyang de nyid dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The size of the Bodhi tree and the leaves of the pāṭala tree, and the size of the palm of the hand, that is the size of the leaf of the śāṇapuspa tree.🔽Also by the model means

original: lhung bzed brnyan pos kyang de nyid dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: lhung bzed brnyan pos kyang de nyid dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: that the model of the alms bowl is also the same.

original: lhung bzed nyid dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhung bzed nyid dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is together with the begging bowl.

original: dbyar dag kyang brnyan pos lhung bzed dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: dbyar dag kyang brnyan pos lhung bzed dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: Also, during the rainy season, it is together with the begging bowl.

original: mtshungs pas 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mtshungs pas 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Since it is similar, it is taught to be the same.

original: lnga po dag de bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lnga po dag de bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The five are also like that.

original: lnga po yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lnga po yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The five are also like that.

original: chos gos gsum dang stan dang chu tshags so ;
analyzed: chos gos gsum dang stan dang chu tshags so ;
translated: The three robes, the sitting mat, and the water strainer.

original: / ji ltar lhung bzed brnyan pos de nyid dang bcas pa yin pa bzhin du lnga po yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / ji ltar lhung bzed brnyan pos de nyid dang bcas pa yin pa bzhin du lnga po yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the begging bowl is together with its own characteristics, the five are also like that. This is the meaning.🔽Here the treatise states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na yo byad drug po brnyas pa dag gis kyang rab tu dbyung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na yo byad drug po brnyas pa dag gis kyang rab tu dbyung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who have only six articles should also go forth.

original: dbyar dag lhung bzed med du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbyar dag lhung bzed med du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: A begging bowl is indispensable during the rainy season.

original: gang la lhung bzed med pa de ni lhung bzed med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la lhung bzed med pa de ni lhung bzed med pa ste /
translated: One who does not have a begging bowl is one who does not have a begging bowl.

original: dbyar dag lhung bzed med du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyar dag lhung bzed med du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that a bowl is indispensable in the rainy season.🔽One should not go wandering in the countryside.

original: lhung bzed med par ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed med par ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should not go wandering in the countryside without a bowl.🔽One should go with a small bowl in a dangerous place.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du lhung bzed chung dus 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba la 'jigs pa dang bcas par 'gro ba ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du lhung bzed chung dus 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba la 'jigs pa dang bcas par 'gro ba ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam mo //
translated: A dangerous place is a place where there is danger.

original: de'i dngos po ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The state of being dangerous is danger.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du gyur na /
translated: If one is in a dangerous place,

original: lhung bzed chung du thogs te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed chung du thogs te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: one should go with a small bowl.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here is the text: The Blessed One said:

original: dge slong @52a * //
analyzed: dge slong @52a * //
translated: “Monks,

original: gis lhung bzed med par ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gis lhung bzed med par ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: one should not go wandering in the countryside without a bowl.

original: ma byin par len pa dag gis bcom nas /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dag gis bcom nas /
translated: If it is destroyed by thieves,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:🔽“Monks,

original: lhung bzed chung du bskur bar bya zhing /🔽lhung bzed gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed chung du bskur bar bya zhing / lhung bzed gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: He should give him the smaller begging-bowl.🔽He should put the begging-bowl aside.

original: dbyar dag lhung bzed nye bar bzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyar dag lhung bzed nye bar bzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the rainy season he should put the begging-bowl aside.

original: med na rab tu dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med na rab tu dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not have one, he should be given the going forth.

original: lhung bzed med na'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed med na'o //
translated: If he does not have a begging-bowl.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: lhung bzed med na rab tu dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed med na rab tu dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: If he does not have a begging-bowl, he should be given the going forth.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be given full ordination.

original: 'greng bzhin du lhung bzed dbyung ba dang gzhug pa dang bskam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽'greng bzhin du lhung bzed kyi snod nas lhung bzed dbyung bar mi bya der gzhug par yang mi bya zhing /
analyzed: 'greng bzhin du lhung bzed dbyung ba dang gzhug pa dang bskam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni / 'greng bzhin du lhung bzed kyi snod nas lhung bzed dbyung bar mi bya der gzhug par yang mi bya zhing /
translated: He should not take out, put in, or dry the begging-bowl while standing.🔽He should not take out the begging-bowl from the begging-bowl container while standing, nor should he put it in there.

original: 'greng bzhin du lhung bzed bskam par yang mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'greng bzhin du lhung bzed bskam par yang mi bya ba ste /
translated: He should not dry the begging-bowl while standing.

original: de ni lhung bzed lhung ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lhung bzed lhung ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to avoid damaging the begging-bowl.

original: ran par spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ran par spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: He should use it appropriately.

original: ran par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ran par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, “appropriately” means

original: 'os par te des lhung bzed spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'os par te des lhung bzed spyad par bya'o //
translated: He should use the alms-bowl properly, i.e., in the proper manner.

original: ran par spyad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ran par spyad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the proper use, he says:

original: gzhan gyis spang ba der mi blugs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis spang ba der mi blugs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He should not pour into it what has been discarded by others.

original: snod la sogs pa gzhan gyis spang bar dor ba'i chus lhung bzed der mi blugs so //
analyzed: snod la sogs pa gzhan gyis spang bar dor ba'i chus lhung bzed der mi blugs so //
translated: He should not pour water into the alms-bowl which has been discarded by others in a vessel, etc.

original: des phyag dar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des phyag dar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not discard dirt with it.

original: lhung bzed des phyag dar mi dor ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed des phyag dar mi dor ro //
translated: He should not discard dirt with that alms-bowl.

original: ngan pa yang mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngan pa yang mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nor should he discard what is bad.

original: lhung bzed kyis mi dor ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyis mi dor ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase, “he should not discard what is bad” should be connected with the phrase, “with the alms-bowl.”

original: shing tog la sogs pa zos pa'i lhag ma shun pa la sogs pa ni ngan ba zhes bya'o //🔽lag pa dang kha'i chu mi blugs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing tog la sogs pa zos pa'i lhag ma shun pa la sogs pa ni ngan ba zhes bya'o // lag pa dang kha'i chu mi blugs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The peels, etc., of fruit, etc., that have been eaten are called “bad.”🔽He should not pour into it water from the mouth or from the hands.

original: lag pa bsnyal ba'i chu dang kha bkru ba'i chu lhung bzed du mi blugs pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa bsnyal ba'i chu dang kha bkru ba'i chu lhung bzed du mi blugs pa ste /
translated: He should not pour into the alms-bowl water from the mouth or from the hands.

original: de dag thams cad ni ma gus par spyod pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni ma gus par spyod pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All of this is in order to avoid disrespectful behavior.

original: dge tshul bag med pa'i chos can byi dor byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge tshul bag med pa'i chos can byi dor byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba la /
translated: A novice should not be made to clean the begging bowl, if he is a person who is heedless.

original: gang la bag med pa'i chos yod pa de ni bag med pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: gang la bag med pa'i chos yod pa de ni bag med pa'i chos can te /
translated: He who has the quality of heedlessness is a person who is heedless.

original: dge tshul de lhung bzed byi dor byed du mi gzhug go //
analyzed: dge tshul de lhung bzed byi dor byed du mi gzhug go //
translated: That novice should not be made to clean the begging bowl.

original: de ni 'chag pa la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'chag pa la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he would abandon walking and so forth.

original: bye ma can dang lci bas mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bye ma can dang lci bas mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not clean the begging bowl with sand or cow dung.

original: bye ma dang lhan cig 'dres pa ni bye ma can no //
analyzed: bye ma dang lhan cig 'dres pa ni bye ma can no //
translated: Sand is mixed with sand.

original: lci ba ni ba lang gi lci ba ste /
analyzed: lci ba ni ba lang gi lci ba ste /
translated: Cow dung is cow dung.

original: des lhung bzed byi dor mi bya'o //
analyzed: des lhung bzed byi dor mi bya'o //
translated: One should not clean the begging bowl with that.

original: de ni 'chas ba la sogs pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'chas ba la sogs pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one would abandon the faults of the bowl and so forth.

original: ha cang gsher bzhin du phyir mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ha cang gsher bzhin du phyir mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not turn the bowl over while it is still wet.

original: chu'i lhag ma yod bzhin du lhung bzed snod la sogs par @52b phyir mi gzhug mi sba ste /
analyzed: chu'i lhag ma yod bzhin du lhung bzed snod la sogs par @52b phyir mi gzhug mi sba ste /
translated: One should not turn the begging bowl over into a container and so forth while it is still wet, while there is still water in it.

original: de ni btsa' 'chags par 'gyur ba'i skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni btsa' 'chags par 'gyur ba'i skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one would abandon the fault of the bowl rusting.

original: ha cang bskam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ha cang bskam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not dry it too much.

original: lhung bzed ha cang rung bar 'gyur ba de ltar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed ha cang rung bar 'gyur ba de ltar mi bya ba ste /
translated: He should not make the bowl too smooth,

original: de ni rtsub pa nyid kyi skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //🔽rdo'i steng du mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni rtsub pa nyid kyi skyon spang ba'i phyir ro // rdo'i steng du mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because that is a fault of roughness.🔽He should not place it on stone.

original: re zhig kyang mi gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: re zhig kyang mi gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He should not place it on the ground.

original: mi gtsang ba'i phyogs su mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i phyogs su mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not place it in an unclean place.

original: lhung bzed ni shin tu rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gar bab bab tu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed ni shin tu rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro // gar bab bab tu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the bowl is very smooth.🔽He should not place it anywhere.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba dang mi gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba dang mi gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: He should not place it in any place.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words here is as follows.

original: khyams la sogs pa ma bshams pa'i phyogs gang yin pa der lhung bzed re zhig kyang mi gzhag go //
analyzed: khyams la sogs pa ma bshams pa'i phyogs gang yin pa der lhung bzed re zhig kyang mi gzhag go //
translated: He should not place the bowl anywhere, in an unprepared place such as a courtyard.

original: der mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not place it there.

original: gar bab bab der lhung bzed mi gzhag go //
analyzed: gar bab bab der lhung bzed mi gzhag go //
translated: He should not place the bowl anywhere.

original: 'di ni gtan du gzhag pa'i phyir dgag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan du gzhag pa'i phyir dgag pa yin gyi /
translated: This is a prohibition that is always to be observed,

original: re zhig kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: not just for a time.

original: lhung bzed dus thams cad du gzhag pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhung bzed dus thams cad du gzhag pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the place where the alms-bowl is always to be kept,

original: de'i ched du ngos khung bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i ched du ngos khung bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “For that purpose, a niche should be made.”

original: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For that purpose” means

original: lhung bzed gzhag pa'i ched du ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed gzhag pa'i ched du ste /
translated: for the purpose of keeping the alms-bowl.

original: ngos khung bya'o //
analyzed: ngos khung bya'o //
translated: “A niche should be made.”

original: khung bu ba lang gi mig gi dbyibs 'dra ba ni /
analyzed: khung bu ba lang gi mig gi dbyibs 'dra ba ni /
translated: A niche is like the shape of a cow’s eye.

original: ngos khung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngos khung zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a niche.

original: ngos khung ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ngos khung ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How is the niche to be made?

original: de'i phyir / gtsug lag khang dang khang khyim dag rtsig pa'i tshe bya'i rtsig pa brko bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gtsug lag khang dang khang khyim dag rtsig pa'i tshe bya'i rtsig pa brko bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “When building a monastery or house, it should not be dug out with a crowbar.”

original: gtsug lag khang dang khang khyim dag byed pa'i tshe na ngos khung bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang khang khyim dag byed pa'i tshe na ngos khung bya'o //
translated: When building a monastery or house, the niche should be made.

original: brko bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brko bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It should not be dug out” means

original: gtsug lag khang byas zin pa'i rtsig pa brko ba'i thabs kyis ni ma yin te de ni grong 'dab pa rnams kyi cho ga bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang byas zin pa'i rtsig pa brko ba'i thabs kyis ni ma yin te de ni grong 'dab pa rnams kyi cho ga bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not by the method of digging into the walls of a monastery that has already been built. That is the procedure taught for those living near a village.

original: da ni dgon pa pa rnams kyi ched du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dgon pa pa rnams kyi ched du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach for those living in the wilderness,

original: dgon pa pa rnams kyis skon bu kha sbyar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dgon pa pa rnams kyis skon bu kha sbyar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that those living in the wilderness should use a container with a lid.

original: dge slong dgon pa pa rnams kyis lhung bzed gzhag pa'i skon bu kha sbyar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa pa rnams kyis lhung bzed gzhag pa'i skon bu kha sbyar bya'o //
translated: Monks living in the wilderness should use a container with a lid to store their alms bowls.

original: de ci las bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci las bya zhe na /
translated: What is it made of?

original: de'i phyir lcug ma'am srad bu las bas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lcug ma'am srad bu las bas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said that it is made of bamboo or string.🔽It is made of bamboo,

original: lcug ma las bsgyur ba'am /🔽srad bu las bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: lcug ma las bsgyur ba'am / srad bu las bsgyur ba ste /
translated: or🔽made of string.

original: srad bu las byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srad bu las byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is made of string.

original: bsgyur ba ni byas pa yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgyur ba ni byas pa yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word made is used to show that it is constructed.

original: lci ba dang sas byugs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lci ba dang sas byugs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is smeared with cow dung or clay.

original: byugs pa'i skon bu kha sbyar bya'o //
analyzed: byugs pa'i skon bu kha sbyar bya'o //
translated: A container with a lid should be smeared.

original: ci zhig gis byugs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig gis byugs she na /
translated: With what is it smeared?

original: lci ba dang sas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lci ba dang sas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and with cowdung and earth means

original: ba lang gi lci ba dang sar bsres @53a * //
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba dang sar bsres @53a * //
translated: mixed with cowdung and earth.

original: pa ste des byugs pa'o //
analyzed: pa ste des byugs pa'o //
translated: It is smeared with that.

original: kha gab rnam pa de lta bu dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /🔽kha gab de rnam pa de lta bu yin pa ni /
analyzed: kha gab rnam pa de lta bu dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la / kha gab de rnam pa de lta bu yin pa ni /
translated: With a lid of that kind means🔽that lid is of that kind.

original: kha gab rnam pa de lta bu ste /
analyzed: kha gab rnam pa de lta bu ste /
translated: That kind is of that kind.

analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: lcug ma las byas pa'am /

analyzed: srad bu lam byas pa lci ba dang sar bsres pas byugs pa'o // kha gab rnam pa de lta bu dang ldan pa ni /

original: kha gab rnam pa de lta bu dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: kha gab rnam pa de lta bu dang bcas pa ste /

analyzed: de ni gzar thag gis shing las dpyangs na bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

original: ci zhig gis she na /

original: gzar thag gis te /

analyzed: thag pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de'i phyir skon bu kha sbyar la mkha' 'phreng zhes kyang bya'o //

analyzed: sa la mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /

original: skon bu kha sbyar sa la gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: skon bu kha sbyar sa la gzhag par mi bya'o //

analyzed: tshig de ni sril za ba la sogs pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ni khur khyer ba la sogs pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'o na gar bcug ste bskur bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /

original: 'o na cis bskur zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir de bskur ba ni lung thag btags te mchan khung gis so zhes bya ba smras te /

original: lhung bzed de bskur ba'o //🔽lung btags te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed de bskur ba'o // lung btags te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That alms bowl is carried.🔽“Having been designated” means

original: lhung bzed snod kyi lung btags te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhung bzed snod kyi lung btags te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: having been designated as a religious object.

original: lus kyi yan lag gang gis bskur zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag gang gis bskur zhe na /

original: de'i phyir mchan khung gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mchan khung gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “by the armpit.”

original: mchan 'og tu bcangs te bskur ro //
analyzed: mchan 'og tu bcangs te bskur ro //
translated: It is carried under the arm.

analyzed: lhung bzed kyi snod kyi zhar la lhung bzed dang sman dang bar bur dag snod tha dad par gzhug go zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /

analyzed: lhung bzed dang sman dang / ngar bur dag ni de dag nyid do //

analyzed: de ltar na lhung bzed la sogs pa de dag snod gsum po dag tu so sor gzhug par bya'i /

original: thams cad gcig tu ni mi gzhug go //
analyzed: thams cad gcig tu ni mi gzhug go //

original: skud ma dang khab ral dang ldan pa la sogs pa dag ni /
analyzed: skud ma dang khab ral dang ldan pa la sogs pa dag ni /

original: bar bur gyi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: bar bur gyi sgras brjod do //

analyzed: de dag bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa'i snod dag go //
translated: “They should be carried” means the bowl and so on.

original: de dag la @53b dpyang ba'i lung thag mnyam par gdags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag la @53b dpyang ba'i lung thag mnyam par gdags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: lung thag gang dag gi dpyang ba mtho dman mnyam par gyur pa de dag ni dpyang pa'i lung thag mnyam pa'o //
translated: The ropes for hanging them are even when they are neither too high nor too low.

original: de bas na snod gsum po de dag la dpyang ba'i lung thag mnyam pa de dag gdags pa gzhag par mi bya mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na snod gsum po de dag la dpyang ba'i lung thag mnyam pa de dag gdags pa gzhag par mi bya mi sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, one should not hang the three vessels on uneven ropes.

original: 'di skad bstan te ;
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te ;
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: snod de dag la dpyang ba'i lung thag srid mnyam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snod de dag la dpyang ba'i lung thag srid mnyam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ropes for hanging the vessels should not be uneven.

original: de ltar yang gleng gzhi ni 'phags pa 'di ci /
analyzed: de ltar yang gleng gzhi ni 'phags pa 'di ci /
translated: What is the background story here?

original: rdza rnga'am zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rdza rnga'am zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: sdug bsngal mi 'dod pas ni zheng chung du dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Because of not wanting suffering, even small ones” means that

analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba las ni snod de dag la lung thag btags pa zheng chung du dag kyang mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal mi 'dod pas ni zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: gang sdug bsngal 'dod par mi byed pa'i gang zag de ni sdug bsngal mi 'dod pa ste /

analyzed: des de dag kyang mi bya'o // zhum par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir dbus su phying bus sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That person should not make the cords too short.🔽In order to prevent the cords from sagging, one should fasten them in the middle means

analyzed: lung thag de dag zhum par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir phying bus sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: phyogs gang du phying bus sbyar bar bya zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / dbus su zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: lung thag gi zhes bya ba bar skabs las shes par 'gyur te /

analyzed: phying bu stug pos sbyar par bya'o // de gnas par bya ba'i phyir mdo mdor bya rog rkang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: phying bu de gnas pa mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir mdo mdor skabs skabs su bya rog rkang gi gzungs gdab par bya ste /

analyzed: bya rog rkang gi dbyibs 'dra bar drub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: lhung bzed yongs su bskyang ba'i bye brag bstan nas /

analyzed: shin tu gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir mig dpe nyid du gzhag go //
translated: The eyes are used as an example to generate great respect.

original: snam sbyar pags pa 'dra bar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snam sbyar pags pa 'dra bar ro zhes bya ba ni /

original: ji ltar pags pa rlung dang nyi ma dang char pa la sogs pa dag las bskyab par bya ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar pags pa rlung dang nyi ma dang char pa la sogs pa dag las bskyab par bya ba ltar /

analyzed: dge slong gis snam sbyar yang de bzhin du bskyab par bya ba'o //

analyzed: chos gos lhag ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni / pags pa dang 'dra bar bskyab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar @54a * //
translated: The remaining robes are also like that.🔽The remaining robes are also like skin, in that they should protect.

analyzed: ro ; / dran par spyad pa'i zhar la chos gos la sogs pa de dag yongs su bskyab par bstan to //
translated: In the course of practicing mindfulness, the Buddha taught that one should protect the robes, etc.

original: gal te lhung bzed la sogs pa dag longs spyod na dengs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te lhung bzed la sogs pa dag longs spyod na dengs par gyur na /
translated: If one uses the alms bowl, etc., and they become damaged,

original: de'i tshe de ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: what should one do then?

analyzed: de'i phyir bcos legs bya ba yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba smras te / lhung bzed kyi bcos legs ni glan pa dang bsreg pa dang / snum gyis bsku ba dang / byi dor bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “one should not neglect to repair them well.”🔽The repair of the alms bowl is to mend it, burn it, anoint it with oil, rub it, etc.

original: chos gos kyi bcos legs ni /
analyzed: chos gos kyi bcos legs ni /
translated: The repair of the robes is to sew them, etc.

original: bkru ba dang / drub pa dang / kha bsgyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bkru ba dang / drub pa dang / kha bsgyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: washing, sewing, dyeing, etc.

original: de dag bya ba yal bar mi dor te /
analyzed: de dag bya ba yal bar mi dor te /
translated: One should not neglect those activities.

original: der lhung blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der lhung blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should take up what has fallen.

original: bcos legs bya ba smras na /
analyzed: bcos legs bya ba smras na /
translated: If one says, “I will do a good repair,”

original: de ji zhig dang ji ltar dang gang du bya ba de mi shes pas /
analyzed: de ji zhig dang ji ltar dang gang du bya ba de mi shes pas /
translated: one does not know what, how, and where to do it.

original: de'i phyir 'di man chad de dag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di man chad de dag brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, from here on, those should be stated.

original: lhung bzed glan pa la nan tan du bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed glan pa la nan tan du bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should be diligent in mending the alms-bowl.

original: dge slong gis lhung bzed glan pa la nan tan bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis lhung bzed glan pa la nan tan bya ste /
translated: A monk should be diligent in mending the alms-bowl.

original: las su bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las su bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should do the work.

original: lag bzo'i tha snyad bsal ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: lag bzo'i tha snyad bsal ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to eliminate the convention of craft,

original: dben pa'i phyogs su'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dben pa'i phyogs su'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: in a secluded place.

original: de la mgar spyad dag dgos pa gang zag gis bsrel ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mgar spyad dag dgos pa gang zag gis bsrel ba tshul dang mthun pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, in order to show that it is not proper for an individual to use the smith’s tools for their own purposes,

original: dge 'dun gyis mgar spyad dag bsrel bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis mgar spyad dag bsrel bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that the smith’s tools should be used by the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi mgar spyad dag bsrel bar bya'i gang zag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mgar spyad dag bsrel bar bya'i gang zag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: The Sangha should be asked to provide a metal bowl, not an individual.

original: lhung bzed glan pa la nan tan bya'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: lhung bzed glan pa la nan tan bya'o zhes smras na /
translated: If one says, “Strive to repair a broken bowl,”

original: gang la jis glan pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la jis glan pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: one should say, “Repair the one you have.”

original: re zhig dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the prohibition,

original: bu gu'i lhan pa bu ram dang rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma dang / spra tshil dang ro nye dang tshon mo steng de dag mi bzang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bu gu'i lhan pa bu ram dang rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma dang / spra tshil dang ro nye dang tshon mo steng de dag mi bzang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “It is not good to use molasses, lac, resin, lead, or red chalk to repair a crack in a metal bowl.”

original: mi bzang ba ni cha ma yin no //
analyzed: mi bzang ba ni cha ma yin no //
translated: “Not good” means it is not proper.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: bu gu'i lhan par bu ram dang rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma dang / sbra tshil dang ro nye dang tshon mo steng dag mi rung ste /
analyzed: bu gu'i lhan par bu ram dang rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma dang / sbra tshil dang ro nye dang tshon mo steng dag mi rung ste /
translated: It is not proper to use molasses, lac, resin, lead, or red chalk to repair a crack in a metal bowl.

original: mi sra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not hard.

original: 'o na gang bzang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang bzang zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “What is good?”

original: de'i phyir lhan rings dang tham phran dang lhan pa chu srin gyi so lta bu dag bzang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan rings dang tham phran dang lhan pa chu srin gyi so lta bu dag bzang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said, “It is good to use a metal alloy, tin, or a metal bowl that resembles the tooth of a crocodile.”

original: bzang ba ni cha ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzang ba ni cha ma yin pa'o //
translated: The good is the patch.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
