analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: bu gu'i lhan par bu ram dang / rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma dang / spra tshil dang ro nye dang tsho na mo'o //
analyzed: bu gu'i lhan par bu ram dang / rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma dang / spra tshil dang ro nye dang tsho na mo'o //
translated: The patch for a hole is molasses, a piece of lac tree, lac, and lead.

original: bu gu'i lhan par lhan rings la sogs pa dag rung ste /
analyzed: bu gu'i lhan par lhan rings la sogs pa dag rung ste /
translated: The patch for a hole is suitable for a patch, etc.

original: sra ba'i phyir ro //🔽lhung bzed kyi lhan pa lcags las byas pa'i ring po ni lhan rings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sra ba'i phyir ro // lhung bzed kyi lhan pa lcags las byas pa'i ring po ni lhan rings zhes bya'o //
translated: because it is hard.🔽The long iron patch for a bowl is called a patch.

original: bu gu dgag pa'i lcags gzer mgo @54b leb ni tham phran zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bu gu dgag pa'i lcags gzer mgo @54b leb ni tham phran zhes bya'o //
translated: The iron nail with a flat head that blocks a hole is called a small nail.

original: lcags kyi lhan pa de nyid gru bzhi'am zlum po'am zur gsum du byas pa ni lhan pa yin no //
analyzed: lcags kyi lhan pa de nyid gru bzhi'am zlum po'am zur gsum du byas pa ni lhan pa yin no //
translated: That very iron patch, made square, round, or triangular, is a patch.

original: de nyid kyi mtha' thams cad sog le'i so lta bu dang ldan pa ni chu srin gyi so lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi mtha' thams cad sog le'i so lta bu dang ldan pa ni chu srin gyi so lta bu yin no //
translated: That very thing, with all its edges like a saw, is like a crocodile's tooth.

original: phye mas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phye mas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also with powder.

original: lcags kyi'am rdo'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: lcags kyi'am rdo'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: This is to be connected with like iron or stone.

original: lcags kyi'am rdo'i phye mas glan na bzang ngo //
analyzed: lcags kyi'am rdo'i phye mas glan na bzang ngo //
translated: It is good if it is covered with powder of iron or stone.

original: 'og ma dang sbyar ba'i don du rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'og ma dang sbyar ba'i don du rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: The term “and so on” is used to indicate that the other examples are similar to this one.

original: 'bru mar dang bdar ba spra tshil 'dra ba la thug par gyur pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bru mar dang bdar ba spra tshil 'dra ba la thug par gyur pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The flour and oil are kneaded together until they form a lump like a lump of clay.

original: phye mas glan pa 'ba' zhig la yin gyi lhan rings la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phye mas glan pa 'ba' zhig la yin gyi lhan rings la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: This is said only with regard to flour and water, not with regard to flour and oil-cakes, etc.

original: 'bru mar dang phye ma lhan cig bdar ba ni 'bru mar bdar ba'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar dang phye ma lhan cig bdar ba ni 'bru mar bdar ba'o //
translated: The flour and oil are kneaded together, i.e., mixed together.

original: ji srid du bdar ba zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid du bdar ba zhe na /
translated: For how long are they kneaded?

original: de'i phyir spra tshil 'dra ba la thug par gyur pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spra tshil 'dra ba la thug par gyur pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “until they form a lump like a lump of clay.”

original: phye ma de spra tshil 'dra ba la thug par gyur pa'i bar du bdar bas so //
analyzed: phye ma de spra tshil 'dra ba la thug par gyur pa'i bar du bdar bas so //
translated: The flour and oil are kneaded together until they form a lump like a lump of clay.

original: rdzas ci zhig gis bdar bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas ci zhig gis bdar bar bya zhe na /
translated: By what substance are they kneaded?

original: de'i phyir lcags sam ku ru bin das so zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir lcags sam ku ru bin das so zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: Therefore, it is said: “with iron or with a Kuruvinda.”

original: ku ru bin da zhes bya ba ni rdo'i bye brag go //
analyzed: ku ru bin da zhes bya ba ni rdo'i bye brag go //
translated: A Kuruvinda is a type of stone.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: 'bru mar dang phye mar bsres nas lcags sam rngo ku ru bin das ji srid du spra tshil 'dra bar gyur pa de srid du bdar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bru mar dang phye mar bsres nas lcags sam rngo ku ru bin das ji srid du spra tshil 'dra bar gyur pa de srid du bdar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Mix the flour with oil and knead it with an iron or stone spatula until it becomes like a lump of clay.

original: dro ba la glan no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dro ba la glan no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said to be heated on a stove.

original: lhung bzed dro ba la phye ma bdar bas glan pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dro ba la phye ma bdar bas glan pa'o //
translated: The flour paste is applied to the hot alms-bowl.

original: gro pas g-yogs te 'jim pas bskus la ci ran tsam du bsro'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gro pas g-yogs te 'jim pas bskus la ci ran tsam du bsro'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said to be covered with cloth and smeared with clay, and heated as much as necessary.🔽The cloth is spread over the hot alms-bowl to which the flour paste has been applied.

original: lhung bzed dron po la phye ma bdar ba des glan pa'i sten gdu gro bas g-yogs te bkab nas de'i steng du 'jim pas bskus la ci ran tsam du bsro bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dron po la phye ma bdar ba des glan pa'i sten gdu gro bas g-yogs te bkab nas de'i steng du 'jim pas bskus la ci ran tsam du bsro bar bya'o //
translated: It is covered with cloth and smeared with clay on top of that, and heated as much as necessary.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gang gi tshe lhung bzed la phye ma btags pa des glan pa de'i tshe gro bas g-yogs par bya zhing /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gang gi tshe lhung bzed la phye ma btags pa des glan pa de'i tshe gro bas g-yogs par bya zhing /
translated: This is what is taught.🔽When the alms-bowl is smeared with the flour paste, at that time it is covered with cloth.

original: gro ba'i steng du 'jim pas bsku bar byas la /
analyzed: gro ba'i steng du 'jim pas bsku bar byas la /
translated: The cloth is covered with clay.

original: de'i 'og tu lhung bzed ci ran tsam du bsro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhung bzed ci ran tsam du bsro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Then, it should be heated as much as necessary.

original: 'bru mar gyis bdar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bru mar gyis bdar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be anointed with oil means

original: lhung bzed la lhan pa glan pa 'bru mar gyis sbyangs la rdo 'jam po la sogs pas bdar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed la lhan pa glan pa 'bru mar gyis sbyangs la rdo 'jam po la sogs pas bdar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: that a patch should be applied to the begging bowl with oil, and then it should be polished with a smooth stone, and so on.

original: lcags kyi lhan pa bstan nas /
analyzed: lcags kyi lhan pa bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the iron patch,

original: sa las byas pa'i lhan pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: sa las byas pa'i lhan pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: how is the earthen patch to be applied?

original: de'i phyir sa las byas pa'i ni bu ram dang 'jim pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa las byas pa'i ni bu ram dang 'jim pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The earthen one is with molasses and clay.”

original: sa las byas pa'i lhung bzed la ni bu ram dang 'jim pa bsres pas glan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa las byas pa'i lhung bzed la ni bu ram dang 'jim pa bsres pas glan par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the earthen begging bowl is to be patched with a mixture of molasses and clay.

original: @55a * // glan pa de yang snga ma bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: @55a * // glan pa de yang snga ma bzhin du bya ste /
translated: That patch should be applied as before,

original: 'bru mar dang bdar ba spra tshil 'dra ba la thug par gyur pas dro ba la glan nas gro bas g-yogs te /
analyzed: 'bru mar dang bdar ba spra tshil 'dra ba la thug par gyur pas dro ba la glan nas gro bas g-yogs te /
translated: with oil and polishing, until it is like beeswax. It should be applied while warm, and then covered with a cloth.

original: 'jim pas bskus la ci ran tsam du bsro nas 'bru mar gyis bdar ro zhes sngar bstan pa de dag thams cad 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jim pas bskus la ci ran tsam du bsro nas 'bru mar gyis bdar ro zhes sngar bstan pa de dag thams cad 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and then, having anointed it with clay, one should heat it as much as necessary and then oil it.

original: glan pa bstan nas /
analyzed: glan pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the mending,

original: bsreg pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsreg pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to speak about the burning,

original: spyod pa nyid yin na zla ba drug gi 'og tu bsreg pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: spyod pa nyid yin na zla ba drug gi 'og tu bsreg pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “If it is a bowl user, then after six months it is to be burned.”

original: lhung bzed spyod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: lhung bzed spyod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it is a bowl user,

original: zla ba drug gi 'og tu bsreg pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: zla ba drug gi 'og tu bsreg pa nyid yin te /
translated: then after six months it is to be burned,

original: bsreg par 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsreg par 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it is suitable to be burned.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te nyin gcig bzhin du lhung bzed nges zas kyi bya ba byed na de'i tshe lhung bzed de zla ba drug gi mthar bsreg par 'os par 'gyur bas de'i dus su bsreg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te nyin gcig bzhin du lhung bzed nges zas kyi bya ba byed na de'i tshe lhung bzed de zla ba drug gi mthar bsreg par 'os par 'gyur bas de'i dus su bsreg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one uses the bowl every day for the purpose of eating, then at the end of six months that bowl is suitable to be burned, so it should be burned at that time. This is the meaning.

original: sa las byas pa'i lhung bzed kyi bsreg pa'i dus bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa las byas pa'i lhung bzed kyi bsreg pa'i dus bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the time for burning a bowl made of clay,🔽he says,

original: gal te sa las byas pa yin na zla ba phyed na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te sa las byas pa yin na zla ba phyed na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it is made of clay, then after half a month.

original: gal te sa las byas pa'i lhung bzed nar mar spyod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te sa las byas pa'i lhung bzed nar mar spyod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the begging bowl is made of clay and is used for a long time,

original: de ni zla ba phyed kyi mthar bsreg par 'os pa nyid du 'gyur bas de'i dus su bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zla ba phyed kyi mthar bsreg par 'os pa nyid du 'gyur bas de'i dus su bsreg par bya'o //
translated: then after half a month it becomes fit to be burned.

original: gal te lhung bzed kyang bsreg par 'os par gyur la dbyar kyang nye bar gnas par gyur na de'i tshe ji ltar longs spyad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhung bzed kyang bsreg par 'os par gyur la dbyar kyang nye bar gnas par gyur na de'i tshe ji ltar longs spyad par bya zhe na /
translated: If the begging bowl becomes fit to be burned and the rainy season retreat is approaching, how should one act?

original: de'i phyir gal te dbyar byung na de bya ba'i bar du bsku ba dang rtsub khrus nyid kyis legs par bcos pa nyid bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te dbyar byung na de bya ba'i bar du bsku ba dang rtsub khrus nyid kyis legs par bcos pa nyid bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: If the rainy season retreat has arrived, it should be repaired with plaster and a bath, until it is time to burn it.

original: gal te dbyar gyi dus byung bar gyur na /🔽de'i tshe lhung bzed de spyod pa'i thabs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te dbyar gyi dus byung bar gyur na / de'i tshe lhung bzed de spyod pa'i thabs ni 'di yin te /
translated: If the rainy season retreat has arrived,🔽this is the method for using the begging bowl.

original: bsod snyoms kyis blang ba dang bza' ba 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni lhung bzed kyi bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyis blang ba dang bza' ba 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni lhung bzed kyi bya ba yin no //
translated: The begging bowl is used for receiving alms and for holding food.

original: de yang nyin gcig bzhin 'byung bas du ma yod de du ma de'i bar ni bsod snyoms 'dzin pas stong pa'i dus te /
analyzed: de yang nyin gcig bzhin 'byung bas du ma yod de du ma de'i bar ni bsod snyoms 'dzin pas stong pa'i dus te /
translated: The period between many such periods is the time of emptiness of the alms-round.

original: de yang zan zos pa'i 'og tu phan chad phyi de nyin par bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i mdun tshun chad kyi bar ro //
analyzed: de yang zan zos pa'i 'og tu phan chad phyi de nyin par bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i mdun tshun chad kyi bar ro //
translated: Moreover, it is the period from after eating food until the next day when one goes on the alms-round.

original: der bsod snyoms bza' ba la sogs pa byas nas 'bru mar la sogs pas bsku ba bya ste /
analyzed: der bsod snyoms bza' ba la sogs pa byas nas 'bru mar la sogs pas bsku ba bya ste /
translated: Having eaten alms-food there, one should anoint with oil, etc.,

original: gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and then put it aside.

original: yang phyi de nyin par bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i tshe lci skam la sogs pas rtsub khrus bya'o //
analyzed: yang phyi de nyin par bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i tshe lci skam la sogs pas rtsub khrus bya'o //
translated: Then, when one goes on the alms-round the next day, one should rub it with dry earth, etc.,

original: de'i 'og tu yang zas kyi bya ba byas nas phyi de nyin par bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i dus kyi bya ba'i bar du 'bru mar la sogs @55b pas bskus te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang zas kyi bya ba byas nas phyi de nyin par bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i dus kyi bya ba'i bar du 'bru mar la sogs @55b pas bskus te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and then, after eating food, one should anoint with oil, etc., up to the time of going on the alms-round the next day, and then put it aside.

original: bsku ba dang rtsub khrus nyid ni bsku ba dang / rtsub khrus nyid de /
analyzed: bsku ba dang rtsub khrus nyid ni bsku ba dang / rtsub khrus nyid de /
translated: Anointing and rubbing is just anointing and rubbing.

original: bsku ba dang rtsub khrus de nyid kyis lhung bzed de'i bya ba'i bar du legs par bcos pa nyid bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽de bsreg par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsku ba dang rtsub khrus de nyid kyis lhung bzed de'i bya ba'i bar du legs par bcos pa nyid bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro // de bsreg par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the washing and scrubbing should be done well until the bowl’s function is restored.🔽It should be burned.

original: lhung bzed de'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed de'o //
translated: This refers to that bowl.

original: lhung bzed bsreg par bya ba'i bsreg pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhung bzed bsreg par bya ba'i bsreg pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the method of burning the bowl,

original: de'i ched du rdza bo bsrel bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i ched du rdza bo bsrel bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “For that purpose, a kiln should be built.”

original: lhung bzed bsreg pa de'i ched du rdza bo bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed bsreg pa de'i ched du rdza bo bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of burning the bowl, a kiln should be made.

original: de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i phyir de nyid du grub pa'am dbyib mo yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid du grub pa'am dbyib mo yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “Either in that very place or elsewhere.”

original: de nyid du grub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid du grub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that very place.

original: rdza bo de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: rdza bo de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The nature of that kiln is that very place.

original: de nyid kho nar gyur pa ni de nyid du grub pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kho nar gyur pa ni de nyid du grub pa ste /
translated: That very place is in that very place.

original: gang rdza bo'i gzugs nyid du grub pa'o //
analyzed: gang rdza bo'i gzugs nyid du grub pa'o //
translated: That which is established as the form of the kiln is that very place.

original: ci de kho nas bya ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de kho nas bya ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is that all that should be done?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir dbyib mo yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir dbyib mo yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, therefore it is suitable to use a clay pot.

original: bsrel bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsrel bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word “should” is supplied.

original: dbyib mo'i bdag nyid kyi rdza bo bya ba'i thabs su rung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbyib mo'i bdag nyid kyi rdza bo bya ba'i thabs su rung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the method for making a suitable clay pot,

original: thal bas bkang ste rdza gzong gis brkos na bzang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: thal bas bkang ste rdza gzong gis brkos na bzang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said: “It is good to fill it with ashes and dig it out with a metal awl.”

original: dbyib mo thal pas 'gengs su bcug ste /
analyzed: dbyib mo thal pas 'gengs su bcug ste /
translated: One should fill the clay pot with ashes.

original: bkang nas de'i 'og tu rdza gzong lcags phur zhes bya ba bas dbyib mo la gcags na bzang ste /
analyzed: bkang nas de'i 'og tu rdza gzong lcags phur zhes bya ba bas dbyib mo la gcags na bzang ste /
translated: After filling it, then one should dig it out with a metal awl called a “nail.”

original: rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is good, that is, it is suitable.

original: rdza gzong de ga las btsal zhe na ;
analyzed: rdza gzong de ga las btsal zhe na ;
translated: From where should one seek that metal awl?

original: de'i phyir de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “One should keep it.”

original: rdza gzong de'o //
analyzed: rdza gzong de'o //
translated: That is the metal awl.

original: rdza bos ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: rdza bos ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one use the clay pot?

original: de'i phyir des du ba mi 'chor bar dgab po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir des du ba mi 'chor bar dgab po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “With that one covers the begging bowl so that smoke does not escape.”

original: rdza bo des lhung bzed dgab par bya'o //
analyzed: rdza bo des lhung bzed dgab par bya'o //
translated: With that clay pot one should cover the begging bowl.

original: ji ltar dgab ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dgab ce na /
translated: How should one cover it?

original: de'i phyir du ba mi 'chor bar zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba mi 'chor bar zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “so that smoke does not escape.”

original: de la du ba phyir 'byung zhing 'gro ba ni du ba 'chor ba'o //
analyzed: de la du ba phyir 'byung zhing 'gro ba ni du ba 'chor ba'o //
translated: In this regard, smoke that goes out and moves is smoke that escapes.

original: du ba phyir mi 'byung zhing mi 'gro ba ni du ba mi 'chor ba ste /
analyzed: du ba phyir mi 'byung zhing mi 'gro ba ni du ba mi 'chor ba ste /
translated: Smoke that does not go out and move is smoke that does not escape.

original: dgab pa gang la du ba mi 'chor ba yod pa'i dgab pa de ni du ba mi 'chor ba'o //
analyzed: dgab pa gang la du ba mi 'chor ba yod pa'i dgab pa de ni du ba mi 'chor ba'o //
translated: The covering on which smoke does not escape is the covering of smoke that does not escape.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: ci ltar byas na du ba mi 'chor ba de lta bu dgab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci ltar byas na du ba mi 'chor ba de lta bu dgab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for “in such a way that smoke does not escape.”

original: rdza bos dgab po zhes bstan na ;
analyzed: rdza bos dgab po zhes bstan na ;
translated: If it is taught that it is covered with a pot,

original: ci rdza bo nyid kyi phyi rol byugs pas sam 'on te ma byugs pas she na /
analyzed: ci rdza bo nyid kyi phyi rol byugs pas sam 'on te ma byugs pas she na /
translated: is it the outside of the pot that is smeared or is it not smeared?

original: de'i phyir / phub ma dang 'jim par sbyar bas phyi rol byugs pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / phub ma dang 'jim par sbyar bas phyi rol byugs pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the outside is smeared with a mixture of chaff and clay.”

original: dgab pa gang gi phyi rol phub ma dang 'jim pa bsres pas byugs pa de ni phub ma dang 'jim par sbyar bas phyi rol byugs pa ste /
analyzed: dgab pa gang gi phyi rol phub ma dang 'jim pa bsres pas byugs pa de ni phub ma dang 'jim par sbyar bas phyi rol byugs pa ste /
translated: The outside of the covering that is smeared with a mixture of chaff and clay is the outside smeared with a mixture of chaff and clay.

original: des dgab @56a * //
analyzed: des dgab @56a * //
translated: It should be covered with that.

original: par bya'o // nang ci zhig gis bsku bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: par bya'o // nang ci zhig gis bsku bar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be applied inside?

original: de'i phyir 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma'am lci bas nang byugs pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma'am lci bas nang byugs pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It should be smeared inside with oil or cow dung.”

original: de'i nang 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma'am ba lang gi lci bas byugs pa ni nang byugs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i nang 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma'am ba lang gi lci bas byugs pa ni nang byugs pa ste /
translated: That which is smeared inside with oil or cow dung is smeared inside.

original: rdza bo nang byugs pa des dgab par bya'o //
analyzed: rdza bo nang byugs pa des dgab par bya'o //
translated: It should be covered with that which is smeared inside.

original: ci nang dang phyi rol gyi skyang nyul ma bskams pas sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci nang dang phyi rol gyi skyang nyul ma bskams pas sam zhe na /
translated: Is it because the inside and outside are dried out by the sun?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: No, therefore it is said,

original: bskams par gyur pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bskams par gyur pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “When it is dried out.”

original: bskams zin pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bskams zin pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means when it is already dried out.

original: sa gzhi ji 'dra bar gzhi ci bting ba'i steng du lhung bzed ji ltar gzhag pa la rdza bos dgab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sa gzhi ji 'dra bar gzhi ci bting ba'i steng du lhung bzed ji ltar gzhag pa la rdza bos dgab par bya zhe na /
translated: On what kind of ground, what kind of cloth, and how should the bowl be placed? It should be covered with a pot.

original: de'i phyir sa gzhi byi dor byas par phub ma bting zhing du ba 'tsher par byed pa 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas bkram pa'i steng du kha bub tu gzhag pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa gzhi byi dor byas par phub ma bting zhing du ba 'tsher par byed pa 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas bkram pa'i steng du kha bub tu gzhag pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the corpse is placed face down on the ground that has been swept and strewn with substances such as chaff that causes the corpse to smoke.🔽

original: sa gzhi byi dor byas par zhes bya ba la /🔽byi dor byas pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽sa gzhi gang du brko ba dang zhal zhal dang brtags pa la sogs pa byas pa de ni sa gzhi byi dor byas pa ste der ro //
analyzed: sa gzhi byi dor byas par zhes bya ba la / byi dor byas pa zhes bya ba ni / sa gzhi gang du brko ba dang zhal zhal dang brtags pa la sogs pa byas pa de ni sa gzhi byi dor byas pa ste der ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the corpse should be placed face down on a surface that has been swept clean, spread with straw, and strewn with substances such as chaff that cause the corpse to smoke.🔽On a surface that has been swept clean🔽means on a surface that has been dug up, smoothed, and so on.

original: phub ma bting zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phub ma bting zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Spread with straw means spread with straw.

original: gang du phub ma bting ba de ni phub ma bting ba ste der ro //🔽du ba 'tsher ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽de du ba yang yin la 'tsher ba yang yin pas du ba 'tsher ba'o //🔽de byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang du phub ma bting ba de ni phub ma bting ba ste der ro // du ba 'tsher ba zhes bya ba ni / de du ba yang yin la 'tsher ba yang yin pas du ba 'tsher ba'o // de byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That causes the corpse to smoke means that causes the corpse to smoke.

original: du ba 'tsher bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: du ba 'tsher bar byed pa'o //
translated: That which causes the corpse to smoke is that which causes the corpse to smoke.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de'i phyir 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “the substance called wick of the oil lamp, etc.”

original: 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa nyid rdzas so //🔽de dag ni du ba 'tsher par byed pa yang yin la 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas kyang yin no //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa nyid rdzas so // de dag ni du ba 'tsher par byed pa yang yin la 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas kyang yin no //
translated: The wick of the oil lamp, etc. is a substance.🔽They are the wick of the oil lamp, etc. and they are the substance.

original: gang du de dag bkram pa de ni du ba 'tsher bar byed pa 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas bkram pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du de dag bkram pa de ni du ba 'tsher bar byed pa 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa'i rdzas bkram pa yin no //
translated: Where they are spread out, there is the spreading out of the substance, the wick of the oil lamp, etc.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sa gzhi'i steng du lhung bzed gzhag pa bkod pa la rdza bo nges dgab par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sa gzhi'i steng du lhung bzed gzhag pa bkod pa la rdza bo nges dgab par bya'o //
translated: On the ground of that kind, the bowl should be placed and covered with a cloth.

original: rnam pa ji ltar gzhag pa'i lhung bzed la zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar gzhag pa'i lhung bzed la zhe na /
translated: How should the bowl be placed?

original: de'i phyir kha bub tu zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha bub tu zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “upside down.”

original: kha thur du bstan ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kha thur du bstan ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: with the mouth turned downward.

original: 'di skad bstan te ;
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te ;
translated: This is what is taught:

original: je dang po kho nar bsko ba la sogs pas sa gzhi byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: je dang po kho nar bsko ba la sogs pas sa gzhi byi dor bya'o //
translated: First of all, the ground should be cleaned by sweeping, etc.

original: de'i 'og tu phub ma dag gding bar bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu dub 'tsher bar byed pa'i rdzas dag dgram par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phub ma dag gding bar bya'o // de'i 'og tu dub 'tsher bar byed pa'i rdzas dag dgram par bya ste /
translated: After that, the ashes should be spread.🔽After that, the substances for polishing should be spread.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sa gzhir lhung bzed kha bub tu gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sa gzhir lhung bzed kha bub tu gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: In such a place, the alms-bowl should be placed face-down.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rdza bos dgab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha @56b tshig go //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rdza bos dgab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha @56b tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: it should be covered with the potsherd as previously explained.

original: de'i 'og tu ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done after that?

original: de'i phyir / lci ba dag dang sog mas bcer te me sbar te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / lci ba dag dang sog mas bcer te me sbar te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “having kindled a fire with cow-dung and grass.

original: ba lang gi lci bdag dang sog mas rdza bo g-yogs bar bya zhing g-yogs nas de'i mod la lci ba la sogs pa'i me sbar bar bya ste /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci bdag dang sog mas rdza bo g-yogs bar bya zhing g-yogs nas de'i mod la lci ba la sogs pa'i me sbar bar bya ste /
translated: ” The potsherd should be covered with cow-dung and grass. Having covered it, immediately a fire of cow-dung, etc. should be kindled.

original: me btang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: me btang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the fire should be lit.

original: te por grangs nas dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: te por grangs nas dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having counted the number, it should be removed.

original: lhung bzed dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed dbyung ba ste /
translated: The alms-bowl should be removed.

original: lhung bzed te por grangs par shes nas bsreg pa'i gnas nas dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhung bzed te por grangs par shes nas bsreg pa'i gnas nas dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Knowing that the bowl is to be filled, one should remove it from the place of burning.

original: lhung bzed bsreg pa rgyun chags su lan du tsam bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed bsreg pa rgyun chags su lan du tsam bya zhe na /
translated: How many times should one burn the bowl?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir kha dog rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽de kha dog kyang yin la rdzogs pa yang yin pas kha dog rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha dog rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te / de kha dog kyang yin la rdzogs pa yang yin pas kha dog rdzogs pa ste /
translated: One should repeat until the color is perfect.

original: kha dog yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: That is the perfect color.

original: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni grub pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni grub pa ste /
translated: The perfection of that is the accomplishment.

original: kha dog rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the color is the perfection.

original: kha dog rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs par gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: kha dog rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs par gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya ste /
translated: One should repeat until the color is perfect.

original: yang dang yang du bsreg par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bsreg par bya ba'o //
translated: One should burn it again and again.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: ji srid du lhung bzed kyi kha dog yongs su rdzogs par gyur gyi bar du de srid du yang dang yang du bzlas shing bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du lhung bzed kyi kha dog yongs su rdzogs par gyur gyi bar du de srid du yang dang yang du bzlas shing bsreg par bya'o //
translated: As long as the color of the begging bowl is completely restored, for that long one should recite again and again and burn.

original: ji ltar yang dang yang du bzlas par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dang yang du bzlas par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one recite again and again?

original: de'i phyir / byi dor byas shing byi dor byas shing gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / byi dor byas shing byi dor byas shing gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “Having cleaned, having cleaned, one should place it.”

original: bsreg pa bsreg pa na byi dor byas shing byi dor byas shing bsreg pa'i gnas su gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽srog chags rnams la snying brtse bas nyen kor phyag dar dang chag chag bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsreg pa bsreg pa na byi dor byas shing byi dor byas shing bsreg pa'i gnas su gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // srog chags rnams la snying brtse bas nyen kor phyag dar dang chag chag bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When burning, having cleaned, having cleaned, one should place it in the place for burning. This is the meaning.🔽Out of compassion for living beings, one should sweep and sprinkle around the burning place.

original: srog chags rnams la rjes su snying brtse bas bsreg pa'i gnas kyi nyen kor phyag dar phyag par bya ba dang / nyen kor nyid du chus chag chag gdab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog chags rnams la rjes su snying brtse bas bsreg pa'i gnas kyi nyen kor phyag dar phyag par bya ba dang / nyen kor nyid du chus chag chag gdab par bya ba'o //
translated: Out of compassion for living beings, one should sweep around the burning place and sprinkle water around the burning place.

original: lhung bzed med par rab tu dbyung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba de'i zhar la 'ongs pa lhung bzed kyi cho ga 'khor dang bcas pa bstan nas /
analyzed: lhung bzed med par rab tu dbyung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba de'i zhar la 'ongs pa lhung bzed kyi cho ga 'khor dang bcas pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the procedure for the begging bowl and its retinue,

original: rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi dang 'brel ba phran tshogs la sogs pa las 'byung ba gzhan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i gzhi dang 'brel ba phran tshogs la sogs pa las 'byung ba gzhan brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will now discuss other topics that are related to the basis of ordination, such as the Kṣudraka Collection.

original: lo tshigs mi shes na mtshan gyi nyen kor du spu skyes pa rdzogs par bsnyen par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lo tshigs mi shes na mtshan gyi nyen kor du spu skyes pa rdzogs par bsnyen par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not know the age of the aspirant, one should grant full ordination after one year, if body hair has grown.

original: spu skyes pa ni lo tshigs yongs su shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pas rdzogs par bsnyen par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: spu skyes pa ni lo tshigs yongs su shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pas rdzogs par bsnyen par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Since the growth of body hair is a sign of having reached the age of twenty, one should grant full ordination after one year.

original: @57a * // phyogs gang du zhe na /
analyzed: @57a * // phyogs gang du zhe na /
translated: In what region?

original: de'i phyir mtshan gyi nyen kor du zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan gyi nyen kor du zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “in the vicinity of the signs.”

original: mtshan gyi then kor du'o //
analyzed: mtshan gyi then kor du'o //
translated: In the vicinity of the signs.🔽Of whom?

original: su'i zhe na rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa'i ste /
analyzed: su'i zhe na rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa'i ste /
translated: Of one who desires full ordination.

original: lo tshigs gang yin pa de mi shes na'o //
analyzed: lo tshigs gang yin pa de mi shes na'o //
translated: If one does not know the age of the aspirant, one should grant full ordination after one year.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa lo nyi shu lon pa nyid du mi shes na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa lo nyi shu lon pa nyid du mi shes na de'i tshe /
translated: If one does not know whether one who desires full ordination has reached twenty years of age,

original: mtshan gyi then kor du spu skyes pa rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pas rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan gyi then kor du spu skyes pa rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pas rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ste /
translated: then because the appearance of hair in the region of the genitals is a reason for full ordination, he should be fully ordained.

original: gal te mtshan gyi nyen kor du spu dag skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan gyi nyen kor du spu dag skyes par gyur na /
translated: If hair has appeared in the region of the genitals,

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa de rdzogs par bsnyen par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa de rdzogs par bsnyen par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then that one who desires full ordination should be fully ordained.

original: mtshan gyi nyen kor du spu skyes pa de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan gyi nyen kor du spu skyes pa de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that hair has appeared in the region of the genitals?

original: de'i phyir / de ni sgyu thabs kyis brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni sgyu thabs kyis brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “That should be examined by means of a ruse.”

original: mtshan gyi nyen kor du spu skyes pa de ni sgyu thabs kyis brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan gyi nyen kor du spu skyes pa de ni sgyu thabs kyis brtag par bya ste /
translated: That hair has appeared in the region of the genitals should be examined by means of a ruse.

original: spu skyes pa sgyu thabs kyis brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spu skyes pa sgyu thabs kyis brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the appearance of hair should be examined by means of a ruse.

original: sgyu thabs ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: sgyu thabs ji lta bus she na /
translated: By what kind of ruse?

original: de'i phyir zung nga dang gos kyi gdang mthon po la 'dug pa'i dngos po dbab pa la sogs pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zung nga dang gos kyi gdang mthon po la 'dug pa'i dngos po dbab pa la sogs pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, one should examine the private parts of a man or woman who is sitting on a bed or high seat by means of the stratagem of lowering or raising the clothing.

original: zung nga dang gos kyi gdang mthon po la 'dug pa'i chos gos la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'i dngos po de dbab pa dang / dgab pa la sogs pa'i sgyu thabs kyis mtshan gyi sbu brtag par bya ba'o //🔽rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zung nga dang gos kyi gdang mthon po la 'dug pa'i chos gos la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'i dngos po de dbab pa dang / dgab pa la sogs pa'i sgyu thabs kyis mtshan gyi sbu brtag par bya ba'o // rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should examine the private parts of a man or woman who is sitting on a bed or high seat by means of the stratagem of lowering or raising the clothing.🔽One should not allow a person who desires full ordination to climb a tree.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa'i gang zag shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug pa'o //🔽mtshams kyi phyi rol du mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa'i gang zag shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug pa'o // mtshams kyi phyi rol du mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not allow a person who desires full ordination to climb a tree.🔽One should not send a person who desires full ordination outside the boundary.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa'i gang zag mtshams kyi phyi rol du mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa'i gang zag mtshams kyi phyi rol du mi gtong ba'o //
translated: One should not send a person who desires full ordination outside the boundary.

original: mdo de gnyis ni bar chad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo de gnyis ni bar chad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These two sutras are for the purpose of completely avoiding obstacles.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i gnas su khrid pa ltar snang ba'i nyen kor ni 'dir mtshams kyi nang ngo //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i gnas su khrid pa ltar snang ba'i nyen kor ni 'dir mtshams kyi nang ngo //
translated: The area that appears to be the place for the full ordination is the inside of the boundary here.

original: de las gzhan pa ni mtshams kyi phyi rol lo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni mtshams kyi phyi rol lo //
translated: What is other than that is outside the boundary.

original: de ltar snang ba'i nyen kor du bkar te /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i nyen kor du bkar te /
translated: Having been placed in that area that appears to be the place for the full ordination,

original: tshogs la mngon du phyogs par thal mo sbyar te gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshogs la mngon du phyogs par thal mo sbyar te gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: he should be placed with palms joined in the direction of the saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong gis ltar snang ba'i nyan kor du gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong gis ltar snang ba'i nyan kor du gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: A fully ordained monk who is part of the saṅgha should place him in the area that appears to be the place for the full ordination.

original: su zhe na de'i phyir de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: su zhe na de'i phyir de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Who? For that reason, “he” is stated.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa'o //
translated: He who desires the full ordination.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: bkar ba zhes bya ba gsang ste ston pa bsko ba'i las mi thos par bya ba'i phyir @57b bkar ba na /
analyzed: bkar ba zhes bya ba gsang ste ston pa bsko ba'i las mi thos par bya ba'i phyir @57b bkar ba na /
translated: When he is placed, that is, when the action of appointing the secret instructor is not heard.

original: de dge 'dun gyi nang nas logs shig tu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dge 'dun gyi nang nas logs shig tu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should be placed apart from the saṅgha.

original: ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: How should he be placed?

original: de'i phyir tshogs la mngon du phyogs par thal mo sbyar te gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs la mngon du phyogs par thal mo sbyar te gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, one who desires full ordination should be placed in the midst of the community with palms together in reverence.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa gang dge 'dun gyi tshogs la mngon du phyogs pa de ni tshogs la mngon du phyogs pa dang / gang gis thal mo sbyar ba de ni thal mo sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa gang dge 'dun gyi tshogs la mngon du phyogs pa de ni tshogs la mngon du phyogs pa dang / gang gis thal mo sbyar ba de ni thal mo sbyar ba ste /
translated: One who desires full ordination and is placed in the midst of the community is one who is placed in the midst of the community. One who joins palms in reverence is one who joins palms in reverence.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa de de ltar gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa de de ltar gzhag par bya ste /
translated: One who desires full ordination should be placed in that way.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang nas ma bkar bar de mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽khyim pa la gnas brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang nas ma bkar bar de mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // khyim pa la gnas brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not to be done without being appointed in the midst of the community.🔽One should not speak of the bases in the presence of a layperson.

original: khyim pa de la gnas rnams brjod par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyim pa de la gnas rnams brjod par mi bya ba ste /
translated: The bases should not be spoken of in the presence of that layperson.

original: de ni rab tu 'byung ba'i bar chad yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rab tu 'byung ba'i bar chad yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is in order to completely abandon obstacles to going forth.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du rab tu byung bar ma gyur gyi bar du khyim pa la gnas rnams brjod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽rdzogs par bsnyen ma thag pa la mi brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du rab tu byung bar ma gyur gyi bar du khyim pa la gnas rnams brjod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // rdzogs par bsnyen ma thag pa la mi brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The text here states: “As long as one has not gone forth, one should not speak of the householder’s states.”🔽“One should not fail to speak of the states immediately after full ordination”🔽means that immediately after full ordination, one should not fail to speak of the states.

original: rdzogs bar bsnyen pa'i mod la gnas rnams mi brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rdzogs bar bsnyen pa'i mod la gnas rnams mi brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that one should speak of the states immediately after full ordination.

original: thams cad du yang rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i mod la sems mthun par 'gyur bas de rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du yang rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i mod la sems mthun par 'gyur bas de rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: In all cases, immediately after full ordination, the minds of the preceptor and the disciple become in harmony, so this is permitted.🔽The text here states: “A young brahmin went forth and was fully ordained. The preceptor told him, ‘Go out for alms later.’

original: 'dir gzhung ni bram ze'i khye'u zhig rab tu byung rdzogs par bsnyen pa la mkhan pos 'phyi ba zhig na bsod snyoms la song shig ces bsgo ba dang / des bsgo ba na bdag slong mo la rgyu bas skyo ste rab tu byung na yang bsod snyoms bya'am zhes bslab pa phul nas mnyam par gyur pa nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bram ze'i khye'u zhig rab tu byung rdzogs par bsnyen pa la mkhan pos 'phyi ba zhig na bsod snyoms la song shig ces bsgo ba dang / des bsgo ba na bdag slong mo la rgyu bas skyo ste rab tu byung na yang bsod snyoms bya'am zhes bslab pa phul nas mnyam par gyur pa nas /
translated: When he was told this, he thought, ‘I am tired of wandering for alms. Even though I have gone forth, I must go for alms.’ He returned his training and became a layman. After they became friends, the preceptor said to him, ‘I have a son. You are my friend. I give you this son.’ He gave him his son.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rdzogs par bsnyen ma thag tu gnas gzhi brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen ma thag tu gnas gzhi brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “As soon as you have completed the approach, you should declare the basis of your residence.”🔽The passage continues up to this point.

original: gang na gnas med pa der gso sbyong la bsdad pa dang gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: gang na gnas med pa der gso sbyong la bsdad pa dang gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba na /
translated: In a place where there is no residence, you should not stay for the purification and restoration ceremony, nor should you agree to stay.

original: gtsug lag khang gang na gnas med pa'i gtsug lag khang der /🔽gso sbyong ma 'ongs pa bsdad par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gang na gnas med pa'i gtsug lag khang der / gso sbyong ma 'ongs pa bsdad par mi bya zhing /
translated: In a temple where there is no residence,🔽you should not stay for the purification and restoration ceremony that has not yet arrived.

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa ma 'ongs par gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa ma 'ongs par gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not agree to stay for the rains retreat that has not yet arrived.

original: gal te gnas par khas blangs nas phyis gnas med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gnas par khas blangs nas phyis gnas med par gyur na /
translated: If you agree to stay, but later there is no residence,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: what should you do at that time?

original: de'i phyir gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma rjes su bsrung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma rjes su bsrung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that you should not protect the previous agreement to stay.

original: gnas med na gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma rjes su bsrung bar mi bya'o//
analyzed: gnas med na gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma rjes su bsrung bar mi bya'o//
translated: If there is no residence, you should not protect the previous agreement to stay.

original: @58a * // 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: @58a * // 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: dge slong dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga mas gnas par khas blangs pa gal te dbyar zla 'bring po mar gyi ngo dang / dbyar zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo la gnas med par gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga mas gnas par khas blangs pa gal te dbyar zla 'bring po mar gyi ngo dang / dbyar zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo la gnas med par gyur na /
translated: If a monk who has taken up the earlier summer retreat finds no place to stay during the waning phase of the middle month of summer or the waxing phase of the last month of summer,

original: de'i tshe gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma dral te gzhan du 'gro bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma dral te gzhan du 'gro bar bya zhing /
translated: then he should tear up the earlier summer retreat and go elsewhere.

original: gang na gnas yod pa'i dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma shos der gnas par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang na gnas yod pa'i dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma shos der gnas par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: He should take up the later summer retreat in a place where there is a place to stay.

original: gal te gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma shos na yang gnas med na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma shos na yang gnas med na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If there is no place to stay even in the later summer retreat, then what should he do?

original: de'i phyir phyi ma la yang zla gnyis las lhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi ma la yang zla gnyis las lhag pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Also, more than two months in the later.”

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra las gnas med na rjes su mi bsrung ngo zhes bya ba na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra las gnas med na rjes su mi bsrung ngo zhes bya ba na 'gyur ro //
translated: The word also indicates that if there is no place to stay, he should not observe the later retreat.

original: de ltar ni 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of the words here is as follows.

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma shos na yang gnas med na /
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma shos na yang gnas med na /
translated: If there is no place to stay even in the latter rainy season retreat,

original: zla ba gnyis las lhag par khas blangs pa gzhan rjes su bsrung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis las lhag par khas blangs pa gzhan rjes su bsrung bar mi bya ste /
translated: one should not stay in another place for more than two months.

original: zla ba gnyis ni gnas med pa des kyang gnas par bya zhing ston zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug la babs na /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis ni gnas med pa des kyang gnas par bya zhing ston zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug la babs na /
translated: One should stay for two months even without a place to stay, and then go elsewhere when the sixteenth day of the second month of the rainy season arrives.

original: gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the text.

original: gal te gtsug lag khang gzhan nas der gnas 'ong bar 'gyur ba zhig btsal bar bya na /
analyzed: gal te gtsug lag khang gzhan nas der gnas 'ong bar 'gyur ba zhig btsal bar bya na /
translated: If one should seek to come to stay there from another monastery,

original: ji ltar btsal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar btsal bar bya zhe na /
translated: how should one seek to come?

original: de'i phyir gnas dang las dang bsnyen bkur gyi sta gon gyis de btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas dang las dang bsnyen bkur gyi sta gon gyis de btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should seek to come by preparing a place, work, and service.

original: de la gnas kyi sta gon zhes bya ba ni gnas khang gi sta gon no //
analyzed: de la gnas kyi sta gon zhes bya ba ni gnas khang gi sta gon no //
translated: Among them, “preparing a place” means preparing a dwelling place.

original: des rnyed pa'i sta gon yang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des rnyed pa'i sta gon yang bstan pa yin te /
translated: It also shows the preparation of obtaining it.

original: gnas khang gang du yon bdag gis rnyed pa lhag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gnas khang gang du yon bdag gis rnyed pa lhag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is a dwelling place where the patron provides extra gain.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gnas so //
translated: “That” refers to the place.

original: btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong gnas bca' bar 'os pa dag gis so //
analyzed: btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong gnas bca' bar 'os pa dag gis so //
translated: “One should request” means that those monks who are suitable to be in the saṅgha should request.

original: dge slong gnas ma bcas pa dag gis zla ba gnyis su la zhu bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong gnas ma bcas pa dag gis zla ba gnyis su la zhu bar bya zhe na /
translated: If there are no monks who have taken up residence, how should one request for two months?

original: de'i phyir / med na gzhon nu'i nang nas ches rgan pa la zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / med na gzhon nu'i nang nas ches rgan pa la zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If there is no one, one should request the oldest among the novices.”

original: gnas gzhan med na gzhon nu rnams kyi nang na ches rgan ba la zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan med na gzhon nu rnams kyi nang na ches rgan ba la zhu bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no other place, one should request the oldest among the novices.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta mod kyi de dag las ches rgan pa gang yin pa de la zhu bar bya zhing de'i 'og tu dgag dbye gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta mod kyi de dag las ches rgan pa gang yin pa de la zhu bar bya zhing de'i 'og tu dgag dbye gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here the text is like this: “If there is no one, one should request the oldest among the novices and then go to another place for the poṣadha.”

original: dngos su na ches rgan pas ni ma zhus par yang bya ba bya'o zhes rjes su gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos su na ches rgan pas ni ma zhus par yang bya ba bya'o zhes rjes su gnang ba yin no //
translated: In actuality, it is an allowance that the oldest one should do the action without requesting.

original: yod na yang re zhig gi @58b gnas nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod na yang re zhig gi @58b gnas nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is, then by the very fact of his being the oldest.

original: gzhon rabs kyi nang na ches rgan pa la re zhig gi gnas nyid kyis zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon rabs kyi nang na ches rgan pa la re zhig gi gnas nyid kyis zhu bar bya'o //
translated: The youngest of the young should request the oldest of the old.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ni khyod dang mkhan po gcig pa yin gyis khyod kyis 'di la zhu bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ni khyod dang mkhan po gcig pa yin gyis khyod kyis 'di la zhu bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “This is your preceptor, you should request him.”

original: bya ba zhu ba'i zhar la ma zhus par de lta bu la bdag gis sam des kyang bsnyen bkur gyi las mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /
analyzed: bya ba zhu ba'i zhar la ma zhus par de lta bu la bdag gis sam des kyang bsnyen bkur gyi las mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /
translated: In the context of requesting the rite, the text states that one should not perform the duties of service for such a person, nor should that person perform the duties of service for oneself.

original: gnas ma la zhus par tshul khrims ral ba 'chal pa'i tshul khrims can de lta bu la bdag gis kyang rkang pa mnye ba la sogs pa'i bsnyen bkur gyi las mi bya la /
analyzed: gnas ma la zhus par tshul khrims ral ba 'chal pa'i tshul khrims can de lta bu la bdag gis kyang rkang pa mnye ba la sogs pa'i bsnyen bkur gyi las mi bya la /
translated: One should not perform the duties of service, such as washing the feet, for a person who has violated ethical conduct and whose ethical conduct is flawed, without requesting permission from the preceptor.

original: de lta bu des kyang mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu des kyang mi bya ste /
translated: Nor should one perform the duties of service for such a person.

original: de lta bu des bdag la bsnyen bkur gyi las mi bya zhing bsnyen bkur byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu des bdag la bsnyen bkur gyi las mi bya zhing bsnyen bkur byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The text states that such a person should not perform the duties of service for oneself, nor should one allow such a person to perform the duties of service.

original: mi gnas par 'dug par mi bya'o zhes spyir btang ba de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi gnas par 'dug par mi bya'o zhes spyir btang ba de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The exception to this general rule is stated:

original: gnas par 'os pa yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa ni med na mi gnas par 'dug pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnas par 'os pa yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa ni med na mi gnas par 'dug pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: There is no offense if one is seeking a suitable place to stay and there is no other place to stay.

original: nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no offense means there is no transgression.🔽When?

original: gang gi tshe na gnas med na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na gnas med na'o //
translated: When there is no place to stay.

original: su la zhe na /
analyzed: su la zhe na /
translated: For whom?

original: de'i phyir gnas par 'os pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas par 'os pa la'o //
translated: For one who is seeking a suitable place to stay.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na de'i phyir /
translated: What kind of distinction?

original: yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “one who is seeking.”

original: gang yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa de ni yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa de ni yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa ste /
translated: One who is seeking is one who is seeking a suitable place to stay.

original: gnas par 'os pa yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa de ni gnas med na mi gnas par 'dug pa la nyes pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par 'os pa yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa de ni gnas med na mi gnas par 'dug pa la nyes pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that there is no offense for one who is seeking a suitable place to stay to stay where one is not allowed to stay.

original: de dus ji srid du mi gnas par 'dug pa la nyes pa med ce na de'i phyir zhag lnga'i mthar thug pa'i bar du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dus ji srid du mi gnas par 'dug pa la nyes pa med ce na de'i phyir zhag lnga'i mthar thug pa'i bar du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If there is no fault in not staying for as long as one stays, then why does the text say, “up to five days”?

original: zhag lnga'i mthar thug pa ni zhag lnga'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zhag lnga'i mthar thug pa ni zhag lnga'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Up to five days is the limit of five days.

original: zhag lnga'i mthar thug pa'i bar du mi gnas par 'dug pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zhag lnga'i mthar thug pa'i bar du mi gnas par 'dug pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in not staying for up to five days.

original: rnyed pa yong na 'os pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnyed pa yong na 'os pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one obtains something, it is proper.

original: rnyed pa nye bar gnas pa yod na /
analyzed: rnyed pa nye bar gnas pa yod na /
translated: If one obtains something,

original: gnas par 'os pa yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa de rnyed pa sbyin par 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas par 'os pa yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa de rnyed pa sbyin par 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: it is proper to stay, and it is proper to give it to one who is seeking.

original: de ltar 'dir gzhung ni gleng gzhi dag las mi gnas pa la yun ji srid du rnyed pa bsal bar bgyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir gzhung ni gleng gzhi dag las mi gnas pa la yun ji srid du rnyed pa bsal bar bgyi /
translated: Thus, the text here is to determine the length of time for not staying, as stated in the sources,

original: nye ba 'khor zhag lnga tshun chad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor zhag lnga tshun chad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Up to five days.”

original: de yang sbyor ba mi gtong ba la'o //
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba mi gtong ba la'o //
translated: And that is for not giving up the practice.

original: gnyug mar gnas pa'i gnas kyi cho ga bstan nas /
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas pa'i gnas kyi cho ga bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the rules for staying in a monastery,

original: glor bur du 'ongs pa'i gnas kyi cho ga smra bar 'dod @59a * //
analyzed: glor bur du 'ongs pa'i gnas kyi cho ga smra bar 'dod @59a * //
translated: He wishes to speak the ritual for a guest house.

original: nas ; glo bur du 'ongs pas ni ngal bsos nas nyi ma gnyis pa'am gsum pa la gnas bca' bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nas ; glo bur du 'ongs pas ni ngal bsos nas nyi ma gnyis pa'am gsum pa la gnas bca' bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: A guest should rest for one or two days and then take up residence.

original: dal bsos nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dal bsos nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Resting” means

original: nyi ma dang po la bstis nas so //
analyzed: nyi ma dang po la bstis nas so //
translated: resting on the first day.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa des nyi ma dang po la ngal bsos nas de'i 'og tu nyi ma gnyis pa'am gsum pa la gnas la gnas bca' bar bya'o //
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa des nyi ma dang po la ngal bsos nas de'i 'og tu nyi ma gnyis pa'am gsum pa la gnas la gnas bca' bar bya'o //
translated: The guest should rest on the first day and then take up residence on the second or third day.

original: nyi ma gcig ni ched du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyi ma gcig ni ched du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One day is not for the purpose of taking up residence” means

original: glo bur du 'ongs pas nyi ma gcig ni 'dug par bya'i ched du gnas bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pas nyi ma gcig ni 'dug par bya'i ched du gnas bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: that the guest should not take up residence for the purpose of staying one day.

original: gnas pa nye bar mi gnas na gzhan la zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pa nye bar mi gnas na gzhan la zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If the resident monk does not stay, he should ask another” means

original: gnas pas dge slong gzhan la zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pas dge slong gzhan la zhu bar bya'o //
translated: that the resident monk should ask another monk.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: nye bar mi gnas na ste /
analyzed: nye bar mi gnas na ste /
translated: If he does not stay.

original: spyod yul du ma gyur pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: spyod yul du ma gyur pa nyid na'o //
translated: It is when it is not the domain of others.

original: su zhig ce na /
analyzed: su zhig ce na /
translated: Who is it?🔽The one who is abiding.

original: gnas pa'o // 'o na gnas zhes brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gnas pa'o // 'o na gnas zhes brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: But if it is to be said that it is abiding,

original: ji ltar gnas pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: how can it be said that it is the one who is abiding?

original: nyes pa med de gnas par bya ba'i las la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig tu bya'i /
analyzed: nyes pa med de gnas par bya ba'i las la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig tu bya'i /
translated: There is no fault. The word “abiding” is used for the action of abiding,

original: gnas par byed pa'i byed pa po la mi bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i byed pa po la mi bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: but not for the agent of abiding.

original: gang gnas par 'os pa de la gnas par byed cing gnas par byed len par byed pas /
analyzed: gang gnas par 'os pa de la gnas par byed cing gnas par byed len par byed pas /
translated: The one who is suitable to abide is the one who abides, and the one who abides is the one who is abiding.

original: des na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas nyid yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: des na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas nyid yin par gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, “abiding” is taken to be abiding itself.

original: de ltar na 'dir don 'di 'byung ste /🔽gnas med na dge slong gzhan la zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir don 'di 'byung ste / gnas med na dge slong gzhan la zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In this way, the meaning that arises here is this:🔽If there is no abiding, one should ask another monk. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: gnas la ma zhus par bya ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i nye bar sbyar ba'i dmigs kyis bsal bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas la ma zhus par bya ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i nye bar sbyar ba'i dmigs kyis bsal bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the exception to the statement “One should not do what is to be done without asking the abiding,”

original: las su bskos par song ba na de gzhan byung na ma zhus kyang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las su bskos par song ba na de gzhan byung na ma zhus kyang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: If another duty arises, there is no offense if he does not inform the other.

original: las su bskos par song ba na zhes bya ba ni /🔽de'i phyir song ba na zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽gnas pa las su bskos pa'i phyir song ba na'o //
analyzed: las su bskos par song ba na zhes bya ba ni / de'i phyir song ba na zhes bya bar sbyar te / gnas pa las su bskos pa'i phyir song ba na'o //
translated: If another duty arises means

original: de gzhan byung na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gzhan byung na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: if another duty arises for him.🔽If he goes to the place where he was appointed to work, he should inform the other.

original: las su bya ba gzhan byung na ste /
analyzed: las su bya ba gzhan byung na ste /
translated: If another duty arises means🔽if another duty arises for him.

original: gzhan de bsgrub pa'i phyir ma zhus kyang nyes pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan de bsgrub pa'i phyir ma zhus kyang nyes pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: If he does not inform the other, there is no offense.

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas mal gyi gzhi las gal te der song ba rnams la las su bya ba gzhan byung na de dag gis yang 'ongs te zhu bar mi bya bar las su bya ba de nyid bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas mal gyi gzhi las gal te der song ba rnams la las su bya ba gzhan byung na de dag gis yang 'ongs te zhu bar mi bya bar las su bya ba de nyid bya ste /
translated: The Chapter on the Bases of Mindfulness says, “If another duty arises for those who have gone there, they should do that duty without returning to inform the other.

original: de dag ni zhu ba snga ma nyid de'i zhu ba yang yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag ni zhu ba snga ma nyid de'i zhu ba yang yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is the prior duty of those who have gone there.”

original: gnas bca' bar bya'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: gnas bca' bar bya'o zhes smras na /
translated: If he says, “I will go to a place,”

original: ci gang yang rung ba la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci gang yang rung ba la'am zhe na /
translated: should he go to any place?

original: de'i @59b phyir gang yang rung ba la mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i @59b phyir gang yang rung ba la mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “one should not do it to just anyone.”

original: gnas bca' ba'o //
analyzed: gnas bca' ba'o //
translated: This is the selection of a place.

original: 'o na gang la zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang la zhe na /
translated: Now, to what kind of person should one go for refuge?

original: de'i phyir dri ba la sogs pas tshul khrims dang shes pa dang 'khor la phan 'dogs pa nyid nges par shes par byas nas de gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dri ba la sogs pas tshul khrims dang shes pa dang 'khor la phan 'dogs pa nyid nges par shes par byas nas de gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “having ascertained the morality, knowledge, and helpfulness of the retinue by means of questions, etc., one should take refuge in that person.”

original: dri ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni lus kyi las la sogs pa'i kun tu spyod pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: dri ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni lus kyi las la sogs pa'i kun tu spyod pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: By the word “etc.” in “questions, etc.,” the conduct of bodily action, etc. is included.

original: de dag gis gnas sbyin pa'i gang zag gi tshul khrims dang shes pa dang 'khor la pha na 'dogs pa nyid de dag thams cad nges par shes par byas nas gnas de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis gnas sbyin pa'i gang zag gi tshul khrims dang shes pa dang 'khor la pha na 'dogs pa nyid de dag thams cad nges par shes par byas nas gnas de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Having ascertained all of those—morality, knowledge, and helpfulness of the retinue—of the person who gives the place, one should take refuge in that place.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: de'i phyir sdom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “like the vow.”

original: dper na dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa la sogs pa sngags sngon du btang ba'i cho gas lan gsum bzlas te /
analyzed: dper na dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa la sogs pa sngags sngon du btang ba'i cho gas lan gsum bzlas te /
translated: For example, the vows of a layperson and so on are taken by repeating them three times in a ritual preceded by the mantra.

original: len pa de bzhin du 'di yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: len pa de bzhin du 'di yang de bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, this is also like that.

original: 'di ltar sdom pa bzhin no zhes smras na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdom pa bzhin no zhes smras na /
translated: If one says, “Just like the vows,”

original: sdom pa ni thal mo sbyar bas blang bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sdom pa ni thal mo sbyar bas blang bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: the vows are to be taken with palms joined.

original: 'dir cho ga gzhan gyis yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir cho ga gzhan gyis yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But here, in order to show that it is by another ritual,

original: lag pa gnyis kyis rkang mthil gnyis la bcangs nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis rkang mthil gnyis la bcangs nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that “one should hold the soles of the feet with both hands.”

original: gnas pas lag pa gnyis kyis gnas kyi rkang mthil gnyis la bcangs te gzung nas gnas su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pas lag pa gnyis kyis gnas kyi rkang mthil gnyis la bcangs te gzung nas gnas su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The host should hold the soles of the feet of the guest with both hands, and hold them.

original: gnas kyis kyang thams cad la gnas sbyin par mi bya ste /🔽'di ltar yongs su brtags nas sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas kyis kyang thams cad la gnas sbyin par mi bya ste / 'di ltar yongs su brtags nas sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The host should not give lodging to everyone.

original: gnas pa yongs su brtags nas gnas sbyin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa yongs su brtags nas gnas sbyin par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, “after examining, one should give” means that one should give lodging after examining the guest.

original: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: In this way, one should examine:

original: ci 'di mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa can dang / bslab pa dag la gus pa yin nam zhes yongs su brtags nas so //
analyzed: ci 'di mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa can dang / bslab pa dag la gus pa yin nam zhes yongs su brtags nas so //
translated: One should examine whether the other is a person who has the intention to attain nirvana and who respects the precepts.

original: gnas dang gnas pa gnyis ji ltar phan tshun gnas par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa gnyis ji ltar phan tshun gnas par bya zhe na /
translated: How can the basis and the one who stands be mutually supportive?

original: de'i phyir bu dang pha'i 'du shes dag bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bu dang pha'i 'du shes dag bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, one should generate the perception of father and son.

original: bu dang pha gnyis ni bu dang pha'o //
analyzed: bu dang pha gnyis ni bu dang pha'o //
translated: The two, father and son, are the father and son.

original: de gnyis kyi 'du shes dag ni bu dang pha'i 'du shes dag ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi 'du shes dag ni bu dang pha'i 'du shes dag ste /
translated: The perceptions of those two are the perceptions of father and son.

original: de dag bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate those.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gnas kyis ni gnas pa la bu'i 'du shes bskyed par bya la /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gnas kyis ni gnas pa la bu'i 'du shes bskyed par bya la /
translated: This is what is taught.🔽The basis should generate the perception of the one who stands as a son.

original: gnas pas ni gnas la pha'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pas ni gnas la pha'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The one who stands should generate the perception of the basis as a father.

original: ci lhan cig gnas pas mkhan po la gnas bca' dgos sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci lhan cig gnas pas mkhan po la gnas bca' dgos sam zhe na /
translated: Is it necessary for the one who stands to stand in relation to the preceptor?

original: de'i phyir / mkhan po de nyid gnas pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mkhan po de nyid gnas pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, that very preceptor is that very basis.

original: @60a * // de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mkhan po la snyegs so //
analyzed: @60a * // de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mkhan po la snyegs so //
translated: The state of that is just that. The word “that” refers to the master.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: mkhan po la gnas na mkhan po de nyid gnas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mkhan po la gnas na mkhan po de nyid gnas pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the master abides, then just that master is abiding.

original: mkhan po yin pa'i phyir gnas nyid yin par brjod par bya ba ji ltar gnas pa nyid du brjod ce na /
analyzed: mkhan po yin pa'i phyir gnas nyid yin par brjod par bya ba ji ltar gnas pa nyid du brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that abiding is just the master, since it is said that the master is the abiding?

original: nyes pa med de 'dir gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni gnas par bya ba'i las la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen gyis bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyes pa med de 'dir gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni gnas par bya ba'i las la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen gyis bstan pa yin gyi /
