translated: There is no fault. Here, “abiding” is taught by the condition “abiding in the action of abiding,”

original: gnas par byed pa'i byed pa po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i byed pa po ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as the agent of abiding.

original: de la gnas par bya bas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas par bya bas gnas pa ste /
translated: In that, abiding is that which abides.

original: des na gnas pa zhes bya ba'i sgras gnas pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gnas pa zhes bya ba'i sgras gnas pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word “abiding” teaches abiding.

original: de'i dngos po ni gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni gnas pa nyid de /
translated: The state of that is just abiding.

original: dngos po'i rkyen gyis mkhan po yin par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen gyis mkhan po yin par byed pa bstan to //
translated: By the condition of the state, the master is taught.

original: gang gi phyir mkhan po de nyid gnas nyid yin pa de'i phyir de la de mi bca'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mkhan po de nyid gnas nyid yin pa de'i phyir de la de mi bca'o //
translated: Since just that master is abiding, therefore it is not established in that.

original: de'i phyir mkhan po'i yul de la gnas de mi bca'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhan po'i yul de la gnas de mi bca'o //
translated: Therefore, the resident monk should not live in that place.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig gnas pa'i mkhan po nyid gnas nyid khon yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig gnas pa'i mkhan po nyid gnas nyid khon yin pas /
translated: Because the resident monk himself is the very place,

original: de'i phyir slob mas de la gnas bca' mi dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob mas de la gnas bca' mi dgos so //
translated: therefore the student does not need to live there.

original: gnas bcas pa gang gis 'jig par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnas bcas pa gang gis 'jig par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the destruction of that which has been taken up?

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga las mi ltos pa nyid byung ba ni gnas bcas pa 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga las mi ltos pa nyid byung ba ni gnas bcas pa 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the cause of the destruction of that which has been taken up is the very non-dependence on both.

original: gnyi ga las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is meant by both?

original: gnas dang gnas pa gnyi ga las te /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa gnyi ga las te /
translated: It means both the place and the resident.

original: mi ltos pa nyid cig car ram snga phyir byung na de ni gnas bcas pa blangs pa'i 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mi ltos pa nyid cig car ram snga phyir byung na de ni gnas bcas pa blangs pa'i 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: If non-dependence occurs simultaneously or sequentially, that is the cause of the destruction of that which has been taken up.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gal te gnas dang gnas pa gnyis dus gcig tu mi ltos pa nyid du gyur tam /
analyzed: gal te gnas dang gnas pa gnyis dus gcig tu mi ltos pa nyid du gyur tam /
translated: If both the place and the resident were to become non-dependent simultaneously,

original: 'on te snga phyir ngang por gnas mi ltos pa nyid du gyur la phyis gnas pa mi ltos pa nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te snga phyir ngang por gnas mi ltos pa nyid du gyur la phyis gnas pa mi ltos pa nyid du gyur na /
translated: But if it is not dependent on the prior state of the place, and later it is not dependent on the place,

original: de'i tshe na gnas zhig par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de'i tshe na gnas zhig par rig par bya'i /
translated: then at that time the place is known to be destroyed.

original: gcig mi ltos pa nyid du gyur pas ni gnas 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig mi ltos pa nyid du gyur pas ni gnas 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not dependent on one, the place is not destroyed.

original: gnas dum tshogs par gyur na /
analyzed: gnas dum tshogs par gyur na /
translated: If the place is a collection,

original: gang la gnas par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang la gnas par bya zhe na /
translated: on what would the place depend?

original: de'i phyir mkhan po ma yin pa dag chogs na 'dod pas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽gnas mkhan po de ni mkhan po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhan po ma yin pa dag chogs na 'dod pas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te / gnas mkhan po de ni mkhan po'o //
translated: Therefore, the non-abbot teachers say, “When the collection is desired, one should enter.”🔽The abbot is the one who abides in the place.

original: gnas mkhan po de las gzhan pa'i gnas ni /
analyzed: gnas mkhan po de las gzhan pa'i gnas ni /
translated: The place other than that abbot

original: mkhan po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhan po ma yin pa'o //
translated: is not an abbot.

original: mkhan po ma yin pa'i gnas de dag 'dus shing tshogs na ste /
analyzed: mkhan po ma yin pa'i gnas de dag 'dus shing tshogs na ste /
translated: When those non-abbot places gather and assemble,

original: tshogs par gyur pa ni tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs par gyur pa ni tshogs pa ste /
translated: having become a collection,

original: gnas @60b dag tshogs na'o //
analyzed: gnas @60b dag tshogs na'o //
translated: when the places gather,

original: de'i dus na gnas pa 'dod pas gnas su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na gnas pa 'dod pas gnas su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: at that time, desiring the place, one should enter the place.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gnas mang po dag tshogs par gyur pa na gnas kyi gang 'dod pa des gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas mang po dag tshogs par gyur pa na gnas kyi gang 'dod pa des gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When many dwelling places are available, he should stay in whichever dwelling place he likes.

original: de dang na de nyid kyis so zhes bya ba la /🔽de dang na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang na de nyid kyis so zhes bya ba la / de dang na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: mkhan por gtogs pa'i gnas de dang tshogs na'o //
analyzed: mkhan por gtogs pa'i gnas de dang tshogs na'o //
translated: In the same place where the preceptor is staying,

original: de nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni /🔽mkhan po de nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni / mkhan po de nyid kyis te /
translated: in that very place.🔽In the same place where the preceptor is staying,

original: mkhan po yin pa'i gnas de nyid kyis slob ma gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhan po yin pa'i gnas de nyid kyis slob ma gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: in that very place the disciple should stay.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te mkhan po dang slob dpon mang po zhig gtsug lag khang du lhan cig lhags par gyur la /
analyzed: gal te mkhan po dang slob dpon mang po zhig gtsug lag khang du lhan cig lhags par gyur la /
translated: If many preceptors and teachers come together in the monastery,

original: gnas pa yang de nyid du 'dus par gyur na /
analyzed: gnas pa yang de nyid du 'dus par gyur na /
translated: and the disciple also gathers in that very place,

original: gnas pas mkhan po nyid du gtogs pa'i gnas de nyid kyis gnas par bya'i /
analyzed: gnas pas mkhan po nyid du gtogs pa'i gnas de nyid kyis gnas par bya'i /
translated: the disciple should stay in that very place belonging to the preceptor.

original: gzhan gyis mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi bya'o //
translated: He should not stay in another place.

original: de ni gnas pas gnas la ji ltar bya ba de ston te /
analyzed: de ni gnas pas gnas la ji ltar bya ba de ston te /
translated: This shows how the disciple should behave towards the preceptor.

original: mkhan po mthong ma thag tu stan las ldang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mkhan po mthong ma thag tu stan las ldang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As soon as he sees his preceptor, he should rise from his seat.

original: mkhan po langs pa mthong na mthong ma thag kho nar stan las ldang bar bya ste /
analyzed: mkhan po langs pa mthong na mthong ma thag kho nar stan las ldang bar bya ste /
translated: When he sees his preceptor standing, he should rise from his seat immediately upon seeing him.

original: ldang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “should rise” is the same as before.

original: mkhan po mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba smos pa 'di ni dpe tsam ste /
analyzed: mkhan po mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba smos pa 'di ni dpe tsam ste /
translated: The expression “as soon as he sees his preceptor” is merely an illustration.

original: gnas gzhan dag mthong na yang da bzhin du stan las ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan dag mthong na yang da bzhin du stan las ldang bar bya'o //
translated: He should rise in the same way when he sees other holy persons.

original: gtsug lag khang de na 'dug na gnas pas nyin par lan gsum 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽gtsug lag khang gang na gnas 'dug pa'i gtsug lag khang de na gal te gnas pa yang 'dug par gyur na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de na 'dug na gnas pas nyin par lan gsum 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni / gtsug lag khang gang na gnas 'dug pa'i gtsug lag khang de na gal te gnas pa yang 'dug par gyur na /
translated: If he is staying in that monastery, he should go to his preceptor’s residence three times during the day.

original: de'i tshe gnas pas gnas de'i drung du nyin mo lan gsum 'gro bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas pas gnas de'i drung du nyin mo lan gsum 'gro bar bya ba'o //
translated: If he is staying in the monastery where his preceptor is staying, then he should go to his preceptor’s residence three times during the day.

original: gal te dgon pa na 'dug la rgyang grags tsam na nyin re lan re'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dgon pa na 'dug la rgyang grags tsam na nyin re lan re'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he is staying in a different monastery, then he should go to his preceptor’s residence once a day.🔽If he is staying in the wilderness, he should go to his preceptor’s residence once a day, if it is within a distance of one krosa.

original: gal te gnas dgon pa na 'dug la dgon pa de yang rgyang grags gcig na yong na /
analyzed: gal te gnas dgon pa na 'dug la dgon pa de yang rgyang grags gcig na yong na /
translated: If one is staying in a monastery, and that monastery is within a krośa,

original: gnas pas nyin re lan re 'ongs nas gnas de'i drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pas nyin re lan re 'ongs nas gnas de'i drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: then the resident monk should go to the resident monk’s place once a day.

original: rgyang grags lnga yod na zhag lnga'am drug cing do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyang grags lnga yod na zhag lnga'am drug cing do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is five krośas, then after five or six days.

original: gal te dgon pa ste rgyang grags lnga yod pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te dgon pa ste rgyang grags lnga yod pa zhig yin na /
translated: If the monastery is five krośas away,

original: de'i tshe gnas pas gnas kyi drung du zhag lnga'am drug cing 'ongs nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas pas gnas kyi drung du zhag lnga'am drug cing 'ongs nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: then the resident monk should go to the resident monk’s place after five or six days.

original: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum dag ni gso sbyang gi tshe'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed dang gsum dag ni gso sbyang gi tshe'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is one and a half yojanas, then at the time of the observance ceremony.

original: gal te dgon pa de dpag tshad phyed dang gsum dag yod la de na gnas @61a * //
analyzed: gal te dgon pa de dpag tshad phyed dang gsum dag yod la de na gnas @61a * //
translated: If the monastery is one and a half yojanas away,

original: 'dug na de'i tshe gnas pas gso sbyong gi nyin mo zla ba phyed phyed cing 'ongs nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug na de'i tshe gnas pas gso sbyong gi nyin mo zla ba phyed phyed cing 'ongs nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: and one is staying there, then the resident monk should go to the resident monk’s place every half month at the time of the observance ceremony.

original: da ni gnas kyis gnas pa la ji ltar gnas par bya ba ston te /
analyzed: da ni gnas kyis gnas pa la ji ltar gnas par bya ba ston te /
translated: Now it is taught how the resident monk should treat the visiting monk.

original: gnas pa chad pas gcad par 'os pa chad pas mi gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pa chad pas gcad par 'os pa chad pas mi gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not not punish those who deserve punishment by cutting off their livelihood.

original: gnas pa chad pas gcad par 'os pa chad pa'i las byed du gzhug par 'os pa gnas kyis chad pas mi gcad par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa chad pas gcad par 'os pa chad pa'i las byed du gzhug par 'os pa gnas kyis chad pas mi gcad par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not not punish by cutting off their livelihood those who deserve punishment by cutting off their livelihood, who are worthy of being made to perform a penance.

original: chad pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: chad pa du yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds of punishment are there?

original: de'i phyir chad pa ni lnga'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chad pa ni lnga'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “Punishment is fivefold.”

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de'i phyir / gtam 'dre bar mi bya ba dang / gdams ngag mi sbyin pa dang / bsnyen bkur dang chos dang zang zing dag gis longs spyod du mi gzhug pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs brtsams pa rgyun bcad pa dang / gnas dgag par bya ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gtam 'dre bar mi bya ba dang / gdams ngag mi sbyin pa dang / bsnyen bkur dang chos dang zang zing dag gis longs spyod du mi gzhug pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs brtsams pa rgyun bcad pa dang / gnas dgag par bya ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “Not conversing, not giving instruction, not allowing enjoyment, interrupting virtuous activities, and prohibiting residence.”

original: gtam mi bya ba ni gtam 'dre bar mi bya ba ste /🔽de dang lhan cig tshig smra ba rmi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtam mi bya ba ni gtam 'dre bar mi bya ba ste / de dang lhan cig tshig smra ba rmi bya ba'o //
translated: Not conversing means not conversing.🔽One should not converse with them.

original: gdams ngag mi sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: gdams ngag mi sbyin pa ni /
translated: Not giving instruction means

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i gdams ngag sbyin par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i gdams ngag sbyin par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not give instructions on meditation on the repulsive, etc.

original: bsnyen bkur dang chos dang zang zing dag gis longs spyod du mi gzhug pa ni de dag gis longs spyod pa mi sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur dang chos dang zang zing dag gis longs spyod du mi gzhug pa ni de dag gis longs spyod pa mi sbyin pa ste /
translated: One should not allow them to enjoy the Dharma or material things, i.e., one should not give them the opportunity to enjoy those things.

original: bgo bsha' ma byas pa'i bgo bsha' mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bgo bsha' ma byas pa'i bgo bsha' mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should not share what has not been shared.

original: dge ba'i phyogs brtsams pa rgyun bcad pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs brtsams pa rgyun bcad pa ni /
translated: One should interrupt the virtuous side that has been begun.

original: de bar du bcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bar du bcad par bya ba'o //
translated: One should interrupt it until that time.

original: gnas dgag par bya ba ni rnam par mnan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas dgag par bya ba ni rnam par mnan par bya ba'o //
translated: One should suppress the place that is to be suppressed.

original: chad pa rnams gang la 'os she na /
analyzed: chad pa rnams gang la 'os she na /
translated: For whom are the punishments?

original: de'i phyir ma pa dang / le lo can dang bka' blo mi bde ba dang / ma gus pa dang sdig pa'i grogs byed pa la de dag 'os pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /🔽ma dad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma pa dang / le lo can dang bka' blo mi bde ba dang / ma gus pa dang sdig pa'i grogs byed pa la de dag 'os pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te / ma dad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore it is said that they are appropriate for the faithless, the lazy, those who are discontented, those who are disrespectful, and those who befriend evildoers.🔽Faithlessness is the absence of faith.

original: gang la dad pa med pa de ni ma dad pa ste /
analyzed: gang la dad pa med pa de ni ma dad pa ste /
translated: Those who lack faith are faithless.

original: de la chad pa de dag 'os pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la chad pa de dag 'os pa nyid do //
translated: Those punishments are appropriate for them.

original: chad pas gcad par 'os pa ni de dag 'os pa ste /
analyzed: chad pas gcad par 'os pa ni de dag 'os pa ste /
translated: Those who deserve punishment are worthy of punishment.

original: de dag 'os pa'i dngos po ni de dag 'os pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag 'os pa'i dngos po ni de dag 'os pa nyid do //
translated: Worthiness of punishment is the state of being worthy of punishment.

original: ma dad pa 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi gzhan yang le lo can la sogs pa dag la yang 'os pa yin te ;
analyzed: ma dad pa 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi gzhan yang le lo can la sogs pa dag la yang 'os pa yin te ;
translated: It is not only the faithless who are worthy of punishment, but also the lazy and so on.

original: smad pa la gnas par byed pa ni /
analyzed: smad pa la gnas par byed pa ni /
translated: Those who are contemptible are

original: le lo can te /
analyzed: le lo can te /
translated: the lazy.

original: de yang chad pas gcad par 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang chad pas gcad par 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: They too are worthy of punishment.

original: tshig mi bzod pa ni bka' blo mi bde ba ste de yang ngo //🔽gus par mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: tshig mi bzod pa ni bka' blo mi bde ba ste de yang ngo // gus par mi byed pa ni /
translated: Those who are disobedient are disobedient to the word.

original: ma gus pa ste de yang ngo //
analyzed: ma gus pa ste de yang ngo //
translated: Those who are disrespectful are disrespectful.

original: gang sdig pa'i grogs yin pa de ni sdig pa'i grogs byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang sdig pa'i grogs yin pa de ni sdig pa'i grogs byed pa ste /
translated: Those who are evil friends are friends of the unrighteous.

original: de @61b yang chad pas gcad par 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de @61b yang chad pas gcad par 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: They too are worthy of punishment.

original: gal te gzhan zhig gis de len par byed na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan zhig gis de len par byed na /
translated: If someone else accepts the punishment,

original: gzhan de la ci 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan de la ci 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what happens to that other person?

original: de'i phyir chad pas bcad pa gzhan gyis len par byed pa la nyes pa sbom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chad pas bcad pa gzhan gyis len par byed pa la nyes pa sbom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the one who accepts the punishment of another incurs a grave offense.

original: chad pas bcad pa gnas las gzhan pa'i len pa pos len par byed na /
analyzed: chad pas bcad pa gnas las gzhan pa'i len pa pos len par byed na /
translated: If the one who is to be punished is punished by someone other than the one who has the authority to punish,

original: de la dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyis dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //🔽de ltar byas kyang gal te de bzod pa gsol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyis dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur bar rig par bya'o // de ltar byas kyang gal te de bzod pa gsol ba'i phyir /
translated: then the offense of a serious transgression that is a remainder of the Saṅgha split should be understood.

original: gus par mi byed na /
analyzed: gus par mi byed na /
translated: If, even though he has acted in this way, he does not show respect in order to request forgiveness,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: then what should be done?

original: de'i phyir / gus par mi byed na drang por bya ba'i phyir dge slong shes nyen can bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gus par mi byed na drang por bya ba'i phyir dge slong shes nyen can bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “In order to make him upright, a monk who is wise should be appointed.”

original: gnas pa gus par mi byed na de drang por rnal du dbab par bya ba'i phyir dag slong gzhan bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa gus par mi byed na de drang por rnal du dbab par bya ba'i phyir dag slong gzhan bsko bar bya'o //
translated: If the one who is to be punished does not show respect, in order to make him upright and calm, another monk should be appointed.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of monk should be appointed?

original: de'i phyir shes nyen can zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes nyen can zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “who is wise.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gnas kyis gnas pa de drang por rnal du dbab pa'i phyir dge slong shes nyen can bska zhing des gnas pa ma gus pa de bzod pa gsol du gzhug pa'i phyir drang por rnal du dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas kyis gnas pa de drang por rnal du dbab pa'i phyir dge slong shes nyen can bska zhing des gnas pa ma gus pa de bzod pa gsol du gzhug pa'i phyir drang por rnal du dbab par bya'o //
translated: The monk who is skilled in the rules should be sent to the one who is staying in the monastery in order to settle him in a straightforward, natural way. He should be settled in a straightforward, natural way in order to make the one who is staying in the monastery request forgiveness from the one who is not respectful.

original: rgyu btang ba bzod pa gsol bar byed pa la bzod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu btang ba bzod pa gsol bar byed pa la bzod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should forgive the one who requests forgiveness after giving up the reason.

original: gang gis ma dad pa nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu btang ba de ni rgyu btang bste ;
analyzed: gang gis ma dad pa nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu btang ba de ni rgyu btang bste ;
translated: The one who has given up the reason for lack of faith, etc. is the one who has given up the reason.

original: de la gnas kyis bzod par bya ste dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas kyis bzod par bya ste dga' bar bya'o //
translated: One should forgive him and be pleased with him.

original: 'o na ci rgyu btang ba tsam kho nar zad la bzod pa gsol bar mi byed pa la yang bzod par bya 'am zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci rgyu btang ba tsam kho nar zad la bzod pa gsol bar mi byed pa la yang bzod par bya 'am zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if he just gives up the reason and does not request forgiveness, should one forgive him? No, one should not.

original: de'i phyir bzod pa gsol bar byed pa la zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzod pa gsol bar byed pa la zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “the one who requests forgiveness.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te gnas pas rgyu yang btang la gnas la bzod pa gsol bar yang byed na de'i tshe gnas kyis bzod par bya'o /
analyzed: gal te gnas pas rgyu yang btang la gnas la bzod pa gsol bar yang byed na de'i tshe gnas kyis bzod par bya'o /
translated: If the one who is staying in the monastery gives up the reason and also requests forgiveness from the one who is not staying in the monastery, then the one who is staying in the monastery should forgive him.

original: de bzhin pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not so for the one who is suitable.

original: mi 'os pa chad pas gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'os pa chad pas gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not punish the one who is not suitable to be punished.

original: mi 'os pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa chad pas gcad par mi 'os pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'os pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa chad pas gcad par mi 'os pa ste /
translated: The one who is not suitable to be punished is the one who is endowed with the qualities of faith, etc.

original: de chad pas gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de chad pas gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not punish him.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa chad pas gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽/ bam po drug pa /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa chad pas gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // / bam po drug pa /
translated: One should not punish the one who is endowed with the qualities of faith, etc.

original: 'os pa la mi bzod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'os pa la mi bzod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not be impatient with the one who is suitable to be punished.

original: rgyu btang ba bzod par bya bar 'os pa la mi bzod par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu btang ba bzod par bya bar 'os pa la mi bzod par mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not be impatient with the one who is suitable to be punished, who is the one who has given up the cause.

original: bzod par bya ba kho na'o //🔽mdo de gnyis @62a * //
analyzed: bzod par bya ba kho na'o // mdo de gnyis @62a * //
translated: One should be patient only with the one who is suitable to be punished.

original: ni tshul ma yin pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni tshul ma yin pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These two sutras are for the purpose of abandoning the unsuitable.

original: mi 'os pa la bzod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi 'os pa la bzod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not be patient with the one who is not suitable to be punished.

original: rgyu ma btang ba bzod par bya bar mi 'os pa la bzod par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu ma btang ba bzod par bya bar mi 'os pa la bzod par mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not be patient with the one who is not suitable to be punished, who is the one who has not given up the cause.

original: de ni ha cang mang du yod pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ha cang mang du yod pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is for the purpose of abandoning the one who has too much.

original: gal te drang por byar ma nus na de'i tshe gnas kyis ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te drang por byar ma nus na de'i tshe gnas kyis ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: If one is unable to be honest, then how should one act in that situation?

original: de'i phyir mi byed pa nyid yin na gnas khang nas bskrad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi byed pa nyid yin na gnas khang nas bskrad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If he does not act, he should be expelled from the monastery.”

original: byed pa'i dngos po ni byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa'i dngos po ni byed pa nyid do //
translated: The state of acting is acting itself.

original: mi byed pa nyid ni drang po'i dngos po mi byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mi byed pa nyid ni drang po'i dngos po mi byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: The state of not acting is not acting in an honest way.

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad du drang por byar mi nus na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad du drang por byar mi nus na /
translated: If one is completely unable to be honest,

original: de'i tshe de gnas khang nas bskrad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de gnas khang nas bskrad par bya ste /
translated: then he should be expelled from the monastery.

original: de gnas khang nas dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnas khang nas dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he should be removed from the monastery.

original: ci yo byad med par bskrad par bya'am zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci yo byad med par bskrad par bya'am zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: Should he be expelled without any possessions?

original: dge tshul la ni chu tshags dang ril pa spyi blugs dang mthang gos dang bcas pa'i blo gos kyang byin te'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge tshul la ni chu tshags dang ril pa spyi blugs dang mthang gos dang bcas pa'i blo gos kyang byin te'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The novice monk should be given his water strainer, his water filter, his lower robe, and his upper robe.”

original: chu tshags dang ril pa spyi blugs ni /
analyzed: chu tshags dang ril pa spyi blugs ni /
translated: The water strainer and the water filter are

original: chu tshags dang ril ba spyi blugs te de gnyis byin te'o //
analyzed: chu tshags dang ril ba spyi blugs te de gnyis byin te'o //
translated: and a water filter and a water-pot.

original: mthang gos dang bla gos phrugs su bcas pa ni /
analyzed: mthang gos dang bla gos phrugs su bcas pa ni /
translated: The lower robe and the upper robe are folded up.

original: mthang gos dang bcas pa'i bla gos so //
analyzed: mthang gos dang bcas pa'i bla gos so //
translated: The upper robe is together with the lower robe.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni /🔽de yang byin te zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽gnas kyis dge tshul la ni de dag byin te /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni / de yang byin te zhes bya bar sbyar te / gnas kyis dge tshul la ni de dag byin te /
translated: Also means🔽that those are given.

original: bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: bskrad par bya'o //
translated: The novice monk is given those and then expelled.

original: gal te rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa zhig yin na yo byad lnga'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa zhig yin na yo byad lnga'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he wants full ordination, he is given five articles.

original: gal te rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa zhig yin na de'i tshe yo byad lnga byin te bskrad par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa zhig yin na de'i tshe yo byad lnga byin te bskrad par bya ste /
translated: If he wants full ordination, then he is given five articles and then expelled.

original: chos gos gsum dang stan dang lhung bzed do //
analyzed: chos gos gsum dang stan dang lhung bzed do //
translated: The three Dharma robes, a seat, and a begging-bowl.

original: chu tshags kyang sbyin par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chu tshags kyang sbyin par bya ba yin te /
translated: A water filter is also given.

original: 'dir ma smos pa ni mdo snga mar smos pas de ni ma smos kyang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ma smos pa ni mdo snga mar smos pas de ni ma smos kyang grub pa yin no //
translated: It is not mentioned here because it was mentioned in the previous sūtra.

original: des na yo byad drug po dag sbyin par bya'o zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na yo byad drug po dag sbyin par bya'o zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the six articles are given.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba yang yo byad drug po dag byin te /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba yang yo byad drug po dag byin te /
translated: Also, one should expel from the monastery the one who has been fully ordained, having given the six articles to him.

original: gnas khang nas bskrad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas khang nas bskrad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should expel him from the monastery.

original: de ltar bskrad pa na gal te dang por gyur na ci de rnam pa thams cad du blang bar mi bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bskrad pa na gal te dang por gyur na ci de rnam pa thams cad du blang bar mi bya'am zhe na /
translated: If, having been expelled, he becomes a novice monk again, should he not be accepted in every way?

original: de'i phyir seng ge ltar gya tshom mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir seng ge ltar gya tshom mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “One should not act rashly like a lion.”

original: ji ltar seng ge zas gang spangs pa de nam yang phyir mi len pa de ltar gya tshom mi bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar seng ge zas gang spangs pa de nam yang phyir mi len pa de ltar gya tshom mi bya ste /
translated: Just as a lion never takes back the food he has abandoned, so one should not act rashly.

original: gal te drang por gyur na yan phyir blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te drang por gyur na yan phyir blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he becomes upright, then he should be accepted again, that is the meaning.

original: gnod par 'gyur @62b ba'i khrims su bya ba mi bca'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnod par 'gyur @62b ba'i khrims su bya ba mi bca'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not make a rule that would be harmful.

original: gang gnod par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi khrims su bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gang gnod par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi khrims su bya ba de ni /
translated: A rule that would be harmful is a rule that is harmful.

original: gnod par bya ba'i khrims su bya ba ste de mi bca'o //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba'i khrims su bya ba ste de mi bca'o //
translated: One should not make that.

original: dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis khrims su bya ba gang gis dge slong dag la gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis khrims su bya ba gang gis dge slong dag la gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: The monks who are members of the Sangha should not make a rule that would be harmful to the monks.

original: ma byas na yang nyes pa 'ga' yang med pa de lta bu'i khrims su bya ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma byas na yang nyes pa 'ga' yang med pa de lta bu'i khrims su bya ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If they do not make such a rule, there is no fault.

original: kha'i gnas pa nyid ni ma bkrus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: kha'i gnas pa nyid ni ma bkrus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The state of not rinsing the mouth is the state of not having cleansed the mouth.

original: kha'i mtshan mo nyal nyal bas gnas pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid ma bkrus pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kha'i mtshan mo nyal nyal bas gnas pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid ma bkrus pa nyid yin te /
translated: The state of not having cleansed the mouth is the state of having slept during the night with the mouth as a sign.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is the state of having something in the mouth.

original: de bas na ji srid du so shing la sogs pas kha ma sbyangs kyi bar du re zhig phyag dang bza' ba la sogs pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ji srid du so shing la sogs pas kha ma sbyangs kyi bar du re zhig phyag dang bza' ba la sogs pa mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, until the mouth is cleansed with a tooth stick and so on, one should not perform prostrations, eat, and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong gis so shing ma bor bar bsod snyoms bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis so shing ma bor bar bsod snyoms bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk should not eat alms-food without discarding the tooth stick.

original: zos na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang / phyag gi gzhung ni /
analyzed: zos na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang / phyag gi gzhung ni /
translated: And the text of the venerable Pūrṇavardhana states:

original: ldang byed 'di la lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas kyis nang par sngar langs te sham thabs zlum por bgos nas so shing bor te mtshams kyi nang gi mchod rten la phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ldang byed 'di la lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas kyis nang par sngar langs te sham thabs zlum por bgos nas so shing bor te mtshams kyi nang gi mchod rten la phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “Here, a resident monk or a novice monk should rise early in the morning, put on his lower robe so that it hangs evenly all around, throw away his tooth cleaner, and pay homage to the caitya inside the monastery.”

original: de'i phyir mdo 'di smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo 'di smos so //
translated: Therefore, this sūtra is cited.

original: so shing dben par dong ro zhes bya ba ni kha sbyang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so shing dben par dong ro zhes bya ba ni kha sbyang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Go to a secluded place and throw away your tooth cleaner” is for the purpose of cleaning your mouth.

original: ji ltar dor bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dor bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should you throw it away?

original: de'i phyir dben par zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dben par zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in a secluded place.”

original: lkog tu 'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lkog tu 'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means “in private.”

original: dben pa'i skabs kyis bshad gci bya ba yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dben pa'i skabs kyis bshad gci bya ba yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text continues, “You should also defecate and urinate in a secluded place.”

original: bshad ba dang gci ba ni bshang gci ste /
analyzed: bshad ba dang gci ba ni bshang gci ste /
translated: “Defecate and urinate” means to defecate and urinate.

original: de gnyis kyi bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bya ba yang ngo //
translated: “The act of” means the action of these two.

original: de yang ci ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should you do this?

original: dben par bya ste /
analyzed: dben par bya ste /
translated: You should do it in a secluded place.

original: bya ba'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir ma ning gi rtags su byas so //
analyzed: bya ba'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir ma ning gi rtags su byas so //
translated: Since it is a particular type of action, it is called a neuter sign.

original: de gnyis kyi gnas bstan pa'i phyir longs spyad du rung ba'i shing ngam rtsig pa'i drung du mi dor ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi gnas bstan pa'i phyir longs spyad du rung ba'i shing ngam rtsig pa'i drung du mi dor ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to indicate the place for those two, it is said, “One should not throw it in front of a tree or wall that is fit to be used.”

original: longs spyad par 'os pa ni longs spyad du rung ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyad par 'os pa ni longs spyad du rung ba ste /
translated: That which is fit to be used is fit to be enjoyed.

original: de'i shing ngam rtsig pa'i drung du nye bar so shing dor ba dang bshad gci dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i shing ngam rtsig pa'i drung du nye bar so shing dor ba dang bshad gci dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not throw a tooth stick or excrement near a tree or wall that is fit to be used.

original: 'dir gang du skye bo phal po che rtag tu gnas pa de ni longs spyod du rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang du skye bo phal po che rtag tu gnas pa de ni longs spyod du rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, that which is fit to be used is said to be that place where many people always stay.

original: so shing gi tshad shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: so shing gi tshad shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to know the measure of a tooth stick, it is said,

original: de'i tshad ni sor bcu gnyis man chad sor brgyad yan chad do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i tshad ni sor bcu gnyis man chad sor brgyad yan chad do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Its measure is twelve finger breadths at the most, and eight at the least.”

original: so shing @63a * //🔽de'i srid kyi tshad ni sor bcu gnyis man chad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: so shing @63a * // de'i srid kyi tshad ni sor bcu gnyis man chad ces bya ba la /
translated: The measure of a tooth stick🔽is twelve finger breadths at the most, and eight at the least.

original: bcu gnyis po dag gi tshogs ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu gnyis po dag gi tshogs ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: The collection of twelve is twelve finger breadths.

original: gang gi zhe na sor dag gi ste /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na sor dag gi ste /
translated: What is the measure?

original: de bas na sor dag gi bcu gnyis kyi tshogs man chad do //
analyzed: de bas na sor dag gi bcu gnyis kyi tshogs man chad do //
translated: Twelve finger breadths and less.🔽Eight finger breadths and more.

original: sor brgyad yan chad ces bya ba 'dir yang brgyad po dag gi tshogs ni brgyad do //🔽yan chad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sor brgyad yan chad ces bya ba 'dir yang brgyad po dag gi tshogs ni brgyad do // yan chad ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, eight finger breadths and more means

original: mtshams de yan chad yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams de yan chad yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: that one should understand that the measure is more than that.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words here is as follows.

original: so shing gi srid ni sor bcu gnyis man chad sor brgyad yan chad do //
analyzed: so shing gi srid ni sor bcu gnyis man chad sor brgyad yan chad do //
translated: The length of the tooth stick is twelve finger breadths and less, or eight finger breadths and more.

original: nye bar sbyar ba de'i 'ga' zhig dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba de'i 'ga' zhig dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach an exception to that application,

original: bad kan mang ba'i ni med na sor bzhi las lhag pa yan chad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bad kan mang ba'i ni med na sor bzhi las lhag pa yan chad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it says, “For those with excess phlegm, it is permissible to use one more than four finger breadths in length.”

original: gang zag bad kan mang pa'i so shing ni tshad sngar bstan pa lta bu nyid med na sor bzhi po dag gi tshogs ni sor bzhi ste /
analyzed: gang zag bad kan mang pa'i so shing ni tshad sngar bstan pa lta bu nyid med na sor bzhi po dag gi tshogs ni sor bzhi ste /
translated: If the tooth stick of a person with excess phlegm is not the prescribed length, then a group of four finger breadths is four finger breadths.

original: de las lhag pa'i tshad yan chad rung ngo //
analyzed: de las lhag pa'i tshad yan chad rung ngo //
translated: It is permissible to use one of that length or more.

original: sor bzhi las lhag pa yan chad ces bya ba ni /🔽sor phyed dang lnga yan chad yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sor bzhi las lhag pa yan chad ces bya ba ni / sor phyed dang lnga yan chad yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase more than four finger-widths🔽means that it should be known to be more than four and a half finger-widths.

original: gang zag bad kan mang ba'i so shing gi srid kyi tshad ni sor bzhi yan chad rung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag bad kan mang ba'i so shing gi srid kyi tshad ni sor bzhi yan chad rung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The length of a tooth-stick for a person with an excess of phlegm is known to be suitable if it is more than four finger-widths.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gal te dge slong bad kan mang po zhig yin la de sa so shing gi tshad sngar bstan pa'i mthar thug pa nyid ma rnyed na sor phyed dang lnga yan chad gang rnyed pa yang dor bar bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gal te dge slong bad kan mang po zhig yin la de sa so shing gi tshad sngar bstan pa'i mthar thug pa nyid ma rnyed na sor phyed dang lnga yan chad gang rnyed pa yang dor bar bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: If a monk has an excess of phlegm and does not find a tooth-stick of the length taught previously, then he should use whatever he finds that is more than four and a half finger-widths.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bar ni dbus te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bar ni dbus te /
translated: Here, the text says,

original: 'di ltar bad kan mang po gang yin pa de dag gis so shing sor bzhi pa ma gtogs pa yang dor bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bad kan mang po gang yin pa de dag gis so shing sor bzhi pa ma gtogs pa yang dor bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who have an excess of phlegm should use a tooth-stick that is more than four finger-widths.

original: gnas khang du so shing dor ba la mi rigs par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas khang du so shing dor ba la mi rigs par dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt that it is inappropriate to throw away a tooth-stick in a dwelling place,🔽the text says,

original: gnas khang du chol zangs kyi nang du so shing dor bar mi rigs pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnas khang du chol zangs kyi nang du so shing dor bar mi rigs pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is not improper to discard the tooth stick in a container in the living quarters.

original: gnas khang du chol zangs kyi nang du so shing dor ba ni tshul dang mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: gnas khang du chol zangs kyi nang du so shing dor ba ni tshul dang mi mthun pa med do //
translated: There is nothing improper in discarding the tooth stick in a container in the living quarters.

original: so shing dben par dor ro zhes smas pa la wa kha yang dben pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽de la wa kha yang mi dpen par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: so shing dben par dor ro zhes smas pa la wa kha yang dben pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro // de la wa kha yang mi dpen par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The statement, “Discard the tooth stick in a secluded place,” was made in order to indicate that a ravine is also a secluded place.🔽The statement, “A ravine is not a secluded place,” was made in order to indicate that a ravine is also a secluded place.

original: so shing dor ba de la wa khar byed na yang mi dben par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: so shing dor ba de la wa khar byed na yang mi dben par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if one discards the tooth stick in a ravine, it is not a secluded place.

original: dben pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dben pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is a secluded place.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: wa khar so shing dor bar byed pa na /🔽dben pa gang yin pa de nyid kyang dben pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i @63b ba tshig go //
analyzed: wa khar so shing dor bar byed pa na / dben pa gang yin pa de nyid kyang dben pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i @63b ba tshig go //
translated: When one discards the tooth stick in a ravine,🔽that very seclusion should be understood as seclusion.

original: wa kha'i nyen khor yang de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: wa kha'i nyen khor yang de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement, “The danger in a ravine is included in that very danger,” was made in order to indicate that the danger in a ravine is included in the danger of a secluded place.

original: de'i khru gang khor yug tu rnam pa de lta bur byar rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i khru gang khor yug tu rnam pa de lta bur byar rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is suitable to do that kind of thing there, within a cubit’s distance all around.

original: der zhes bya ba ni wa khar ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni wa khar ro //
translated: “There” means in the urinal.

original: wa kha der khru gang khor yug tu so shing dor ba dang rkang pa bkru ba la sogs pa rnam pa de lta bu byar rung ste /
analyzed: wa kha der khru gang khor yug tu so shing dor ba dang rkang pa bkru ba la sogs pa rnam pa de lta bu byar rung ste /
translated: It is suitable to do that kind of thing there, within a cubit’s distance all around, such as throwing away the tooth stick, washing the feet, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa sa de na longs spyad du rung gi khru gang gi khor yug las lhag par ni so shing dor ba la sogs pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa sa de na longs spyad du rung gi khru gang gi khor yug las lhag par ni so shing dor ba la sogs pa mi bya'o //
translated: It is suitable to use that place, which is included in that area, but one should not throw away the tooth stick, and so on, beyond the area of a cubit’s distance all around.

original: so shing dor ba dang 'brel pas de'i rjes la lce bzhar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: so shing dor ba dang 'brel pas de'i rjes la lce bzhar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In connection with throwing away the tooth stick, it is said, “After that, one should clean the tongue.”

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni so shing dor ba'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni so shing dor ba'i 'o //
translated: “That” means throwing away the tooth stick.

original: rjes la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “After that” means

original: de ma thag tu ste /
analyzed: de ma thag tu ste /
translated: immediately after.

original: lce bzhar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lce bzhar bar bya'o //
translated: One should clean the tongue.

original: ci zhig gis bzhar bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gis bzhar bar bya zhe na /
translated: With what should one clean it?

original: de'i phyir lce bzhar nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lce bzhar nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “One should keep a tongue cleaner handy.”

original: lce bzhar bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lce bzhar bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should carry a tongue-scraper.

original: ci las byas pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci las byas pa zhe na /
translated: What is it made of?

original: de'i phyir khab kyi rdzas dag las so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khab kyi rdzas dag las so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “It is made of metal.”

original: rdzas gang dag las khab byed par gan dang zangs dang khar ba dang lcags dag las bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzas gang dag las khab byed par gan dang zangs dang khar ba dang lcags dag las bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is made of iron, copper, bronze, or steel, from which materials needles are made.

original: lce bzhar med pa dag gi phyir dor 'di la so shing gi tshal pa rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lce bzhar med pa dag gi phyir dor 'di la so shing gi tshal pa rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For those who do not have a tongue-scraper, it is appropriate to use a piece of wood from the tooth-stick.

original: don 'di la zhes bya ba ni /🔽lce bzhar ba'i don la'o //
analyzed: don 'di la zhes bya ba ni / lce bzhar ba'i don la'o //
translated: The meaning is🔽with regard to the tongue-scraper.

original: so shing gi tshal pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so shing gi tshal pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is appropriate to use a piece of wood from the tooth-stick.

original: rung pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rung pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make it appropriate,

original: de mi rno bar bya ba'i phyir gcig gis gcig brud par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de mi rno bar bya ba'i phyir gcig gis gcig brud par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “In order to make it not sharp, it should be rubbed against another.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni so shing gi tshal pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni so shing gi tshal pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “it” is the piece of wood from the tooth-stick.

original: mi rno bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rno bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In order to make it not sharp” means

original: ha cang zur rnon po bcag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ha cang zur rnon po bcag pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to avoid very sharp edges.

original: de'i phyir gcig gis gcig brud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig gis gcig brud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be filed down by one another.

original: so la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyid spang ba'i phyir /🔽mi rno bas so dang lce dang rna ba brud bzhar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: so la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyid spang ba'i phyir / mi rno bas so dang lce dang rna ba brud bzhar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to avoid the suffering of the teeth, etc.🔽One should not file or cut the teeth, lips, or ears with sharp things.

original: dngos po rnon pos so la sogs pa mi brud mi bzhar ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnon pos so la sogs pa mi brud mi bzhar ro //
translated: One should not file or cut the teeth, etc. with sharp things.

original: mi rno bas kyang dal gyis ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rno bas kyang dal gyis ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not do it slowly with blunt things.

original: so la sogs pa dal bus khad kyis brud pa dang bzhar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so la sogs pa dal bus khad kyis brud pa dang bzhar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should not file or cut the teeth, etc. slowly or gradually with blunt things.

original: ji ltar dal bus she na de'i phyir /🔽de dag gis sha la mi gnod par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar dal bus she na de'i phyir / de dag gis sha la mi gnod par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How slowly?🔽So as not to injure the flesh.

original: so'i rnyil la sogs pa mi snang par ro //
analyzed: so'i rnyil la sogs pa mi snang par ro //
translated: So as not to expose the roots of the teeth, etc.

original: so shing dor ba'i zhar la so dang lce gnyis kyi brud bzhar gyi phyogs kha'i dri mas gos pa ma bkrus sam sas ma bskus par mi dor ro zhes bya ba 'di smras te /
analyzed: so shing dor ba'i zhar la so dang lce gnyis kyi brud bzhar gyi phyogs kha'i dri mas gos pa ma bkrus sam sas ma bskus par mi dor ro zhes bya ba 'di smras te /
translated: One should not discard the tooth stick without washing or rubbing with earth the place where the teeth and tongue were cleaned.

original: so dang lce gnyis kyi brud bzhar ni so shing ste /
analyzed: so dang lce gnyis kyi brud bzhar ni so shing ste /
translated: The tooth stick is the scraper for cleaning the teeth and tongue.

original: de'i phyogs dbus kyis @64a * //
analyzed: de'i phyogs dbus kyis @64a * //
translated: The middle part of the tooth stick is used to clean the tongue.

original: lce bzhar ba dang rtse mo sos bcas pa'i phyogs de kha'i dri mas gos shing spags pa'i so shing de ma bkrus par mi dor ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lce bzhar ba dang rtse mo sos bcas pa'i phyogs de kha'i dri mas gos shing spags pa'i so shing de ma bkrus par mi dor ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The place where the teeth and tongue were cleaned is soiled with the odor of spittle. One should not discard the tooth stick without washing or rubbing with earth that place.

original: sas ma bskus par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sas ma bskus par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Without rubbing with earth means

original: chu med na sas bsku bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: chu med na sas bsku bar bya ba ste /
translated: without washing with water, one should rub with earth.

original: so shing zhes bya ba'i brud bzhar gyi so shing de'i phyogs gang gis so dang lce brud cing bzhar ba'i phyogs de sas ma bskus bar mi dor ba'o //
analyzed: so shing zhes bya ba'i brud bzhar gyi so shing de'i phyogs gang gis so dang lce brud cing bzhar ba'i phyogs de sas ma bskus bar mi dor ba'o //
translated: One should not discard the tooth stick without rubbing with earth the place where the teeth and tongue were cleaned with the tooth stick.

original: sgra ma byas bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgra ma byas bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not discard the tooth stick without making a sound.

original: se gol la sogs pa'i sgra ma byas par so shing dang tshal pa dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: se gol la sogs pa'i sgra ma byas par so shing dang tshal pa dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not discard the tooth stick or the water for rinsing the mouth without making a sound with one's fingers, etc.🔽This is an example.

original: de ni dpe yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽de ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni dpe yin no zhes bya ba la / de ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word this refers to🔽the tooth stick and the water for rinsing the mouth.

original: so dang lce gnyis kyi brud bzhar sgra ma byas par mi dor ba de'o //
analyzed: so dang lce gnyis kyi brud bzhar sgra ma byas par mi dor ba de'o //
translated: One should not discard them without making a sound with one's fingers, etc.

original: gang gi dpe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi dpe zhe na /
translated: What is the example?

original: sgra ma byas par mi do rang gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: sgra ma byas par mi do rang gzhan gyi'o //
translated: One should not discard one's own or another's without making a sound.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: dor bar bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po gzhan gang yin pa yang sgra ma byas par mi dor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dor bar bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po gzhan gang yin pa yang sgra ma byas par mi dor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should not discard any object that is to be discarded without making a sound.

original: dpes gang mtshon pa de ston to //
analyzed: dpes gang mtshon pa de ston to //
translated: That which is indicated by the example is taught.

original: bshad ba dang gci ba dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / skyugs pa dang / rlugs pa dang / gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bshad ba dang gci ba dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / skyugs pa dang / rlugs pa dang / gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: One should not discard feces, urine, saliva, mucus, vomit, or phlegm, or anything else, without making a sound.

original: skyugs pa dang rlugs pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
analyzed: skyugs pa dang rlugs pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
translated: The words vomit and phlegm are mentioned

original: mchil ma dang bshad ba gnyis las gzhan yin te /
analyzed: mchil ma dang bshad ba gnyis las gzhan yin te /
translated: because they are different from saliva and feces.🔽Not saliva, but vomit,

original: mchil ma ma yin la skyugs pa yin pa ni /
analyzed: mchil ma ma yin la skyugs pa yin pa ni /
translated: is not feces, but vomit.🔽 Not feces, but phlegm,🔽 is not saliva, but phlegm.

original: 'di lta ste dper na sna'i bshal sman lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na sna'i bshal sman lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a nasal medicine.

original: rlugs pa yin la bshad ba ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rlugs pa yin la bshad ba ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is expelled but not ejected, for example,

original: 'khru ba can gyis ji ltar zos pa de bzhin du zur du rlugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khru ba can gyis ji ltar zos pa de bzhin du zur du rlugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the contents of the stomach are expelled but not ejected by one who suffers from diarrhea.

original: gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig ni bshad ba la sogs pa las gzhan pa dor bar bya ba thams cad bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig ni bshad ba la sogs pa las gzhan pa dor bar bya ba thams cad bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” means that all things to be discarded, other than those that are ejected, etc., are included.

original: so shing dor ba dang 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de las byi dor 'byung ba bzhin du 'dag rdzas dang lci bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: so shing dor ba dang 'dra ba'i dngos po gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir / de las byi dor 'byung ba bzhin du 'dag rdzas dang lci bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are other things that are like discarding the tooth stick,🔽he says, “purification is like the arising of grooming from it, as well as from ashes and cow dung.”

original: so shing dor ba de las so la sogs pa'i byi dor 'byung ba bzhin du 'dag rdzas dang lci bas kyang byi dor 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: so shing dor ba de las so la sogs pa'i byi dor 'byung ba bzhin du 'dag rdzas dang lci bas kyang byi dor 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Just as grooming arises from discarding the tooth stick, so also purification arises from ashes and cow dung.

original: 'dir gzhung ni so shing ma rnyed na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni so shing ma rnyed na /
translated: In this regard, the text says, “If you do not find a tooth stick,

original: 'dag rdzas dang ba lang gi lci ba las kyang kha sbyang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dag rdzas dang ba lang gi lci ba las kyang kha sbyang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should also clean one's teeth with a twig and cowdung.

original: lus kyi kyang bsgrubs ma thag tu mchod rten la phyag bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyi kyang bsgrubs ma thag tu mchod rten la phyag bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should also perform the bodily practice immediately after, and then pay homage to the stupa.

original: lus kyi bya ba bsgrub pa so shing bor ba'i 'og tu mchod rten la phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bya ba bsgrub pa so shing bor ba'i 'og tu mchod rten la phyag bya ba'o //
translated: The bodily practice is to pay homage to the stupa after throwing away the tooth stick.

original: gnas pas sgrub pa'i dbang du bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pas sgrub pa'i dbang du bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The author now begins the section on the practice of abiding, saying, From the perspective of the practice of abiding.

original: aa tha zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbang du bya ba'i don yin gyi de ma thag @64b gi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: aa tha zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbang du bya ba'i don yin gyi de ma thag @64b gi don ni ma yin te /
translated: The word atha has the meaning of perspective, not the meaning of immediately after,

original: mdo 'og ma khon las de ma thag tu zhes bya ba'i tshig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo 'og ma khon las de ma thag tu zhes bya ba'i tshig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word immediately after occurs in the following sutra.

original: 'di man chad ni gnas pas sgrub pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni gnas pas sgrub pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: From here on is from the perspective of the practice of abiding.

original: gnas pas bya ba ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pas bya ba ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it teaches the practice of abiding.

original: da ni gnas pas sgrub pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni gnas pas sgrub pa ston te /
translated: Now it teaches the practice of abiding.

original: de nas de ma thag tu sngar song ste phyag bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nas de ma thag tu sngar song ste phyag bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, immediately after, one should go and pay homage.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Then means

original: lus kyi bya ba bsgrubs nas mchod rten la phyag byas nas so //
analyzed: lus kyi bya ba bsgrubs nas mchod rten la phyag byas nas so //
translated: Having performed the bodily duties, he should pay homage to the caitya.

original: de ma thag tu gnas pas gnas kyi drung du sngar song ste phyag bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ma thag tu gnas pas gnas kyi drung du sngar song ste phyag bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Immediately afterwards, he should go to the presence of the resident monk and pay homage to him. This is the meaning.

original: bsnyun gsol lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyun gsol lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should inquire about his health.

original: gnas pas gnas la'o //
analyzed: gnas pas gnas la'o //
translated: The resident monk should inquire about the health of the newly arrived monk.

original: 'dag rdzas dang so shing dbul lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dag rdzas dang so shing dbul lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should offer him cleansing and a tooth cleaner.

original: gnas de la gnas pa des 'dag rdzas dang so shing dag dbul zhing bstabs par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de la gnas pa des 'dag rdzas dang so shing dag dbul zhing bstabs par bya'o //
translated: The resident monk should offer the newly arrived monk cleansing and a tooth cleaner.

original: chu la sogs pa ni ma bstan yang grub pa'i phyir ma smos so //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa ni ma bstan yang grub pa'i phyir ma smos so //
translated: Water, etc. are not mentioned because they are established even without being taught.

original: tshang mang blta ste brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshang mang blta ste brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should look at the kitchen and announce it.

original: gnas pas g-yos kyi khang pa bltas brtags te gnas la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pas g-yos kyi khang pa bltas brtags te gnas la brjod par bya'o //
translated: The resident monk should look at the kitchen and announce it to the newly arrived monk.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: tshang mang der bza' ba dang btung ba gang dag sta gon bya bar 'dod na gnas pas gnas la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshang mang der bza' ba dang btung ba gang dag sta gon bya bar 'dod na gnas pas gnas la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If any food and drink are to be prepared in that kitchen, the resident monk should announce it to the newly arrived monk. This is the meaning.

original: dga' ba stobs pa nyid du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ba stobs pa nyid du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should attend to the offering of delight.

original: tshang mang bltas te brjod pa na dngos po gang la gnas dga' zhing 'dod pa ston par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: tshang mang bltas te brjod pa na dngos po gang la gnas dga' zhing 'dod pa ston par byed pa de ni /
translated: When the kitchen is observed and the one who is delighted and desirous of a thing is indicated,

original: dga' ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ste /
translated: that is delight.

original: dga' ba de bstabs pa nyid du yid la bya ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ba de bstabs pa nyid du yid la bya ba ni /
translated: One should attend to the offering of that delight.

original: bdag gis de zas kyi dus su bstabs par bya'o zhes yid la bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis de zas kyi dus su bstabs par bya'o zhes yid la bya ba'o //
translated: One should attend to it with the thought: “I will offer that to him at the time of eating.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the purport.

original: gnas bza' ba dang btung ba'i dngos po 'ba' zhig la dga' ba ston par byed na de'i tshe gnas pas 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas bza' ba dang btung ba'i dngos po 'ba' zhig la dga' ba ston par byed na de'i tshe gnas pas 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: When the one who is delighted shows delight in the thing that is the basis, namely, food and drink, then the one who is delighted should arouse the following thought:

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa de dag 'di la bstabs par bya'o snyam du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽lhung bzed bkru bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa de dag 'di la bstabs par bya'o snyam du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // lhung bzed bkru bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “I will offer that food and drink, etc. to him.” This is what is meant by “one should attend to it.”🔽One should wash the alms-bowl.

original: gnas kyi lhung bzed gnas pas bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi lhung bzed gnas pas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: The one who is delighted should wash the alms-bowl of the one who is delighted.

original: gal te bsod snyoms pa zhig na gsil byed kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni / gal te gnas bsod snyoms pa zhig yin na de'i tshe gsil byed kyang byi dor bya ste /
analyzed: gal te bsod snyoms pa zhig na gsil byed kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni / gal te gnas bsod snyoms pa zhig yin na de'i tshe gsil byed kyang byi dor bya ste /
translated: If he is a refuse-rag wearer, he should also clean his bowl.

original: sgra si li li byed pas gsil byed de /
analyzed: sgra si li li byed pas gsil byed de /
translated: If he is a refuse-rag wearer, he should also clean his bowl.

original: khar gsil gyi ming cig shos yin no //🔽gal te dgos pa yod na chu tshags kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khar gsil gyi ming cig shos yin no // gal te dgos pa yod na chu tshags kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bowl is called a “bowl” because it is a vessel for food.🔽If he has a need for it, he should also clean his water strainer.

original: gal te der chu tshangs dgos pa yod na de'i tshe de yang byi dor bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te der chu tshangs dgos pa yod na de'i tshe de yang byi dor bya ba'o //
translated: If he has a need for it, he should also clean his water strainer.

original: de'i dgos pa ni 'di yin par shes par bya ste /🔽gal te gnas skyed mos tshal la sogs par zan za bar byed @65a * //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa ni 'di yin par shes par bya ste / gal te gnas skyed mos tshal la sogs par zan za bar byed @65a * //
translated: The need for it should be understood as follows.

original: na der chu btsag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: na der chu btsag par bya ba'o //
translated: If he eats his meal in a park or the like, he should filter the water there.

original: gal te de yang yin na zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de yang yin na zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he has a need for it, he should also clean his water strainer.🔽If he is a refuse-rag wearer, he should also clean his bowl.

original: gal te gnas pa de yang bsod snyoms pa yin na de'i gnas pas gnas la zhu bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa de yang bsod snyoms pa yin na de'i gnas pas gnas la zhu bar bya ste /
translated: If he is a refuse-rag wearer, he should also clean his bowl.🔽The bowl is called a “bowl” because it is a vessel for food.

original: ci lags thabs cig tu bsod snyoms la 'jug par bgyi 'am 'on te so sor zhes de skad zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci lags thabs cig tu bsod snyoms la 'jug par bgyi 'am 'on te so sor zhes de skad zhu bar bya'o //
translated: One should ask, Should we enter for alms together or separately?

original: gal te bzod cing 'dod na de nyid dang lhan cig tu 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te bzod cing 'dod na de nyid dang lhan cig tu 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he is willing and agreeable, one should say, Let us enter together.

original: gal te bsod snyoms la 'jug pa la gnas gnas pa dang lhan cig 'jug par bzod cing 'grogs par 'dod na de'i tshe gnas de nyid dang lhan cig 'jug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bsod snyoms la 'jug pa la gnas gnas pa dang lhan cig 'jug par bzod cing 'grogs par 'dod na de'i tshe gnas de nyid dang lhan cig 'jug par bya ba'o //
translated: If the resident monk is willing and agreeable to enter for alms together with the visiting monk, then at that time, one should enter together with that resident monk.

original: lhan cig 'jug pa na gnas pas gang bsgrub par bya ba de ston te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'jug pa na gnas pas gang bsgrub par bya ba de ston te /
translated: When entering together, the resident monk shows what is to be done, saying, Let us enter.

original: nyam nga ba la sogs par mdun du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyam nga ba la sogs par mdun du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should go in front when there is danger, etc.

original: glang po che la sogs pa dang phrad pa'am /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa dang phrad pa'am /
translated: When there is danger from elephants, etc., or

original: g-yang sa dang 'dam rdzab la sogs pa dang nye bar gyur pa na gnas pa mdun du 'gro bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yang sa dang 'dam rdzab la sogs pa dang nye bar gyur pa na gnas pa mdun du 'gro bar bya ba'o //
translated: when there is a precipice, a swamp, etc., the resident monk should go in front.

original: bsod pa de la bdar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod pa de la bdar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should share the alms obtained.

original: gal te gnas pas bsod snyoms bsod pa bzang po zhig rnyed na /
analyzed: gal te gnas pas bsod snyoms bsod pa bzang po zhig rnyed na /
translated: If he finds good almsfood in a place,

original: 'di la phul cig ces gnas de la bdar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la phul cig ces gnas de la bdar bar bya'o //
translated: he should praise that place, saying, “Give it to me!”

original: gal te ma 'grogs na 'ongs nas bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te ma 'grogs na 'ongs nas bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not go there, he should come back and show him the place.

original: gal te gnas dang gnas pa gnyis ma 'grogs par bsod snyoms la zhugs na de'i tshe gnas pas bsod snyoms las phyir 'ongs nas gnas bsod snyoms bstan par bya'o ;
analyzed: gal te gnas dang gnas pa gnyis ma 'grogs par bsod snyoms la zhugs na de'i tshe gnas pas bsod snyoms las phyir 'ongs nas gnas bsod snyoms bstan par bya'o ;
translated: If the place and the person who lives there are not in accord, and the person who lives there goes out for alms, then when he returns from the almsround, he should show the place to the person who lives there.

original: / ches mchog tu gyur pa dbul bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / ches mchog tu gyur pa dbul bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should offer the best of what he has received.

original: gnas pas bza' ba dang bca' ba ches mchog tu gyur pa bzang po gnas la 'di bzhes shig ces dbul zhing bstabs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pas bza' ba dang bca' ba ches mchog tu gyur pa bzang po gnas la 'di bzhes shig ces dbul zhing bstabs par bya ba'o //
translated: The person who lives there should offer the best of what he has received, saying, “Please take this!”🔽He should know the right amount for all of them.

original: des thams cad la tshod rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / gnas des bsod pa bstabs pa 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des thams cad la tshod rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / gnas des bsod pa bstabs pa 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi /
translated: He should not only offer the best of what he has received,

original: thams cad la tshod rig par bya zhing /
analyzed: thams cad la tshod rig par bya zhing /
translated: but he should know the right amount for all of them.

original: tshod rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshod rig par bya ste /
translated: He should know the right amount.

original: gang gis gnas pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ba de ltar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis gnas pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ba de ltar bya ba'o //
translated: One should do it in such a way that it does not harm the one who is staying there.

original: chu snod dgang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chu snod dgang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The water-vessels should be filled.

original: chu snod ril ba spyi blugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chu snod ril ba spyi blugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The water-vessels are the water-pots, the water-bowls, and so on.

original: de dag dgang ba na chu snod dgad bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dgang ba na chu snod dgad bar bya ba'o //
translated: When they are filled, the water-vessels are filled.

original: dus brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The time should be announced.

original: gdugs tshong bab bo zhes zas kyi dus brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gdugs tshong bab bo zhes zas kyi dus brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The time for eating should be announced, saying, “It is time for the meal.”

original: zan zos nas lhung bzed la sogs pa bkru bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zan zos nas lhung bzed la sogs pa bkru bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: After eating, the alms-bowl and so on should be washed.

original: gnas kyis zan zos nas gnas pas lhung bzed la sogs pa bkru bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas kyis zan zos nas gnas pas lhung bzed la sogs pa bkru bar bya ba'o //
translated: After the one who is staying has eaten, the one who is staying should wash the alms-bowl and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The word “and so on”

original: lhung bzod chung du la sogs pa dag @65b bsdu'o //
analyzed: lhung bzod chung du la sogs pa dag @65b bsdu'o //
translated: includes the small alms-bowl and so on.

original: de dag gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should be put away.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa bkrus pa de dag rang rang gi gnas su gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa bkrus pa de dag rang rang gi gnas su gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: The washed alms-bowl and so on should be put in their own places.

original: mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba na 'dag rdzas dang chu la sogs pa dbul lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba na 'dag rdzas dang chu la sogs pa dbul lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When one is paying respect to a stūpa, one should offer such things as water for the feet.

original: gnas mchod rten gyi byi dor byed pa na /
analyzed: gnas mchod rten gyi byi dor byed pa na /
translated: When the shrine is being cleaned,

original: gnas pas bdag rdzas dang chu lar sogs pa dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pas bdag rdzas dang chu lar sogs pa dbul bar bya ste /
translated: the resident monk should offer the cleaning materials, water, etc.

original: 'dag rdzas dang chu dang phyag ma la sogs pa dag dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dag rdzas dang chu dang phyag ma la sogs pa dag dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
